loans.name: I

texts.en:
I R. is 52 years old. She has been growing rice since 1986. She is widowed with nine children, two of whom are married.

With a large family, I R. works hard everyday to care for her children. Three of her sons help to earn income to support the family. One son runs a motorcycle repair business near his house. His business is growing, and I R. needs a loan to purchase more materials for his repair service and to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to repair motocycles and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso tiene 38 años esta casado con la señora Maria de G., tienen tres hijos menores, vive en casa propia y hace 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Con su trabajo logro progresar mucho ya que tiene una hermosa casa, una camioneta y una moto. Gracias a su trabajo hoy día da empleo a 5 personas quienes le ayudan en la venta y cobranza de sus más de 600  tarjetas de clientes.
Su idea es seguir creciendo para que sus hijos logren una educación superior.
texts.en:
Señor Alfonso is 38 years old. He is married to Maria de G.. They have three young children and live in their own home. They have been dedicated to this activity for 10 years. With his work he has progressed a lot and now has a beautiful house, a small truck and a motorcycle. Thanks to his work he now employs 5 people who help him with sales and the collection of their more than 600 client accounts. He wants to continue growing so that their children can have a higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sheets, towels, comforters, bedspreads, curtains, jeans, t-shirts, household utensils and other things.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: En su casa alquilada, Ayde de 19 años, compra toda la chatarra que puede para luego venderla, es soltera así que trabaja sola. Rodeada de artefactos viejos, los cuales espera vender, Ayde comienza su día en la “cachina” (mercado de cosas usadas), ofrece diversos artículos a las personas que pasan, pero disfruta más cuando logra venderlas y es que su alegría hace que sea una de las mejores vendedoras de la cachina. Ayde sufre mucho trasladando la pesada chatarra hasta su negocio, pero aun así, ya lleva un año sacrificándose para mejorar su futuro. Como Ayde pudo pagar con mucha facilidad su primer préstamo con MFP, decidió solicitar este segundo crédito que sabe también pagara a tiempo. Con la cantidad requerida comprará más chatarra, para tener más cosas que ofrecer a la gente que compra en la cachina.
texts.en:
From her rented house, Ayde, 19 years old, buys all the scraps she can to later sell. She is single, and therefore works on her own. Surrounded by old artifacts which she hopes to sell, Ayde starts her day at the “cachina” (used goods market) offering her various items to passersby. She enjoys it the most when she manages to sell something, and her happiness makes her one of the best salespeople at the cachina. Ayde suffers a great deal transporting her second-hand wares to her place of business and, despite this hardship, she has spent a year so far sacrificing to improve her future. Since Ayde was easily able to repay her first loan with MFP, she decided to request this second loan that she knows she will also pay back on time. With the amount she is requesting, she will buy more used goods to have more to offer the people who come to buy at the cachina.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi K. est une jeune femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse depuis 5 ans de sodabi (une liqueur locale) et des produits divers. Elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise en payant plus de marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi K. is a young woman, 42 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. For the last 5 years, she has been a reseller of a local liquor called sodabi along with various other products. She is hoping with this loan to increase her business by purchasing additional supplies for resale.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.en:
Amriddin is married and has 5 children. Due to the lack of jobs in his town, Dushanbe, Tajikistan, to provide for his family Amriddin started his own business selling sewing machines and supplies (needle, thread, and other small items) about 14 years ago. He has become well-known in his town, and his sales have increased. To continue growing his business, Amriddin is requesting a loan in the amount of $1300 to purchase more merchandise to offer customers greater variety and quality of products and to provide better customer service. He commits to repaying this loan within 12 months. Be part of this business and support Amriddin. He and his family thank you very much!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; its role in ending Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous cultural figures, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, modern Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war that began soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged Tajikistan's already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition to potential lenders. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine and supplies for it.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere, 41 years old and married with four children, has a poultry farm where she raises birds to sell. In this business for a long time, she is now requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Teu

texts.en: Teu F., 28, is married with three children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Teu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy equipment and chemicals for her business, as well as home improvements.

loans.use: Purchase garden spray, bush knife, and chemicals

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza
Vilma es casada, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Vilma y hermanos integran una asociación propietaria de un Colegio llamado Raúl P. en el que se imparte el nivel primario, secundario y el no escolarizado, Vilma es la directora administrativa del Colegio. Vilma tiene proyectado tener un colegio de su propiedad.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos y uniformes.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener un colegio de su propiedad y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the collective Banco Comunal Alianza. She is 40 years old, married, and has one daughter. Vilma and her siblings run a school association called Raúl P., which teaches K-12 grades as well as non-graded studies. Vilma is the administrative director of the school. Vilma needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy sweatshirts and uniforms. Vilma's dreams include having her own school and building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts and uniforms.

loans.name: Elda Eile

texts.es:
ELDA EILY P. N., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” con domicilio en el Jr. LOS NARANJOS  N° 180 del distrito de MANANTAY, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo que aun esta estudiando.  Ssu esposo está haciendo servicio  militar en Lima.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, no cuenta con un local donde vender.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 año, con este dinero compró algunas prendas mas y afianzo su negocio. Su esposo la ayuda con el negocio, él es el que le envía mercadería desde Lima. 

Con este  préstamo  de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 docenas de zapatos, 3 paquetes de polos y pantalones.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que Manuela Ramos da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Elda Eily P. N. belongs to the Community Bank "Damas del Oriente" (Ladies of the Orient) located at Los Naranjos Number 180 of the district of Manantay. She is 30 years old and has a son that is still in school. Her husband is in military service in Lima. She makes a living selling clothing door to door, she does not have a space from which to sell. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, two years ago. She bought some more outfits and capitalized her business. Her husband helps her with the business by sending her merchandise from Lima. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will purchase 2 dozens pairs of shoes, 3 packages of shirts and pants. During the short time that she has been with Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy with the help that Manuela Ramos gives to the women in getting ahead, helping their husbands and children and economics of running a home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is a 45-year-old businesswoman who has operated a retail business for six years. She has three children who attend school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more retail items such as boxes of Safi drinks, packets of sweets, tomato sauce and cooking oil to expand her business. Thanks to her business, she obtained a beautiful house. Her dream is to educate her children abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more items to expand her retail business.

loans.name: Tulagatasi

texts.en: Tulagatasi A., 38, is married and has 7 children. She has experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and people of the village 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~ 90 USD). SPBD loans are Tulagatasi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack, sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, chainsaw.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora O. sells provisions. She is 50 years old and married with eight children. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en:
Lealofi L. (0) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has six adult children.

Lealofi owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 380 WST a month.

In 2008, Lealofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

Lealofi is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She has a bore hole for commercial purpose and also rent out cooking utensils for ceremonies. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase a generator for power supply. This will alternate for electricity for the pumping machine. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Romao Luis

texts.pt:
Romão Luis B. nasceu na provincial de inahmbane no distrito de Zavala, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidos entre 16 e 22 anos dois dos quais freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado para começar a trabalhar ainda muito cedo devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vivem com a esposa, filhos e enteada na casa própria no distrito de boane. 

Mudou se de inhambane para maputo em casa dos tios no ano de 1981, sozinho, com intuito de encontrar melhores condições de vida. Logo conseguiu emprego e casou se no ano de 1992. Neste momento é funcionário do estado desempenhando as funções de dactilografo há mais de 23 anos. Recebe mensalmente 2.895,00MT, como salário. Aplica no sustento da família, construção da casa e pagamento de credito.

A esposa faz trabalhos caseiros. Este é o terceiro empréstimo do Romão com a instituição no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, barrotes e outros materiais) de uma casa de alvenaria.
Os primeiros créditos foram para o mesmo propósito nos valores de 3.000,00MT e 6.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Nunca tinha recebido credito em outros bancos e propõe se a pagar o presente empréstimo, tal como os outros passados, sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos. Sonha ver a casa finalizada.
texts.en:
Romão Luis B. was born in Inahmbane in the district of Zavale. He is 45 years old, married and a father of three children between the ages 16 and 22, two of them students. He finished 7th grade but had to drop school to start working and help his parents. He lives with his wife, children and stepdaughter at their house in the district of Boane. He left Inhambane for Maputo in 1981 and lived with his uncle and aunt, trying to find better life conditions. Soon after that he got a job and got married in 1992. He's been working as a typist for over 23 years, and makes 2.895,00 (about U$105) per month. With this money he supports his family, builds his house and pays loans. This is Romão's third loan, in the amount of $375, which he'll use to buy construction supplies. His first loans were for the same purpose, in the amounts of $110 and $220. He's committed to pay this loan like he's paid the ones in the past. He dreams of seeing his house finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 57 years old, widowed and has three grown children. Nena has owned and operated a retail shop, specializing in green bananas and daily essentials, for over 15 years. As her main source of income, the business generates approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to access their financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP. Nena is requesting 14000 PHP, as her fourth HSPFI loan, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kitoy

texts.en:
Kitoy C. is currently in the business of selling sweet, biscuits etc at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase plates and cups to sell.  

Kitoy is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a departmental stores.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase plates and cups to sell

loans.name: Purev

texts.en:
Purev D. is 56 years old and lives with her daughter and her daughter's family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house. D. also has a son, age 29, who lives on his own.

D. currently operates two separate businesses in the city. Her primary focus is her vegetable stand, which she operates at one of the largest markets in the city, but she also sells used raw materials such as copper, iron, and glass to supplement her income. Her son also helps support the family with his coal-trading business.

D. started her businesses in 1992 and made quick progress. However, in 1996, her husband passed away and she was left to raise her three children. At that time it was hard for her to continue her work, but she has since worked diligently to grow her businesses to their current successful positions.

D. is always looking for ways to expand her businesses and says, "In the near future I hope to buy a car to begin transporting raw materials and coal directly to my customers." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to help purchase a car to start transporting raw materials and coal.

loans.use: To help purchase a car to start transporting raw materials and coal

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 38, is married to Susan Wanjiru and they have four school-aged children.  He has been selling food products (potatoes and cereals like maize) in Naivasha town for the last two years.  

He learned about KADET through a KADET promotion that was held around his business area. This will be his first loan with the organization, and he plans to use the loan to add cereals to the food products he sells.

His immediate plan for the future is to save to buy a piece of land on which he can run his business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add cereals to sell at his shop

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin S. is 42 years old and married. She lives with her six children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1.00 each day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver making $3.00 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Yin S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $700.00 so that her husband can purchase a new trailer.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul E. M. is 36 years old and married, with two children. He has a retail business dealing in home products like soap, sugar, plates, and so forth. He is using the loan to purchase more items to sell. Since he supplies goods to shops in Masindi town and its suburbs, he wants to start selling the rare goods that his customers ask for, in trying to meet their needs.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, plates, and so forth.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is thirty years of age. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment. They live in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Richard is a trader. He runs a provision store by the roadside in the community. He procures his goods from Accra. Richard has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his store.

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en:
Lagomau  N. is 35 and married with 4 children (ages 5 months - 13 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  Lagomau  has 6 years of experience in this business.  Lagomau  needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 162 tala or US $68 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Lagomau  joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lagomau 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lagomau  N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.87 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.56 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Marsellar

texts.en: Marsellar is 48 years old, married and has nine children. Her husband is a pastor and they hope to expand her business and even open other restaurants. Her business is located within Kakamega town where she sells food and beverages to the local people. She has been in this business for five years and her major challenge has been competition. Previously she was a fishmonger and it is when doing this business that the idea of a restaurant was born. Her major challenge is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers but she is determined to be the best. She is using her loan to buy flour, maize, beans and sugar. In the future, she wants to buy her own plot. She describes herself as very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To buy flour, maize, beans and sugar

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 03 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 1 classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras e pela negligencia dos progenitores. Vive na casa propria com seus filhos e sustenta um irmao que vivem com ele.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo com a sua mae depois da separação e foram fixar residência em Boane. Actualmente vive neste Distrito e tem um negocio proprio a mais de 17 anos, trabalha das 7h as 21horas, vende mais cerveja e refrescos nao possui nenhum empregado. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique ( sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do amigo Sr. Antonio Mundlovu que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos( cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria no seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt  todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  a ampliação do seu estabelecimento comercial e oferecer melhor comodidade aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Fernando C. was born in the city of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is 37 years old, and a single father of two children who are 12 and 3 years old. The eldest attends school. Fernando only completed the first grade, and didn't continue due to lack of resources and the negligence of his parents. He lives with his children in his own home, and also supports a brother who lives with him. He left Maputo with his mother after she left his father, and they relocated their residence to Boane. He currently lives in this district and has owned his own shop for over 17 years. He works from 7 am until 9 pm, and mainly sells beer and soft drinks. He has no employees. He earns around 1000 MZN a day, and uses the money for household expenses and saves some through a Xitique (a traditional savings system). He's never taken out a loan with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through his friend Mr. Antonio Mundlovu who is also a client of the organization. This is his fourth loan, and is in the amount of 17000 MZN. He plans to use the money to purchase products (beer, wine, soft drinks and others) to increase the quality of the merchandise in his establishment. The earlier loans were for 8000 MZN, 12000 MZN and 15000 MZN, and were all used for the same purpose. In the future, he hopes to apply for additional loans to increase the size of his commercial establishment and provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Cossy

texts.en:
Cossy is a  single mother with four children. Three of her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with ten people. She also takes care of additional family members. The Family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Cossy works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a ladies’ salon in Katanga in Wandegeya. She incurs  transport costs to and from buying hair conditioners and hair relaxers from shops in Kampala city. She sells both retail and wholesale.

Cossy works seven days a week and receives an average of five customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of cosmetics and the rainy season which disturbs her work because she works from a muddy place. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

Cossy has been in this business for over five years. Cossy joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start a bridal salon. Cossy is pictured with a customer.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and hair conditioners

loans.name: Mrs. Men Saes Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan in Ta Ou Khang Cheung Village in Takeo Province goes to a group of ten people. Mrs. Men S. has been selected village bank president by all the group members, who will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Men S. owns a general store and her husband, Mr. Len Hou, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to support the family. Besides farming rice, he works as a cow middleman.  Since Mrs. Men S.'s business is going well, she wants to expand, but they do not have enough money. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for resale. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy a cart to use on the farm. She is the mother of two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Moises Edwin

texts.es: EL SR. MOISES ES UN CLIENTE NUEVO QUE FUE RECOMENDADO POR SU MAMA QUE ES CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, EL RADICO POR UN TIEMPO EN LA REPUBLICA ARGENTINA Y TRABAJABA CON LO QUE ES CONFECCION DE ROPA, AHORA QUE VOLVIO A SU PAIS EL QUIERE EMPEZAR SU PROPIA EMPRESA AQUÍ SOLAMENTE CUENTA CON UNA MAQUINA EN LA QUE CONFECCIONA CHALECHOS EN TELA POLAR, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA OJALADORA ES UNA MAQUINA PARA HACER OJALES PARA PONER BOTONES A LA ROPA Y REALIZARA DIFERENTES TIPOS DE PRENDAS, EL TIENE LA INTENCION DE TENER DE AQUI A UNOS 2 AÑOS UNA EMPRESA RELATIVAMENTE GRANDE Y CON MUY BUENA CALIDAD DE PRODUCTOS, EL TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE TRABAJAR Y TRIUNFAR AQUI EN SU PAIS NATAL, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERARSE PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Moses is a new client who was recommended by his mother, who is a client of our institution. He lived in Argentina for a while and worked making clothing. Now that he has returned to the country he wants to start his own business but only has a sewing machine that he uses to make thermal vests. He will use the funds to buy a button-hole machine so that he can attach buttons to the items and make different kinds of clothes. His goal is to have a fairly large, well-known factory in two years making high quality goods. He wants to work hard and succeed here in his native country. He is hard-working and has much desire to succeed thereby improving his family’s quality of life. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a button-hole making machine.

loans.name: Abdou Fatawou

texts.fr:
En 2008, ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente de produits d’alimentation générale qu’il a appelé « ETS BAS PRIX », il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, 3 personnes de sa famille l’aident dans la gestion de son commerce. En ce moment, son stock est en baisse, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour l’achat d’huile, de tomates en bois, de lait concentré et divers autres produits d’alimentation générale pour renforcer son stock.
Etant célibataire il subvient à ses besoins grâce aux revenus de son commerce.
texts.en:
In 2008, this gentleman opened his own shop selling general food products. He called his store “ETS BAS PRIX” [Est. Low Prices]. He gets his supplies from the grand market in Lomé. Three members of his family help him to manage his business. At this time his stock is diminishing. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase oil, canned tomatoes, condensed milk and various other general food products to replenish his stock. Being single, he provides for his needs thanks to the income from his business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products.

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle sells electronics retail prices. She hopes to own an electronic company in the future. She hopes to make her business more sustainable. She is 40 years old, married with 4 children. She is requesting for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to   sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 72 años, tiene 6 hijos mayores y vive junto a su esposo en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a  la venta D. artefactos electrodomésticos D. medio uso, en un mercado informal ubicado cerca D. su casa. Se dedica a esta labor desD. las 9 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche, durante  todos los días. En las ventas le va muy bien, y ya lleva 15 años en este negocio,  inicialmente  vendía al crédito, pero no obtenía ganancias, y en la actualidad sus ventas son solo  al contado, y D. esta manera obtiene mejores ganancias. Está muy contenta con su negocio,  porque le genera buenas utilidades y lo que más le llama la atención  D. su oficio, es que tiene amistades y conocidos con los que conversa mucho, y D. esta manera se entretiene. En adelante tiene planeado  alquilar un puesto en el  mercado y así desea evitarse riesgos constantes durante el  traslado D. su mercadería.Este es su crédito número  treinta y dos con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso D. seguir pagando puntualmente, además es una socia responsable y preocupada por el desarrollo D. su grupo comunal.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  más artefactos D. cocina, para ofrecer lo mejor en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 72 years old, has six grown children and she lives together with her husband in a house that is their own. She sells second-hand applicances at an informal market located near her house. She is dedicated to this work from nine in the morning until seven at night, every day. In sales she does very well and has fifteen years with this business, initially she sold on credit but didn't make a profit and now her sales are only in cash and because of this she makes a better profit. Rosa is very happy with her business, because it generates good profits and what calls attention to her business is that she has friends and acquaintances who she talks with and is entertained by. From now on she plans to rent a stall in the market and she wishes to avoid the constant risk of transporting her merchandise. This is her thrity-second loan with MFP and she agrees to the commitment to continue making payments punctually. Rosa is a responsible businesswoman and is concerned with the development of her communal group. Rosa has plans to invest the money she is seeking in the purchase of more second-hand appliances to offer the best in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a quantity of appliances.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernardita E. is a married woman who supports her family by selling herbal products. She lives in Canaway, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 9 children, who are between 13 and 34 years of age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her herbal products business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Bernardita is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she can have additional working capital for her business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bernardita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Elise Patricia Anique

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 46ans, vendeuse du poisson salé en détail depuis 8ans,mariée,mère de 5 enfants dont 3 vont à l'école.
Avant de vendre le poisson salé, elle vendait des friandises devant une école de son quartier et après elle s'est lancée dans le poisson salé.
Elle a sur son étalage differentes sortes de poissons salé: poisson sole, poisson thon, poisson morue, elle choisie les meilleurs pour équilibrer le prix et la qualité.
L'actuel prêt lui permettra d'agrandir son stock de marchandises, comme ses amies le font, elle veut aussi faire le séchage traditionnel avec du poisson vendu sur place pour agrandir son commerce.
pour ses  enfants, elle veut leurs assurer une bonne éducation et leurs construire une belle maison avec l' aide de son époux.ses proche la qualifie de femme sérieuse.
texts.en:
This woman is 46 years old and has sold salted fish at retail for 8 years. She is married and has 5 children, of whom 3 go to school. Before selling salted fish, she used to sell sweets in front of a school in her area. Afterward, she began selling salted fish. In her display of goods, she keeps different types of salted fish: sole, tuna, and cod, and she selects the best options to balance price and quality. This current loan will allow her to enlarge her stock of merchandise, as her friends have done, and she also wants to dry fish in the traditional way on the spot to enlarge her business. She wants to ensure a proper education for her children and build a nice house with the help of her husband. Her friends and family describe her as a serious woman.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of salted fish

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 5 est composé  de femmes mariées du village de SESSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne  34 ans,  6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Elles sont à leur  premier prêt de campagne.
DJENEBA T., la présidente du groupe,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TENE, MOPTI et dans les marchés environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15000 à 38.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 5 consists of married women from the village of Sesso in the prefecture of San, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional families. On average, each is 34 and has six children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso this year, and are receiving their first operational loan. Djeneba T., the group's president, plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Tene Mopti and in nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of between 15,000 and 38,000 CFA after their produce is sold. They will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 26 years old and married. He has a 2-year old child. He has been selling bananas for eight years. He was previously employed and decided to do this business because his income was not enough to support the family.  

He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya. He has managed to service two loans from Faulu Kenya. Therefore, he has seen his business improve tremendously. He needs to buy more bananas for resale. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. He hopes to sell his bananas on a wholesale basis in the future. In five years, he wants to open other outlets.

loans.use: To add stock of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Dino

texts.en:
Dino B. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. He is 26 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he raises pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $100 when he sells his raised animals.

In 2010, Dino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah B. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.
Hadjah has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Hadjah sells her fruits and vegetables in Owino market on a retail basis. She also generates additional income through selling Irish potatoes. Hadjah has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, oranges, pineapples and cabbages.
The main business challenge for Hadjah is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow larger and to start selling wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables such as oranges, cabbages, tomatoes and mangoes

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is the resident of Borewala, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its shrines. She got married to M. R., who operates a small restaurant in the market where he offers different kinds of Punjabi foods and tea to his clients. 

Parveen, herself, is a housewife but she also helps her husband in his business by cooking foods for his restaurant. He sells Daal chawal (a dish made of lentils and rice and served with pickle) and Naan chanay (a dish made of chick peas serves with bread) to his customers. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy food items such as chick-peas, lentils, rice, spices and cooking oil for his restaurant business. By buying the items in bulk, he will be able to make good and tasty food for his customers and to increase his sales as well. Parveen is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes for her husband’s business and make his income double in size. 

Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Parveen”.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk quantity for restaurant business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: afi est une jeune fille célibataire. a la fin de son apprentissage, n'ayant pas les moyens d'ouvrir un salon de coiffure. elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans cette activité. sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. elle veut augmenter son stock pour pouvoir répondre aux besoisn de fin d'année de sa clientèle. elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 50 mèches, 50 tissages, et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: Afi A. is a young unmarried woman. At the end of her apprenticeship, she could not afford to open a hair salon. She started in the business of cosmetic  sales. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Her clientele is predominantly female. She wants to increase her stock to meet the year-end needs of her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy 50 hair extensions, 50 hair weaves, and various cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Florah

texts.en: Florah M. is a married lady with two children, ages six and two and one-half years old. Her business is located at Shinyalu market in Kakamega. Kakamega is a region in Kenya widely known as the "sugar belt" for its production of sugar cane. Florah has a shop in which she sells general items to the local people. In addition to this business, Florah also has a motorcycle that she uses to provide transportation services. She has been in this business for the past three years. She says that her business is profitable and that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to stock general items in her store in order to meet her customers' needs and grow her business. She will also use part of the money to repair her motorcycle. She hopes to grow her business and move to another location that will enable her to attract more customers. She also hopes to give her children a quality education up to the university level. She describes herself as polite, honest, and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for general store and motorcycle parts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and rent bills.

She has operated a salon and cosmetic shop for over seven years, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments from creditors who purchase goods on credit. Mercy hopes to establish another business of selling clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase body lotions, hair conditioner, hair weaves, and shampoo. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for hair salon business

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita G. is 57 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Coastal Place of Jala-jala, Rizal, Philippines. She and her husband work hard to offer their family a better life.  They decided to join ASHI in 2000 to acquire capital for their business, which is fishing. They have requested a new loan of  20,000 PHP, which they will use to buy more fishnet, rope, bamboo, and fingerlings (small fish). Morita hopes to build a beautiful house, expand her fishing business, and have more space for their fishing equipment. 

The family feels very happy with the loan because it improved their lives. Morita wishes all lenders all the best and good luck and will continue to support ASHI, which helps poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fishnet, rope, bamboo, and fingerlings

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent has been in the farming business for the last four years and employs two farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces tea, which he sells to a local tea factory, and maize, which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to provide the needs of his family. Innocent is 52 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This dairy cow will enable his family to get enough milk for home consumption and for sale. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a matatu (minibus) and venture into the transportation business. He faces the challenge of drought and diseases which affect his farm production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
la señora Lux Estela L. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, vive en casa de la mama con sus hermanos,  vive en la colonoia Fraternidad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia,  atiende a los vecinos de la comunidad, vende lacteos, reftrescos de botella, jugos de lata y caja, huevos, harina, manteca, aceite y todo para el hogar ademas vende cosmeticos y ropa de niño.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio, quiere tener su negocio bien surtido para la epoca de navidad y asi poder tener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Lux Estela L. is 44 years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter.  She lives in her mom's house with her siblings.  She lives in the Fraternidad neighborhood and has a small grocery store where she sells staple food products.  She serves her neighbors, selling dairy produts, bottled soft drinks, canned and boxed juice, eggs, flour, butter, oil and everything for the home.  She also sells cosmetics and children's clothes. 
 
She will use this loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.  She would like to have a well-stocked business for the Christmas season so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: To buy pork, beef, chicken, eggs, beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, soft drinks, bread, cookies, soap, toilet paper, salt, soup and pasta

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Pierre and his beauty salon business in Kigali, Rwanda! Jean Pierre is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 13 and two adopted orphans. Jean Pierre, who has been in the credit association since 2004, has a salon business in Kigali which attracts many working-class clients. He employs two people in his salon. He also works in the African Library.

Jean Pierre has requested a loan to buy two helmet hair dryers for his salon, which will be enable him to attract more customers and earn more profit. With this profit, Jean Pierre will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy two helmet hair dryers for his salon

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a very good wife and mother. She manages her responsibilities very well. She is 57 years old, but still very active. She has a marriage bureau and helps people find their life partners.  She is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area of Razabad with her family in a 3-room brick house. 

She is a widow and lives with her three sons who are young men and do different kind of work. Her eldest son has a tea stall, the 2nd one sells sweetmeats, and the youngest one weaves carpets. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who wants to improve his tea business. With the loan, he will buy sugar, milk, and tea in bulk quantity for his tea stall business. 

He has been operating this business for the past 3 years and became well-known among his customers for the good taste of his tea. Nazeeran is hopeful that an investment will bring his business to more profitable position and earn him better profit. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her and she will be able to marry off her eldest son soon with the increased loan profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazeeran.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk and tea for tea stall

loans.name: Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Saidati is 26 years old, married with two children. Saidati is the president of a group called 'Twegerane'. She is wearing the red shirt in her group.  This group owns a restaurant where they sell food in order to earn their daily living. This group has been in this business for about 3 years and the hours of the business are from 5am until 10pm every day.

Saidati and her group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this group will purchase equipment and increase the quantity of food which in turn will increase profits. With these profits, the members of this group will pay school fees for their children and continue taking care of their families. In addition, they will keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: Additional equipment and food for the restaurant

loans.name: Ave Fenix Group

texts.es:
Margarita forma parte del Banco comunal “Ave Fénix” conformado por 18 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de zapatería, peluquería y venta de artículos para regalos, yerbas medicinales, repuestos de bicicletas, vestuario, condimentos, huevos, frutas y verduras. Pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Margarita quien en la foto aparece sentada en la segunda fila, con un calendario blanco en sus manos, se dedica a la venta de condimentos, frutos secos, miel y legumbres. Desde hace 8 meses en un local establecido de la vega (mercado), llamado “Frutos del País”.
Margarita compra su mercadería al por mayor, en el mercado y la  miel a un proveedor del producto.
El terreno donde se encuentra su local es provisorio, por lo tanto está postulando a un proyecto en el cual  podrá optar a un terreno propio.
Con este préstamo comprará miel al por mayor.
El sueño de Margarita es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales. Y respecto a su negocio que éste siga prosperando.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con este negocio son los ingresos generados por éste, los que le permiten brindarles a sus 6 hijos un mejor bienestar y una mejor calidad en la educación. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, sobre todo por la buena convivencia y confianza experimentada en el grupo. 
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Margarita is part of the Communal Bank “Ave Fénix” (Phoenix) which consists of eighteen entrepreneurs. They engage in businesses such as manufacturing shoes, managing hair salons, selling gifts, herbal medicines, bicycle parts, clothes, spices, eggs, fruits, and vegetables. The members live in the city of Concepción.

In the photo, Margarita is seated in the second row holding up a white calendar. She sells condiments, dried fruit, honey, and legumes. For the past eight months, she has had a shop established in the market called “Frutos del País” (Fruits of the Country). Margarita buys her goods at the market wholesale and acquires honey from a distributor. The location of her shop is temporary, so she has already started looking for her own piece of land. With this loan, she will purchase honey in bulk.

Margarita dreams of seeing her children continue their studies and become professionals. She also hopes to keep prospering in her business. Her reason for continuing her business is the income it generates, which enables her to provide for the welfare of her six children and give them a better quality education. She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza. Margarita enjoys participating in meetings, especially for the camaraderie and enthusiasm she experiences as part of the group. Regarding the financing she has received from Fondo Esperanza, the loans have been a great help to her business.

The city of Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile in Bíobío region. This city played an important role in Chilean history since it was the home to major battles, such as the War of Arauco, and a historical settlement since it borders the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development. It is considered to be one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: Purchase honey

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V., a 43 year old married woman with three school-aged children, is from the city of Dipolog where she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of products to the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKU LIGUEY est créé depuis le 04 décembre 2007; date d'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Leurs activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine ou bovine. 

Madame YAYA D. (debout derrière à droite et mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle fait de l'embouche comme activité principale depuis 03 ans. Elle achète les moutons les engraisse pendant au moins quatre mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires ou pendant les grandes fêtes religieuses. Parallèlement elle fait un petit commerce d'encens, de pâte d'arachide, de thioubs et de chaussures. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer ses activités d'embouche et de petit commerce

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité d'une de ses filles de 17 ans, de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de contribuer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille
texts.en: The solidarity group Taku Liguey was created on December 4, 2007, on the inaugural date of the Santhiaba Sud Banc Villageois, which hosts it.  It is made up of 14 women who come from the same neighborhood.  Their businesses include running small shops and fattening sheep and cows.  Ms. Yaya D. (standing in the back, to the right, in the inset) is the leader of the group.  She is 55 years old.  She is married and the mother of 5 children.  She also cares for her granddaughter.  She has run her main business fattening animals for 3 years.  She buys the sheep and fattens them for at least four months before she re-sells them at the weekly markets or during big religious festivals.  At the same time, she runs a small business selling incense, peanut butter, dyed cotton cloths, and shoes.  This new loan will allow her to finance her fattening business and her shop.  Her objective is to ensure the education of her one 17-year-old daughter, to strengthen her level of savings, and to contribute to taking care of the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep, incense, peanut butter, dyed cotton cloths, and shoes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy D. is from the village of Nampicuan. She is 38 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a gasoline station in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Joy is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional gasoline to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline to sell

loans.name: Unur

texts.en:
Unur, who is 38 years old, resides with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house in the outer ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts. Unur supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, while her husband supports the family by planting cucumbers in his yard.

When Unur started her business in 2000, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian (MNT) in working capital. Today, her business has grown so that she now has 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. For the past 11 years, Unur has been selling jean trousers from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and the profits have helped sustain the family and improve their living conditions. For example, she and her husband were able to buy their own yard upon which they built their small house with their business earnings in 2010. Unur is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more jean trousers.

Unur wants to expand her stall with this loan and then be able to build their own small pickled cucumber enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more jean trousers.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chin H. is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Sat Seit, age 32. They both are rice growers in Kompong Cham province. The couple lives with their four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  Presently, Chin H. wants to plant a potato crop, but she doesn’t have immediate money to do tH. yet. For this reason, Chin H. has decided to seek a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, potato crop, and insecticide, which she will use to protect her crop. She will also pay for the cost of plowing, which she hired out earlier.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, potato crop, and insecticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, tiene casa propia, donde vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad, tiene 9 años de vender meriendas, también administra una tienda, este negocio le ayuda para solventar algunas necesidades en su hogar.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda y productos para hacer las meriendas como: bebidas, galletas, embutidos, carnes, aceite, lácteos y condimentos.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, ampliarlo y tener una mejor capacidad para atender las exigencias de los clientes.
texts.en:
Brenda owns her house where she lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She’s been selling lunches for 9 years and also runs a store.  This business helps her meet some of her household expenses.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise for the store and ingredients for her lunches like:  beverages, cookies, cured meats, meats, oil, dairy products and condiments.

Her goal is to improve the business, enlarge it and have a better capacity to tend to customer demands.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cookies, cured meats, meats, oil, dairy products and condiments.

loans.name: Euro Lenin

texts.es:
Euro Lenin tiene 75 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa y con los tres hijos de 29, 31 y 33 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Lenin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y en pocas cantidades siembra tomate de árbol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y de tomate, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y tener mas ingresos.

Lo que le gustaría es que la tradición no se pierda los hijos sigan trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Euro Lenin is 75 years old.  He’s married and lives with his wife and three children, who are 29, 31 and 33 years old, in San Pablo Parish which belongs to San Miguel Canton.

The “Unión y Esperanza” (Unity and Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office.  The members of this communal bank farm corn and potatoes and are merchants of vegetables and others.

Lenin is a farmer.  He’s a corn farmer and also grows tree tomatoes (a small tree or shrub in the flowering plant family Solanaceae. It is best known as the species that bears the tamarillo, an egg-shaped edible fruit.)  in small amounts.  He’s been in this line of work for a long time.  He does his purchases in San Miguel and sells his products at the farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

He requests the loan to buy corn and tomato seeds.  The loan has helped him increase income and crop yields.  He has faced challenges like the lack of laborers and weather variations which have sometimes damaged the crops.  His dream is to continue to work and earn higher income.  He would like it if the tradition weren’t lost and his children continued working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy corn and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum, age 47, a domestic rice farmer, has been living in the Prey Chor district. In addition to farming, she sells mortars, which are made of hard stone as the photo shows. She is good at making mortars in a variety of sizes at her house. Sum’s husband also assists her in the same business, and they can earn a net income of US $6.25 a day on average to cover all the family expenses. 

She has two children who work in industry, generating around $4 each day, and they contribute their profit to Sum every month as well.  

Sum will use the loan for buying fertilizers and rice seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a poultry selling business, selling wholesale to restaurant operators and hotel owners. She faces a major a challenge of seasonality especially disease outbreak. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is showing some maize she uses to cook banku for sale.  She is married to a farmer and they live with their 5 children.  She cooks banku and serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce. This business has been in existence for six years. Her loan will be used to buy maize for banku and fish for cooking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house. At the time of the visit, she had not cooked for the day; and so is showing the maize she uses for the banku.

loans.use: to buy maize for banku, and fish for cooking.

loans.name: Midy

texts.en:
Midy, 32, is a farmer. He has been married since 2007 and has no children yet. He lives in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Midy is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to repair his tractor because it breaks down.

loans.use: To repair his tractor.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia is a 57 year-old widow.  She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  She lives with her only child.  Sulpicia sells Avon products in the local community and in neighboring communities.  She has done this for 2 years.  Every month, Sulpicia makes a total of PHP 6,000. 

Sulpicia wants to expand the business and joined GDMPC earlier this year for that purpose. The loan amount applied for and approved by the cooperative is worth PHP 5,000. The money is intended to order additional cosmetic products from Avon to sell.  With anticipated profits, Sulpicia hopes to meet her business expansion plan and have more beauty products to offer.

loans.use: To order additional cosmetic products from Avon to sell.

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Mrs. Oung is 42 years old, married, and has five children who are living under her revenue. Currently she is in the business of pig fattening in the Baray District, Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. From this business, she can earn about $2 per day. Additional income is taken from her husband. Currently her husband sells firewood in front of his house. He would like to transport firewood to clients’ houses but a lack of money is why Oung and her husband would like to request funds from Kiva partner HKL. The purpose of the loan would be to purchase a tractor for developing his business over time and to satisfy his clients. Oung says that these funds are very important for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Dora Concepción

texts.es: Dora Concepción D. sesenta y un años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida  y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda muy visitada por las personas D. la zona, ya son muchos años D. experiencia en este negocio y la clientela siempre encuentra en su negocio lo que necesitan,  además sus productos son D. buena calidad y los venD. a precios accesibles; Dora Concepcion a pesar D. que es una mujer D. avanzada edad no se detiene por ninguna circunstancia siempre se encuentra muy activa y con ganas D. seguir trabajando, el secreto en su negocio es la perseverancia y el amor con que ella lo realiza; quiere ver crecer su pequeño negocio por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar producto para surtir la tienda como granos básicos, golosinas, pan, condimentos entre otros. Dora concepción tiene fe que con su esfuerzo en el trabajo lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Concepción, 61, lives with her life partner and children in her own house.  She has a store that’s very popular with local residents.  She has quite a few years’ experience with this business now and her customers always find what they need in her store.  Besides, her products are of good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  

Despite her advanced age, Concepción doesn’t stop for anything; she’s always busy with a desire to keep working.  The secret to her business is perseverance and the love she puts into it.  

She wants to see her small business grow and this is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy merchandise like basic grains, snacks, bread and condiments, among others to stock the store.  Concepción trusts that with her effort at work she will bring economic security and a better life to her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with seven children; three attend school while four have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to her neighburs and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase thirteen sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase thirteen sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Sonia Del Socorro tiene 60 años, su actividad es la venta de nacatamales desde hace 34 años que tiene este medio de vida. El objetivo de su crédito es para la compra de materia prima como hojas, masa, mecates, chile, especie entre otros productos. Sonia es una mujer muy emprendedora pues la lucha constante que realiza diariamente es muy significativa para sobrevivir con su familia. Ella sueña con agrandar su negocio y realizarle las mejoras pertinentes.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Socorro, 60, sells nacatamales (large Nicaraguan tamales).  She has had this work for 34 years.

The purpose of her loan is to buy ingredients such as leaves, dough, twine, chili peppers, and spices, among other products.

Sonia is a very enterprising woman, since the constant struggle she carries out daily is very meaningful in order to survive with her family.  She dreams about growing her business and making the appropriate improvements.

loans.use: to buy leaves, dough, twine, chile, and spices.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38, lives in the Philippines and is married with six children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a single woman raising two young children on her own. Both children are currently enrolled in school. Dzame operates a charcoal business and sells her goods retail. She's worked in this business for two years and was previously employed as a clothing saleswoman. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Dzame describes her greatest business challenges as transportation and seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Dzame will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase 10 bags of charcoal. Dzame aspires to continue expanding her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Более 26 лет Хабибулло занимается откормом скота и выращиванием сельхозкультур. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Его любящая жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Хабибулло выращивает пшеницу и  морковь. Иногда его дети помогает на переработки земли и посева семян. Хабибулло хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия и расширить свой бизнес. Он хочет приобрести скот и семена с целью расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 7000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Habibullo has been involved in fattening up livestock and growing agricultural crops for over 26 years.  He is a very hardworking and goal-oriented person.  Habibullo's loving wife helps him in this business.  He grows wheat and carrots.  Sometimes, his children helps him with plowing the land and sowing seeds.  Habibullo wants to improve his living conditions and expand his business.  He wants to buy livestock and seeds in order to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni for this purpose.  Habibullo is grateful to you for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds
