MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from Barangay Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Yolanda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs for breeding. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es: Mardonia, de 37 años, es una mujer joven y soltera, que se dedica integralmente a su trabajo, ella vive en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Chachunayo. A pesar de su edad, Mardonia no se amilana por no tener una familia a su lado y como mujer moderna, piensa progresar y salir adelante sin la ayuda de nadie; porqué sabe muy bien que el esfuerzo proviene de muchos sacrificios. Desde niña le enseñaron a cultivar los terrenos de cultivo, ahora ella posee un terreno propio, ahí siembra maíz y papá; los que después los vende en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero no solo a la agricultura se dedica, ella también puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su localidad, donde abastece de productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores. En adelante quiere expandirse y abrir una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad y vender sus productos al por mayor. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que su fin es de progresar y triunfar. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará abono y fertilizantes para su cosecha de la misma manera invertirá una parte para contratar operarios que le ayuden en el cuidado de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Mardonia is 37 years old and is a young, single woman who is dedicated to her work. She lives in her own house located in the town of Chachunayo. Despite her age, Mardonia is not daunted by not having family by her side and, like a modern woman, thinks about progressing and getting ahead without the help of anyone because she knows well that hard work comes from much sacrifice. Since she was a little girl, she was taught to cultivate farm land. Now she has her own land and there she sows maize and potato which she later sells in the central market in her area. However, she is not only dedicated to agriculture. She also has a small grocery store where she supplies basic necessities to townspeople. In the future, she wishes to expand and open a grocery store in the city and sell her products at wholesale. This is the ninth loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to her community bank since her goal is to progress and triumph. With this loan, she will obtain fertilizer for her harvest and at the same time invest some of the money in hiring workers to help her take care of her crops.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and hire workers to help her with her crops.

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.ru: Махмудова Зарбиби жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж работает на рынке поваром. Сама Зарбиби имеет среднее образование. Арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Zarbibi M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children.  Her husband works as a cook at a market.  Zarbibi has a secondary education.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells shoes.  She has been involved in this business for 8 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand the merchandise assortment.

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Kipkurui

texts.en:
Kipkurui is a farmer from the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. He has been farming for four years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces maize and tea which he sells locally. He also earns income from his bodaboda (motorcycle transport) business in the same area. His biggest challenge in farming has been diseases which affect his production.

Kikurui is 22 years old and single. He has requested this loan of 29,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his living standards. In the future, he would like to build a modern dairy unit for his cows.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa J., 53, lost her dear partner in life, but now lives for her one child, who is in college. Elsa and her child currently stay in Caloocan City, Philippines. With all heart and strength, Elsa strives to make sure she gives her child a good life.

Elsa manages a computer shop, which is up and growing a year after it was started. Elsa offers Internet access to people in her community, particularly to the young generation who use the Web for educational purposes as well as for entertainment. Adults also gain needed Internet access, thanks to Elsa's business, which earns PHP 400 on an average day.

Elsa plans to add one more computer to her store in order to accommodate more customers, so she would like to apply  to CCT* for a PHP 18000 loan. Her ultimate goal for her business is to increase the number of her computers and expand the business.

At present, Elsa battles the lack of sleep brought by having to supervise the computer shop from early morning to late at night. But if her goal of attaining a happy, abundant life with her only child is to be kept in mind, Elsa is sure to win the battle and live life to its fullest.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer for her Internet services business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Thirty-nine year old Hellen O. is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last fifteen years and employs two farmhands. Her farm produces tea, which she sells through a local tea factory, maize and tomatoes which she sells locally. She mainly depends on her farming income to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. In future, she would like to buy a motorcycle to transport her produce to the market. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to expand her farming activities. 

She is grateful to Juhudi for their financial support in alleviating poverty.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria Jamileth

texts.es:
la señora Gloria Jamileth S. Muñoz tiene 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, esta casada y su esposo se dedica  a la construccion, Gloria se dedica a la venta de mariscos pescado y camaron.
juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Gloria y su esposo en su carro viajan desde coyolito hasta juticalpa Olancho a vender el pescado y los camarones cada cuatro dia,  y de viernes a domingo sale a vender Choluteca.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos a precio de mayorista.
su sueño es darles una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Jamileth S. Muñoz is 33 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband works in the building trade.  Gloria sells seafood, fish and shrimp.  She and her husband both work hard to get their children ahead in life.

Gloria and her husband travel in their car from Coyolito to Juticalpa Olancho to sell fish and shrimp every four days.  From Friday to Sunday she goes to sell her products in Choluteca.

Gloria will use her loan to buy seafood wholesale.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Carolyne Owuor

texts.en: Carolyne Owuor A. is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Carolyne owns a vegetable grocery and also sells charcoal and paraffin to her customers.  This business has been in operation for the last eight years.  This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase vegetables, charcoal, and paraffin. The anticipated profits have been directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to own rentals houses in the future.

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, charcoal, and paraffin

loans.name: Ruperto Joel

texts.es:
El señor Ruperto Joel R. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de carpintero desde hace 10 años y 5 meses.

Es soltero con 3 personas a su cargo, 1 de estas están en edad escolar, el habita en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de San Rafael del Sur en pochomil desde hace 23 años.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por este crédito que le han otorgado ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de su casa, y poder dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ruperto Joel R. is an employee at an aqueduct and sewage company where he has worked as a carpenter for 10 years and 5 months. 

He is single with 3 dependents; one who is school age. He has lived in the city of Managua in the municipality of Southern San Rafael in Pochomil for 23 years. 

He appreciates CEPRODEL for this loan which he needs to improve his house and provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: housing construction

loans.name: C 2388 Abafatanyije Group

texts.en:
Collette, a 40-year-old mother of seven children between 9 and 18 years of age, owns a small shop which sells fruit and vegetables. Her business, well known in the region, is the reason she is the leader of this group, called Abifatanyije in the local language.

Collette, who has been in her business for a year, describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her shop is open daily from 6 am until 6 pm.

Collette and her group have requested this loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for their businesses. Collette especially needs this loan in order to expand her enterprise through the purchase of more fruit and vegetables, a purchase that will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. With the additional profits, she expects to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven de  21 años  a su corta edad es muy emprendedor y trabajador  todo lo que ha logrado  es admirable el estudio para técnico en computadoras  así poco a poco fue ofreciendo sus servicios a domicilio para realizar arreglos de computadoras e instalación de programas, al  juntar algo de dinero  empezó con su propio negocio que tiene por nombre  “JOHAN.NET”  el cual funciona en su misma casa donde ofrece sus servicios para arreglos en general, de otro lado también tiene cabinas telefónicas donde la gente acude para realizar llamadas , realmente le va bien ya tiene clientela ganada que lo conoce y sabe de su buen trabajo, el acaba de ser nombrado el nuevo presidente del grupo “JOVENES EMPRENDEDORES”  07 miembros  lo conforman. Para el futuro el quisiera ampliar su negocio, el dinero de su prestamos será de gran utilidad para el ya que le servirá para la compra de algunas herramientas y repuestos que le hacen falta, con esto el puede ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

* Jhonatan es el cuarto de los parados (derecha)viste polo crema
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a young man of 21.  Even at his young age, he is a very enterprising and hard-working man.  Everything he has achieved is to be admired.  He studied to become a computing technician and gradually started offering his service in people's homes, fixing computers and installing programs.  This allowed him to gather some money together and he started his own business called "Johan.net" which he runs from home, offering his services doing general repairs.

Jhonatan also has telephone booths which people come to use to make calls.  His business is going really well.  The customers he has attracted know him and know about the good work that he does.  

Jhonatan has just been named the new president of the "Jovenes Emprendedores" (Young Entrepreneurs) group which has 7 members.

In the future, Jhonatan would like to expand his business.  His loan money will be very useful to him since he will use it to buy some tools and spare parts that he needs.  This will enable him to offer his customers a better service.

* Jhonatan is the fourth person along of those standing in the photo (on the right), wearing a cream-colored top.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in the construction field for 7 years. He is specialized in painting buildings. In 2006, he started to work independently according to clients' request. He also works with multiple construction projects. In parallel, he works as a maintenance agent in a local company. He works hard in both jobs to be able to meet the family's financial needs. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l so he can buy a car. In that way, he will be able to make his transportation faster and much easier. This will result in increasing his productivity and thus his income.  In the future, he is planning to work on bigger projects and build a good business reputation.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su casa ella es una persona bien alegre y muy dedicada a su familia, actualmente uno de sus hijos ya termino su carrera universitaria y necesita realizar su tesis para poder graduarse y buscar un buen trabajo, la socia vive de las rentas de su casa y de esta forma ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la los estudios de su hijo mayor (tesis).

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the "MOSOQ RUNA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Dina is 48 years old, separated, and has 2 children.  She looks after her children and her home.  Dina is a very cheerful woman who is devoted to her family.  One of her children is currently finishing his degree course at university and needs to complete his thesis so that he can graduate and look for a good job.  Dina lives off the rent from her house.  It is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Dina is requesting this loan to pay for her eldest son's studies (his thesis).  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her eldest son's studies (his thesis)

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira K., 31, is the leader of this group. Unlike the other members of her team, who have several years of experience in business, Nazira is a beginner in agricultural work. Though she is a fragile woman and a mother of two boys, her job calls for extremely tough physical pressure that usually males deal with. 

Being a transporter in a cement mill  takes nine hours of Nazira’s precious daytime, which she could have spent with her dear boys. In fact, Nazira and her spouse are colleagues. It was he who taught Nazira the key to effective driving with a minimum loss of time and fuel. 

Nazira resides in the tiny town of Tup, in Issyk Kul region, with a population of approximately 15,000 people and she knows very well how few employment opportunities there are here. Local traditions, lifestyle and landscape have formed the main activities of this area’s residents – farming and livestock breeding. 

Many successful business stories of her neighbors, colleagues and friends, who are well-trained farmers, escalated Nazira’s wish to engage in farming. She believes that her entrepreneurial skills, land, good climate and a constant desire to learn something new will push the level of the business upward. The only thing she lacks is financial capital. For this reason she gathered a group of ambitious private entrepreneurs like her and applied for a loan from Kiva, cooperating with its field partner in Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance. 

Nazira will start with the purchase of 500 kg of potato seeds. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Rozbek

texts.en:
Rozbek is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His three children all attend local secondary school. His wife is a cook who manages a cafe in their town. Rozbek is a driver and operates a transportation service in his town. 

Rozbek worked as a driver at a private company for 6 years and started his business in 2004 with his own truck. Besides his transportation service he conducts a vegetable planting and selling business in order to contribute to his family earnings. He is an open-minded and diligent man who says, "I am planning to plant more vegetables this year." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some auto parts for his truck and some seeds for his vegetable planting business.

loans.use: To purchase some auto parts.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy is 30 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Amy has been in her business for six years. In the future, Amy would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat,

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent depuis longtemps à la même  association d’artisan. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Claire, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Claire est née le 04 Août 1973 et est mariée à un instituteur du nom de Wassi. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claire et sa famille habitent ensemble. Claire a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire, au profit de la couture qu’elle a appris et exerce depuis dix neuf ans. De façon secondaire, Claire vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Claire achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. La clientèle de Claire devient de plus en plus grande, et Claire voudrait équiper son atelier d’une autre machine à coudre afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Claire et son groupe se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO group is composed of three people, who have been members of the same craft association for a long time. The group's representative, named Claire, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their activity level.
Claire is born on August 4th, 1973, and is married to a schoolteacher named Wassi. The couple has three kids, who all attend school and depend on them financially. Claire and her family live together. Claire went to school but quit in middle school, to the benefit of sewing, which she learned and has been practicing for nineteen years. As a side activity, Claire sells sewing supplies at her workshop. Claire guys her supplies in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital.
Claire's clientele is growing, and Claire would like to equip her workshop with another sewing machine to better meet the demand. To this effect, and since she doesn't have the financial resources to make her dream a reality, Claire and her group contacted ALIDé for a first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Manfredy

texts.es:
Manfredy, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con su familia, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, tiene 2 años de realizar esta actividad, aprendió por iniciativa propia, trabaja solo cuatro días al mes que es el día de comercio realizado cada martes.
El necesita comprar ganado por lo que solicita un préstamo y invertirlo en tres terneros, estos los crecerá por un tiempo para luego comercializarlos, con esta compra estará creciendo en su comercio.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso, con la que pueda ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para su futuro.
texts.en:
Manfredy is single, and he does not have children.  He lives with his family.  He has been buying and selling livestock for two years.  He learned this through his own initiative.  He only works four days a month as he conducts his business every Tuesday.

He needs to buy livestock, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He will buy three calves.  They will grow for a while, and he will later sell them.  With this purchase he will be growing in his business.

His objective is to have a source of income with which he will be able to help his family and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Julieta also has been farming fruits and vegetables for five years and earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to establish pasture grounds for her cattle.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to school and to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to establish a pasture.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 51 years old. She lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with her big family, which consists of her husband, her mother-in-law, her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

Larisa has worked at the illuminating glass factory for 7 years. In the early nineties, Larisa started to engage in the agricultural business. On her farm she has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Larisa's family helps her with farming. They breed their animals and sell agricultural products to the villagers. Thanks to their occupation, Larisa and her family are able to support each other. 

This is Larisa's third loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to add to her sheep number and to buy fodder.

loans.use: to add to her sheep number and to buy fodder

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has six children. She makes corn dough and cassava dough for sale at Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ama uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase maize to make corn dough and cassava for cassava dough. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wishes to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make corn dough and cassava for cassava dough.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 39, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rufo who is a driver. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in high school, while the youngest is in elementary school. By the grace of God, Lilibeth has managed to support her older children's schooling; a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Lilibeth as she herself has only been a high school graduate. She believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lilibeth operates a "buy and sell" business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell the items with a small profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices and other items of the like. Customers are attracted due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilibeth dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for appliances and electronic items that she sells in her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Lydia has a furniture shop that sells wooden furniture like dining tables & chairs. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials for making furniture.

Lydia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.fr: La leader du groupe d’affaire « Justice », est entrepreneur, âgée de 32 ans, veuve, mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous. Dans la photo, elle est la femme positionnée à l’ extrême, elle s’habille en blouse noire, elle lève sa main Elle est  vendeuse des pagnes. Son mari fut décédé d’une mort inopinée. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de  Virunga. Il y a 14 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  12 pièces de pagnes  à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à mettre a location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes veuves exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Justice » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
This leader  of the business group  « Justice », is an entrepreneur of 32, a widowed mother of three children who are all enrolled in school. In the photo she is on the far right in the black blouse, with her hand raised. She sells African print cloth. Her husband died an untimely death. She displays her merchandise at the central market of Virunga. She has been in various small income-generating activities of this sort for 14 years. However, she has just completed her sixth loan with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to purchase 12 lengths of cloth for resale. Moreover she would like to have her children in school and build a house to rent out. The client thanks Hekima for its work to help poor widows who are not served by conventional banks. It is worth noting that the business group  « Justice » is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es: Porfiria de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella es costurera y tiene su taller en el lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en el lugar ya que confecciona ropa muy bonita, Porfiria tiene un don, siempre está a la vanguardia creando nuevos estilos para el gusto de su clientela desde lo mas simple hasta lo mas exigente en: blusas, faldas, vestidos para eventos especiales, camisas, trajes, entre otros, todo de muy buena calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio que ofrece es inigualable, Porfiria es muy amable para ella el lema en su trabajo es al cliente lo que pida; últimamente han aumentado sus pedidos de ropa y eso la impulso a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor de diferentes estilos, sierres, hilos, agujas etc. Porfiria tiene confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Porfiria, 38, lives with her two small children. She is a seamstress and has her workshop in her residence. She is well-known in the area since she makes very lovely clothing.

Porfiria is a talented seamstress. She is always avant-garde, creating new styles, from the simplest to the most complicated, according to her customer’s taste, in blouses, skirts, special-occasion dresses, shirts, suits, among others, all of very good quality and at a reasonable price. Moreover, the service she offers is unparalleled.

Porfiro is very friendly. Her motto in her work is:"Whatever the client wants." Recently her clothing orders have increased and this prompted her to request a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy different styles of fabric wholesale, fasteners, thread, needles, etc. Porfiria is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a fuller life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, thread, needles.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is a 47-year-old entrepreneur who earns most of his living by selling construction materials. He is married and has two children, but is the only breadwinner in his family. He has about 10 years of experience in this field, and usually orders new supplies every one to three months. In his village, he is known for selling high-aquality construction materials, and he would like to take advantage of that reputation by buying more items to sell to his customers. To make this possible, he is applying for a loan for 1,200 AZN. This will be his second loan from our organization. He repaid his first loan fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for the colder weather.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in produce for five years. He started with 500,000 but now has 2,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is high commodity prices and his vision is a bigger business plus educating his children.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is 43 years old and is a window with five children aged between 10 and 26 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. 

Hasina owns a business selling various goods in the market such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, etc. This is her 14th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day. 

Hasina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more goods such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, beans, vegetables, fruits, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Butende Tents A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Butende Tents A Group in Western Kenya! Livingstone is the facilitator of the Butende Tents A group. He is photographed with his group members and their Field Officer on the left. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Livingstone is the father of one child. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Livingstone had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Livingstone was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Livingstone will invest in livestock rearing and buy a piece of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Livingstone and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Butende Tents A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry has been farming for five years. She currently produces maize, beans, and milk for the local markets in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya. She currently employs two farmhands. Terry is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 5.

Terry has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry and add poultry farming to the list of her farming activities. She says this will help her diversify her farming trade and provide her family with basic needs.

Terry recognizes that the high cost of feeds and poultry diseases are the prominent challenges to be faced.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah lives in Changamwe town, Kenya. She is widowed and has four children, three of whom attend school. Emma operates a fruits and vegetables stall and has been in the business for two years. Besides this, she also sells cereals in her neighborhood. 

She joined Milango early this year, applied for a loan and completed repaying. She is now applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase vegetables and fruits, e.g. potatoes, oranges, cabbages and kale.

Her main challenge is the high cost of transport; she travels to the main market to purchase the stock. She has put things in place to be able to restock the cereals shop, which is her main business plan for the future. As a widow, the income from this loan will help her educate her children, pay house rent and also save for the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits, e.g. potatoes, oranges, cabbages and kale.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un jeune tailleur  âgé de 33 ans, marié et père  d’un enfant. Son activité consiste à confectionner des ensembles pour hommes et dames. Son atelier se situe au cœur du marché local. 
Avec le prêt il  envisage d’acheter une variété de tissus, les confectionner  pour les revendre.
Ibrahima arrive à gérer sa petite famille et à subvenir à leur besoin au quotidien.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is 33 years old, married and the father of one child. He is a tailor and makes outfits for men and women. His workshop is located in the centre of the local market.

Ibrahima will use this loan to buy a variety of fabrics with which to make outfits for resale. His income allows him to take care of his family and their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric to create outfits to sell

loans.name: Dhelly

texts.en:
Dhelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling food products in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more food products to sell to customers. She earns more income from frozen foods and fruits. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pablo al que quiere mucho, llevan juntos 25 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Atocc. Su visión en estos momentos se centra en la venta de granos verdes, papa y demás productos de primera necesidad a las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Huancayo, Pampas y la capital del país, Lima. Mientras eso sucede, ella continua trabajando en sus sembríos de papa, olluco, habas, que comercializa a la ciudad de Lima, donde viaja constantemente. Además cuida de sus vacas de buena calidad que le brinda rica leche. De ahí obtiene una ganancia extra, de igual manera, tiene ovejas que engorda para venderlas a un mayor precio, entre los carniceros. Ahora ella desea juntar más dinero, para comenzar con su negocio, es optimista y sabe que con la ayuda de su asociación lo logrará. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, sol naciente, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada; pues sus miembros son personas solidarias y muy trabajadoras. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Alejandra, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 43, and a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Pablo, whom she loves very much. They have been together for 25 years. They have eight children, but only live with four of them in their own house, located in the settlement of Atocc. 

Currently, her main focus is on the sale of unroasted coffee beans, potatoes, and other basic staples at the various markets in the city of Huancayo, Pampas, and the country's capital, Lima. Meanwhile, she continues working on her potato, olluco (a root vegetable), and lima bean crops, that she sells in the city of Lima, where she travels constantly. 

In addition, she looks after her cows, who are of good quality, and provide her with rich milk. From this she gets extra earnings. In the same way, she has sheep that she fattens, to sell at a higher price to the butcher shops. 

Now she want to raise more money, to get her business going. She is optimistic, and knows that with her group's help she will succeed. She belongs to the "Sol Naciente" communal bank, and this is the fourth loan with MFP.  She feels she is developing as a person, as its members are supportive and very hard-working people. In addition, she promises to pay her instalments on time. 

On receiving the loan, Alejandra will use the money applied for, to buy natural fertilizers to nourish her potato and olluco crops.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Mary Jean is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, candies, biscuits, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 60 años es un hombre que dio mucho por su familia en la vida, siempre se mostró como un hombre trabajador, empeñozo y muy dedicado. Es así que de los cuatro hijos que tiene ya todos son mayores e independientes, y él vive a lado de su esposa en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y en donde siempre compartió momentos felices con sus hijos. Ahora trabaja mucho para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Segundo consiste en el arreglo y mantenimiento de aire acondicionado, por lo general trabaja con algunas instituciones publicas y privadas, pero en los momentos en no se encuentra trabajando está en su casa arreglando algunas cosas. Siempre esta a la expectativa de sus teléfono fijo o Mobil ya que cuando suena es por que un cliente necesita que vaya a su casa u oficina a reparar su sistema de aire. Lleva trabajando con este negocio desde hace 31 años en los cuales ganó experiencia y mejoró su técnica. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener su tiempo para dedicar a su hogar, además de darle buenas ganancias ya que en esta parte el calor es intenso y hay muchas instalaciones de aire acondicionado, lo que significa para él un mercado muy amplio. Ahora esta en etapa de hacer crecer su negocio pues no solo quiere arreglar sino que también vender repuestos para estos productos. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financieros y así aumentar su capital de trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cutas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales y herramientas para poder hacer mejor su trabajo, además de algunas piezas y repuestos necesarios para comenzar a vender.
texts.en: Sixty-year-old Segundo is a man who has given a lot for his family.  He always proved to be a hardworking, determined, and very dedicated man.  That's why his four grown children are all independent.  He lives with his wife in their own home, which he was able to buy thanks to a lot of hard work and sacrifice and which has always been the place where he shared happy moments with his children.  Now he is working hard to be able to offer his wife a better quality of life and to have a quiet retirement.  Segundo's work is repairing and maintaining air conditioners.  He generally works with a few public and private institutions, but when he's not working he's usually at home fixing things.  He's always waiting for his cell or home phone to ring because when it does it's because a customer needs him to go to his house or office to repair an air system.  He has been in this business for 31 years, during which he has gained experience and improved his technique.  He likes his work a lot because it allows him to have free time to spend at home and it also makes him good money because in his area the heat is intense and there are a lot of air conditioning systems, which mean a big market for him.  He is currently at the stage where he is expanding his business, as he wants to not only do repairs, but also to sell replacement parts for these products.  This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have the financial support to increase his working capital.  He also promises once again to make his payments on time, as he has with his previous loans.  He is very happy to belong to his communal bank as all the members are responsible and supportive.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles he has requested, he will buy materials and tools to better perform his job and he will also buy some of the parts he needs to start selling.

loans.use: to buy tools and parts

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ajabu est leader du groupe de crédit « Manne du ciel », entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Son conjoint est un maçon constructeur. La cliente est propriétaire d’une moto qui fait le taxi urbain. En outre, elle est vendeuse d’arachides. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter une nouvelle moto. Les accidents de circulation et routiers sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et construire une maison. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit.
texts.en: The client, Ajabu, is the leader of the loan group "Manne du ciel". She is a courageous entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has 6 children. Her spouse is a mason. The client owns a motorbike which she uses as an urban taxi. In addition, she also sells peanuts. She started her business with money from her husband. This new loan will help her buy a new motorbike. Traffic and road accidents are big obstacles for the growth of her business. In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house. She thanks Hekima for their microfinance support.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis  Mai 2010 et posséde 21 membres qui habitent le même quartier et sont solidairement liés par une responsabilité de remboursement de leur crédit.

Fanta qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 43 ans,est mariée et mére d'une fille.

Elle fait du commerce,elle vend des fruits et des céréales au marché central de la ville.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 100000f pour l'achat des fruits(bananes,oranges,mangues) et des céréales comme le mil soit 250kg à 50000f le kg et l'arachide soit 100kg pour une valeur de 50000f.

Les bénéfices serviront à participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la maison et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created May 2010, is composed of members living in the same district and who are bound together in solidarity by the responsibility of paying back their loan. 

Fanta, appearing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is 43 years old and a married mother of one girl.

Her commerce involves selling fruit and grains at the town’s central market. 

With this loan, she intends to buy 100,000 francs ______  for buying fruit (bananas, oranges, mangoes); and grains, such as millet, perhaps 250 kg at` 50,000 francs_____, and peanuts, perhaps 100 kg worth 50,000 francs. 

The profits will be used to help cover day-to-day expenses at home and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and grains

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a lechon (roasted pigs) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her roasted pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her roasted pigs.

loans.name: Agnes Wakiruru

texts.en:
Agnes is married with four children. She has trained on secretarial, computers and an accountant by professional. She is a CCI member.

She started her private computer college eight years ago. She is the Managing Director of the college which has 170 students. Thika is a densely populated town and most school leavers have missed vacancy in her college due to lack of enough computers and training materials. The college has employed 8 members of staff.

loans.use: A loan of USD.750 will help her to buy a new computer to easy her work and good storage students’ data.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie K. is a very devoted and determined woman. Married to a mechanic for ten years, she now has three children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to cover the family expenses. Early on, Mrs. K. started up a small business selling a variety of products (e.g. soap, canned food, candy) in front of her house, in order to provide for her children. A generous and honest woman, she has paid back her previous loans without difficulty. To liven up her shop window, Mrs. K. needs an $800 loan to open a store and enlarge her business to attract more clients. This loan will help her to feed her children well, and to pay their school fees and other expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Sylvie est une femme très dévouée et battante. Mariée à un mécanicien depuis une dizaine d’années, elle a aujourd’hui trois (3) enfants. L’économie de son mari ne lui permet pas de couvrir les dépenses de la famille. Très tôt, Madame K. a su orienter son économie vers le petit commerce de la vente des produits divers (savon, boîte de conserve, bonbon, etc.) devant sa maison afin de couvrir les dépenses de ses enfants. Femme honnête et généreuse, elle a su rembourser ses antécédents crédits sans difficulté. Pour donner plus de vie à son étalage, Madame K. a besoin d’un appui financier de $800 pour ouvrir une boutique et augmenter la taille de son commerce afin d’attirer plus de clientèle. Ce crédit pourra l’aider à bien nourrir ses enfants, a payer leur scolarité et autres.

loans.use: To open a store and enlarge her business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana lives in Nkurankan, Ghana and has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells onions at the market. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her sales.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is 22 years old. She is single and she works in the production of artisan embroidery of the Zinacantan region such as tablecloths, napkins, shawls and embroidered blankets. She and Mrs. Juana P. Sanchea are part of the group Rosas 3. They both work in regional craft production. With the loan, they hope to purchase raw materials in bulk and thereby cut costs. This will help them increase production. Later, they will sell the products in the artisan market in town.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MAGDALENA TIENE 22 AÑOS , ES SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE ARTESANIAS BORDADAS DE LA ZONA DE ZINACANTAN QUE GENERALMENTE SON MANTELES , SERVILLETAS, CHALES Y MANTAS BORDADAS. JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA P. SANCHEZ FORMAN PARTE DEL GRUPO ROSAS 3.AMBAS SE DEDICAN A LAS ARTESANIAS TIPICAS DE LA ZONA EN DONDE VIVEN . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAATERIALES AL POR MAYOR Y ASI REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y ADEMAS AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION QUE POSTERIORMENTE SALDRAN A VENDER EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria Uwabor is 22 years old, and married with 2 children.  She sells motorcycle parts and has been in this business since 2002.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle parts

loans.name: Tufaina

texts.en: Tufaina is a new member of SPBD. She is 25 years old and recently quit her job because she wanted to work from home, where she can look after her two children. She makes more than $100 a week by selling pancakes, and she uses the money to support her family and kids.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and oil for her pancake business

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng D. married in 1996 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from a relative who was living in the same village in 1995. Then she started her silk production in the same year. She has never attended even primary school. Her husband also weaves silk at home. In addition, he is a construction worker, doing farming and raising animals. He did not finish grade 3 at the primary school.

Mrs. Sokheng D. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a partner of the Brigada Ramirez Communal Bank and sells prepared meals in her own establishment, situated in her home in Lamas in the San Martin region. The support of her family have helped her to better organize her business and in that way tend to her clients with much joy and charisma.

With the loan of S/. 2,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase more tables with their respective chairs (4 chairs for 1 table), decorative tablecloths (8 units) and she will have her locale painted so that it has a better presentation and is more appealing so that her clientele will enjoy a cool, comfortable and cozy environment.

Gloria is married and has two small children, a boy and a girl, who support her with some of the chores in their home and in the business such as the cleaning of the restaurant, washing of utensils, going to the market to do some shopping, and they sometimes tend to the clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria es socia del banco comunal Brigada Ramírez, se dedica a la venta de comida en un local propio ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Lima 617 de la localidad de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, región San Martín. El apoyo de su familia le ha permitido organizar mejor su negocio y de esa manera poder atender con mucho carisma y alegría a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará más mesas con sus sillas (04 mesas y 1 sillas), manteles decorativos (08 unidades) y mandar pintar el local para que se vea mejor presentado y más llamativo para que su clientela se sienta bien en un ambiente fresco, cómodo y acogedor. Es casada, tiene dos hijitos, un varón y una mujercita, los cuales la apoyan con algunas labores del hogar y del negocio como la limpieza del local, lavado de utensilios, ir al mercado a realizar algunas compras y algunas veces atienden al público.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as paint to implement her locale.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi I. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She comes from Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells cooked food & drinks in her restaurant. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for 3 years. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff & drinks for sale. She wishes to thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff and drinks for sale

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en: Thanks to Hugo E.’s tenacity, entrepreneurial spirit, and his effort, he has made a prosperous business for himself.  He works delivering goods with his truck.  However, his only source of income needs repairs and he needs a loan of $425 to make the necessary repairs to his vehicle.  He will then be able continue his work and continue making an income.  He is a young man of 26 and just beginning in the business world.  Someday he hopes to have enough money to settle down and have a family.

loans.use: To repair his delivery truck

loans.name: Gilca Ramona

texts.en:
Gilca Ramona owns and operates a small cafeteria in the Herrera community of Santo Domingo. This activity is the main source of income of Gilca. She mentions that she constantly needs money to pay school tuition of her two daughters and the university studies of her son. So, she says that it’s not very easy to support three children, but she’s proud that she could make great efforts so they can have a good education.

Gilca plans on using her loan to increase the variety of sandwiches and hamburgers she offers to her clientele. She would like to have a well-established cafeteria in the sector to better provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Nuru M.. She is single and has one child, age 3.

In 2006, Nuru established her passport photo studio. Nuru requires a loan in order to expand her photography business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her photography business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. Maria has a lot of love for the land where she was born so she gives her thanks by acting for its benefit through a variety of organizations. For a long time she has dedicated herself to farming and raising livestock in order to support the members of her family. A recent initiative by a group of mothers to establish a guinea pig farm for export has motivated her to request a loan to retrofit a space to raise guinea pigs herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria siente mucho amor por la tierra que la vio nacer y en agradecimiento actúa en beneficio de ella a través de diversas organizaciones. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a las labore agrícolas y ganaderas para sostener con satisfacción a los miembros de su hogar. La reciente iniciativa de un grupo de madres por establecer una granja de exportación de cuyes la ha motivado a integrarse y solicitar un préstamo para el acondicionamiento de un espacio de crianza.

loans.use: Establishing a space for breeding guinea pigs.

loans.name: Husrav

texts.ru:
Husrav D. is a videographer. He works at the local television station. His salary is not enough to fully support his family and Husrav also takes videos of special events and private individuals. The payments for his services add to his income. He also edits videos.

One year ago Husrav turned to MicroInvest for a loan to purchase necessary materials for his work, such as videocassettes. Now he would like to expand his business and needs a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусрав по профессии оператор видеосъемки. Работает он на местном телевидении. Получаемой зарплаты не хватает на полноценное содержание семьи и поэтому Хусрав дополнительно занимается видеосъемкой торжественных мероприятий у различных частных лиц. Полученное вознаграждение является его дополнительным заработком. Еще он занимается видеомонтажом. Год назад обратился в Микроинвест и получив займ приобрел необходимые материалы для работы - видеокассеты и тп. Сейчас он собирается расширить свой бизнес и обратился за новым займом.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
The flavor that Gladis gives to her dishes drove her to build a food sales kiosk in her home because her patrons deserved better service. Gladis, a 26-year-old mother of two, is an amazing woman because at her young age, she shows many young mothers that people can move ahead if they resolve to do so. Gladis gets support from her partner, who works as a bricklayer. Gladis needs to keep succeeding in her business, which is why she wants to expand, develop, and give atmosphere to her business. In order to do all these things, she is requesting a loan from you. Gladis awaits your speedy response.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Su buena sazón para la comida hizo que Gladis construyera en un espacio de su propio domicilio un kiosco para la venta de comida, pues sus clientes merecían una mejor atención. Gladis a sus 26 años es madre de 2 hijos, mujer sorprendente, ya que a su corta edad demuestra a muchas madres jóvenes que si se puede salir adelante cuando uno se lo propone. Gladis tiene el apoyo de su pareja, el cual trabaja como albañil. Gladis quiere seguir surgiendo en su negocio y para ello quiere ampliar, ambientar e implementar nuevas cosas en su negocio, para todo ello de una cantidad de dinero que solicita a ustedes en préstamo. Gladis espera su pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Expand and improve her food sales kiosk

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is the wife of N. M. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan, in Kasur Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 12 years. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. None of her children go to school because of their poor financial condition. Her husband works in a kiln where he makes bricks. N. M. is the only breadwinner. He wants to improve his financial condition and therefore his wife has requested for a loan from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). He wants to advance money for use of the kiln to the kiln owner so that he is able to make bricks according to his need.

Ghulam is joined in her loan group by four more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk business. Zareena baji wants a loan to give an advance to the kiln contractor for making bricks. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy furniture to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To give money in advance to the kiln owner for brick making

loans.name: Khushal

texts.en:
This is Khushal K.. He is 21 and single. His parents and four brothers have been living in his village together for a long time. They have their own home in Behsood district. Khushal's father is about 60, and he can't do work, so he is resting at home.

When Khushal was about 7, he started tailoring with his father, and after 8 years he became a good tailor, and he is working as a tailor still now. Khushal and his brothers have a tailor shop in Behsood bazaar. They all provide the income for their family expenditures together.

But recently Khushal decided to make a cloth-selling shop besides his tailoring, because he thinks that this business will increase his income, and then he will expand his business more. But now he has 20,000 Afghanis of his own capital, and it's too little for this purpose, therefore he has requested a 50,000 Afghani loan for 18 months from AFSG. He wants to buy cloth with this money and with his own capital make some shelves in his shop.

Khushal hopes from the lenders that they will help him make his dreams come true and provide this opportunity for him. Also he thanks them in advance.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for his shop

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, Mme A. Adjo est née à Aného et réside dans le quartier dégbenou . Agée de 32 ans environ elle fait le commerce d'alimentation générale.

 Les revenus de son mari étant insuffisants pour la prise en charge de  leur foyer, Adjo décida d’aider son mari à travers les maigres bénéfices qu’elle réalise. Elle pourra gagner un peu plus d’argents si son chiffre d’affaire était un peu plus haut 
     
A. Adjo  sollicite donc un crédit pour mieux s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi elle aidera son mari dans la gestion de leur foyer.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of two children, Adjo A. was born in Aného and lives in the Dégbenou district. She is 32 years old and in the grocery business. As her husband’s income is not sufficient to support the household, Adjo decided to assist him by means of the small profit she makes. She would be able to earn a bit more money if her turnover were a little higher. Adjo is requesting a loan in order to stock up on merchandise for the purpose of better meeting her customers’ needs and increasing her income. In that way she will help her husband to support their household.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Seccelambras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ccejelambras esta integrado por socias que viven en L. comunidad D. Ccejelambras que pertenece al distrito D. Tambillo que se ubica a dos horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, actualmente L. comunidad se dedica a L. agricultura, produciendo en mayor cantidad L. papa y en menor cantidad L. crianza D. animales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, abarrotes, agricultura y L. crianza D. animales. Como es el caso D. Victoria Q. es viuda tiene 6 hijos ya mayores D. edad, Victoria se dedica a L. venta D. comida en el anexo D. Qechcca, con este negocio educa a sus hijos, aunque L. situación es difícil para elL. siempre hubo que comer, desD. que es socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido en L. compra D. víveres para su negocio, Victoria sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
Por otro lado Simona C. es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Simona se dedica a L. venta D. cereales actividad que aprendió D. su mama, Simona sueña ahorrar para tener una bodega, Simona necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cereales variados.
Mientras que Zenaida es separada, tiene 1 hijo, Zenaida venD. comida en su casa a los trabajadores del gas D. camisea, una oportunidad para hacer crecer su negocio, Zenaida necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. víveres al por mayor, Zenaida sueña con tener un restaurante en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Como ellas las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 13100 soles en todo el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, trigo, cebada, maíz, animales menores.
Las socias mencionan que aprendieron a ahorrar y sobre todo les gusta las capacitaciones que reciben que les ayuda en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Ccejelambras" is maD. up of members that live in the community of Ccejelambres which is in the district of Tambillo, located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. The community is mainly agricultural, producing mostly potatoes and in a lesser capacity livestock.

The members carry out different types of businesses such as the sale of foods, convenience stores, agriculture and raising livestock. As with the case of Victoria Q., a widow and mother of 6 grown children, she sells foods in downtown Quechcca. With this business she sent her kids to school, and although the situation was difficult there was always something to eat. Since she has been a member of the Community Bank, she has learned to save money. Victoria requires a loan amounting to 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of grocery products for her business. Victoria dreams of having a convenience stO..

On the other hand Simona Callanaupa is married and has six children. Simona's business is selling cereals, a business that she learned from her mother. Simona dreams of saving enough to set up a convenience stO.. Simona requires a loan of 600 soles, funds which will be investe din the purchase of various cereals.

Meanwhile, Zenaida is separated and she has one sone. Zenaida sells food from her home to the natural gas workers fo Camisea, an opportunity to make her business grow. Zenaida requires a loan amounting to 600 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of wholesale products. Zenaida dreams of having a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho.

The other members require loans of different sums: 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, and 1000 soles, totalling 13100 soles for the membership of the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, wheat, barley, corn, and small animals. The members maD. mention that they learned how to save money, and above all they are grateful for the loans that they receive, helping them in their daily life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery products, various cereals, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguon S., 43, is a Commune Committee Adviser who currently gets a salary of $100 a month. She lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married with four children, one of whom is employed as a dealer for a casino near the border between Thailand and Cambodia. 

Her husband, age 46, is a motorcycle taxi driver who currently earns around $5 a day. Mrs. S. needs a loan to replace her husband's motorcycle, which is so old that it does often not attract customers.

Mrs. S.'s husband appears in  the picture, because she was not available.

loans.use: To replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha Y. (pictured with her son), 46, and her husband, Mr. Sros Soeung, 48, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons who assist their parents in growing watermelons and two daughters, one married and living outside the family home and the other a garment factory worker.

Chantha has been selling desserts for four years, buying the ingredients to cook and selling the finished products at Chbar Amporv market. Her husband grows watermelons. Chantha is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a water-pumping machine for her husband’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine to use for growing watermelons.

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kalifa T. a 25 ans, célibataire et père d’un garçon, il réside dans la grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses cadets à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. est un électricien de profession et en parallèle avec sa profession, il mène l’activité d’achat-vente des appareils  électroniques (TV,Minie Chaîne, DVD, etc) à Mancourani I où se situe son atélier. Il mène cette activité depuis maintenant trois (03) ans.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six (06) mois avec laquelle elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur T. vend ses appareil dans son atélier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 1  TV, 2 Minies Chaînes, 3 DVD, 5 battéries, etc. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana avant de les revendre sur place.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalifa T., age 25, is unmarried and the father of a boy. He resides in a large traditional family with his parents and younger siblings in Kaboïla II, Sikasso’s downtown (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is an electrician by trade, and concurrent to this, he does commerce in electronic equipment (TV, Minie Chaîne, DVD, etc.) in Mancourani I, where his workshop is located. He has been in this commerce for three years now.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso six months ago and is on his first individual loan. He sells equipment in his repair shop generally to people who ask for his services. With this initial loan, he plans to buy a TV, two Minies Chaînes, three DVD, five batteries, etc. He gets his supplies in Ghana and resells them locally. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment (TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc).

loans.name: Pik

texts.en: A resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, Mrs. P. is a widow who is looking for a loan of $ 800 to buy a new motorcycle for the family to ride. P. is 49 years old and has three children who are all married; two are living in different houses and one is living in the family home. One son is a domestic building worker, age 18. She is a local cultivator, growing vegetables and has some plowers for sale. She wants to reduce the cost of transportation for the family, and that’s why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy a new one motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor lives in Kahovka in the Kherson region. After he resigned from his previous job, he decided to start his own business to allow him to earn a decent living. Today Igor owns a footwear-sales business and sells his inventory by traveling to different markets in his region. The business is the only source of income for him. Igor works very hard in order to bring in enough income.

Igor has been in this business for seven years. Currently, his turnover capital is over 60,000 Grivnas. Igor would like to get a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to generate additional profit. One of his long-term plans is to eventually expand his trade.

We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Igor develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other entrepreneurs will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin Q. is a forty-six year old, married father of two children. He provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store he owns where he sells toys for children. He is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months to increase the stock of goods available at his store. Shahin is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children's efforts to get a good education. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more toys to sell

loans.name: Kikiafu 2 Omoding Joyce Group

texts.en: Ms. O. Joyce is a married woman, age 36, with six kids: three girls and three boys. The first born is 19 and the last born is  2 years old. Five are going to school and one is still too young. She is using the loan to purchase millet and maize flour for the local brew. Her dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase millet and maize flour for the local brew.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Since 1989 Vivian F. has worked as a trader selling tomatoes and garden eggs in Elmina. She is married with five dependents and has received no formal education. While Vivian makes her living as a trader, her husband is a worker at UCC. She is responsible for contributing housekeeping money for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for selling and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to help educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for selling

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Rizalina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Rizalina raises swines. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising swines for fattening. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from GDMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 23rd loan taken out by Rizalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to sustain her family's financial needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
