Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Almas Group

texts.en:
Salma A., age 30, is single with no child. She sells clothes from her home and also door to door. She started this business in 1968 and works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $114.

This will be Salma’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her clothing business, bought house furniture, bought land and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes to get her 6th loan to increase her capital and to buy bricks.

Salma will share this loan with her group, Almas, which totals twenty-two members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Salma is second from the left in a black blouse and yellow skirt.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing and to buy bricks

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina F., age 32, is married and has four children.  She has 5 years of experience in the flea market business.  She sells to the tourists and general public 6 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala.SPBD loans are Rosalina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase kava bowls of different sizes, samoan war weapons, and tapa table mats to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa started her fish-selling business fourteen years ago in a market where she currently lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market and for that reason she is popular with many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the market place.

Adwoa is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Currently two of her children are schooling. She requests the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fresh fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph N. is managing a motorcycle shop that sells motorcycle parts and they also cater some service. He is 23 years old and living in the village of San Leonardo of Aglipay, Quirino Province. He is very responsible and working hard for his future family.

In order to make his business more productive, he would like to borrow additional business capital amounting to PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. He hopes that through the loan, his business will continue to become more and more successful.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita S. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Clarita has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She is a trader. Janet trades in footwear and ladies dressing bags. She sells in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. Janet procures her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en: Soeum S. is 38 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 2000, she has been selling coffee and grocery items to earn a living and is able to make US$12 in revenue per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who typically makes US$8 every day. This couple has five children living at home to support. Soeum S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to expand her grocery and coffee stand.

loans.use: To expand grocery and coffee stand.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy S., 58, lives in the Takeo province with his wife and three of his children. Dy and his wife make and sell rice noodle to earn a living and is able to make approximately US$6 each day. People in the community always support their rice noodle because the way the cook soup is so good. However, this couple needs to support three school-aged children. Dy would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase rice to make noodle and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make noodle.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Isabel C. is living without a partner because her husband has already passed away. Although their children are still there, they are now busy improving their own lives with their families. Isabel doesn’t mind that because she also wants to help their three children, Charlote, Rodante and Ronnel, to improve their lives. Because only one of Isabel's children got the opportunity to receive a two-year college degree, she is working really hard to help her grandchildren pursue good educations.

Since joining Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), Isabel has always used the loans she received to improve her businesses, which consist of pig-raising, rice sales, and the operation of a variety store. All of her businesses help to meet their daily expenses, but she is requesting a new loan to buy additional goods for her variety store as well as rice for resale. Isabel's hope is that her businesses will continue to grow, thus enabling her to save for the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and also her rice vending business

loans.name: Mame Dieng

texts.fr: Mame Dieng N. est une femme de 40 ans elle est divorcée et vit avec son unique enfant dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD2" depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle renforce sa boutique en achetant divers produits tels que du lait en poudre, des bonbons, des produits de beauté, du sucre etc. les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge son enfant et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Mame Dieng N. is a 40-year-old woman who is divorced and living with her only child, whom she supports entirely by herself.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD2" for 1½ years.  With her loan, she's bolstering her shop by buying various goods, such as powdered milk, candy, beauty products, sugar, etc.  The profits earned from her business enable her to care for her child and to meet her own needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bostering her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros O. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old, married, and she has 6 adult children.

To make a living, Milagros sells a variety of viands in the community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Milagros joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Milagros is requesting her fifth loan, for 11000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more ingredients for her food business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her  food business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has owned a special Lebanese tobacco shop in his town since 2007. He's 20 years old and single. He cooperates with his 2 brothers to provide a good life situation for the family.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to enlarge his business by buying more merchandise and tobacco products.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and tobacco products

loans.name: Abdul R.

texts.en:
This gentle guy is a businessman in the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. His name is Abdul R. M.; he owns a video center (like a cinema but he uses 21 inch television and satellite dishes) to show European soccer matches. Soccer is a very popular sport here and with the fall of domestic soccer during the period of the Ten Year civil war, youths have resorted to watching European matches for a pastime.

The 36-year-old has been running this business for many years now. A native of Magburaka town, he has been able to attract a lot of customers to his video center. Thus, to meet the growing demand of his customers, Abdul R. M. wants a loan of SLL 1,200,000 to buy decoders and subscribe to Super Sport, Canal, and Show Time. In this way, this husband and father of four children will be able to show almost any soccer match played in Europe and other parts of the world.

loans.use: Buy decoders and subscribe to  Super Sport, Canal, and Show Time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion owns a rice farm that her family relies upon for income. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. Her oldest is now 17 years old and goes to school. Her dreams for her children are for them to have a proper education and a bright future. She wants to expand her business in order to provide for all her household's needs. She applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI, which she will use for purchasing farm supplies.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Miriam is the coordinator of her group, Mujers Bendecidas (Blessed Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Miriam is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon business by purchasing three hair straighteners, rolls, shampoo and conditioner. She will use the profits to invest in saving for a home in another part of the city which will be safer and therefore allow her children to grow up in a more stable environment. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair straightener, rolls, conditioner and shampoo

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria’s income from her rice farm is only enough to pay her obligations and to buy food for her family. She wants to improve it so she could also save money and improve her family’s living conditions. She has three children with her husband, Wilfredo. Like any other businesswoman, she wants to succeed and give her children a bright future.

Maria is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 37 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her son currently attends a local high school. 

Erdenechimeg operates a second-hand products trading business with her husband at a counter at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She and her husband sell a variety of second-hand products such as clothes and blankets. Erdenchimeg started her business in 2003 and has had steady growth over the years. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2111 USD) and her daily profits average between  10,000 – 20,000 tugrugs (~ 10  USD). 

Over the years, she has gained great business experience and she has used her earnings to support her family and grow her business. Erdenechimeg is a very hard-working and hopes to continue her success in the future. She says, “My dream is to purchase a larger house for my family.” She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~ 2465 USD) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Agua Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Agua Clara está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Leyla V. Vivas quien tiene una comideria.  Este negocio lo inicio porque muchas personas que llegaban a un billar cerca de su casa buscaban  alimentos de eso le vino la idea de poner una comideria y es  en el 2005 que con unos pequeños ahorros que logra instalarla.

Su compañera de grupo Lisbeth Martínez quien tiene un taller de calzado junto con su esposo. Ella antes criaba y vendía animales y su esposo elaboraba calzado pero decidieron tener un solo negocio es así que instalaron el taller. Mientras Ivania del Carmen Ñamendis G. tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Agua Clara group is composed of three hardworking women. One is Leyda V. Vivas, who has a diner. She started this business because many people who came to a pool hall near her home were looking for food, so she had the idea to open a restaurant. With her small savings, she was able to do this in 2005. Her groupmate Lisbeth Martínez has a shoe store along with her husband. Before, she raised and sold animals and her husband made shoes, but they decided to concentrate on one business and opened the shop. Meanwhile, Ivania del Carmen Ñamendis G. has had a small local store for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as grains, meat, vegetables, and fruit

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Paulina es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Paulina tiene una panadería en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. 4 trabajadores. Además venD. frutas, panes en un terminal terrestre.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas, harina y leña.
Paulina sueña con mejorar su panadería con maquinas modernas y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Banco Cominal Villa Huatatas.

Paulina is married, 58 years old and has 6 children. Paulina has a bakery in her home, a business which she runs everyday with the help of 4 workers. She also sells fruits and breads in the bus station.

Paulina needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fruits, flour and firewood.

Paulina dreams to improve her bakery with modern machines and to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits, flour and firewood

loans.name: Azalias Flat Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA AZALIAS YA QUE ES EL NOMBRE QUE LES GUSTO PARA SU GRUPOLA CINCO INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: AMALIA A. C. QUE TIENE UNA TIENDA D. ABARROTES, FRANCIASCA T. Y CRUZ SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. PESCADO, MIRIAM VEND. ROPA Y ORLANDA VEND. COMIDA.
AMALIA ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS SE LLAMAN GUADALUPE, JUANCARLOS, LUIS DAVID, MIGUEL ANGEL Y TANIA YULIANA. ELLA QUIERE AGRANDAR MAS SU TIENDA YA QUE  EMPESO A VENDER EN UNA MESITA Y POCO A POCO FUE CRECIENDO Y ESPERA CON  EL TIEMPO CRECER MAS, ESTA SEGURA QUE SU NEGOCIA DA MUCHAS GANANCIAS YA QUE VEND. MUY BIEN Y EL TRATO QUE BRINDA A SUS CLIENTES ES D. LO MEJOR PARA ELLA  Y TODOS SUS VECINOS LE COMPRAN.
CON ESTE CREDITO SE QUIERE SURTIR MAS D. MERCANCIA COMO HUEVO, LECHE, CREMAS, PAN, REFRESCO, SABRITAS, CHILES ENLATADOS, AZUCAR, ETC. SU META EN UN FUTURO ES PODER DARLE  UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA A SUS HIJOS  Y SEGUIRLOS APOYANDO EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
DOÑA AMALIA NOS COMENTA QUE LKE GUSTA SU GRUPO POR QUE SE APOYAN Y LE GUSTA LA IDEA  D. TRABAJAR CON FRAC Y KIVA YA QUE EL INTERES ES MUY BAJO Y ELLA SE HA SENTIDO MUY BENEFICIADA Y DA GRACIAS POR AYUDARLA  A QUE SU NEGOCIO SIGA CRECIENDO
texts.en:
This group calls themselves Azalias, because they really like the name. The members of the group and their activities are: Amalia A. C., who has a convenience store. Cruz D. T. Franciasca, who sells fish; Miriam who sells clothing; and Orlando who sells food. Amalia is the representative of the group. She is married and has 5 children: Guadalupe, Juan Carlos, David Luis, Miguel Angel, Tania Yuliana. She wants to enlarge her store and have more things to sell. She started selling from a small table and little by little it grew and she hopes with time to grow even more. She is sure that her business gives good earnings because already she sells a lot. The way she treats her customers is the best and all her neighbors buy from her. With this loan she wants to supply more merchandise such as eggs, milk, cream, bread, refreshments, Sabritas, canned chiles, sugar, etc. Her goal for the future is to be able to give a better quality of life to her children and continue supporting them in their studies. Ms. Amalia tells us that she likes her group because they support her and she likes the idea of working with FRAC and Kiva and because the interest is very low. She feels very blessed and is thankful for the help with her business to continue to growing.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soap, bread, sabritas, milk, eggs, etc. for inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz P. L., es una señora emprendedora, casada con el Sr. Emilio Claros, tienen 5 hijos, de 16, 14,10, 8 y 6 años de edad, viven en la Comunidad de Londo, ubicado en la provincia de Capinota. 

La señora Beatriz es una señora que se dedica a la lechería, cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno, los cuales se encuentran en producción, y de la venta de la producción de leche logra llevar ingresos a su hogar. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de zanahoria, cebolla y papa, productos que la señora Beatriz los comercializa en Santivañez. Londo es una localidad que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Santivañez y Santivañez se encuentra a 1 hora de viaje de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Los hijos de Beatriz son niños pequeños los cuales estudian en Santivañez. Su hijo menor tiene problemas de dislexia, que si bien puede ser tratado, no cuentan con los recursos para pagar un tratamiento para este problema, si bien han encontrado a profesionales que les ayuden no podrían pagar este tratamiento entonces han solicitado un crédito para poder incrementar sus ingresos y lograr pagar sus gastos.

Beatriz ha solicitado el crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado e incrementar sus ingresos, así poder cancelar a especialistas que ayuden a su pequeña hija, si bien no es urgente, pero si necesita que la ayuden a recuperarse.
texts.en:
Beatriz P. L. is an enterprising woman married to Emilio Claros, and together they have five children, ages 16, 14, 10, 8 and 6. They live in the community of Londo, located in the province of Capinota. Beatriz makes a living selling dairy products. She has six heads of cattle to produce the milk, which she sells in order to help the household income. Her husband makes a living in agriculture, harvesting carrots, onion and potatoes, which Beatriz then sells in the town of Santivañez, 20 minutes outside of Londo and an hour from the city of Cochabamba. Beatriz's children go to school in Santivañez. Her youngest son is dyslexic, which can be treated, but they don't have the resources to afford the treatment. While they have found professionals to help their son, they cannot pay for the treatment, which is why they have requested a loan so they increase their income and cover the expenses. Beatrix plans to use the loan to purchase another head of cattle to increase her income. In this way she can pay off the specialists who are helping her young son. While it is not urgent, she needs helps in recovering the expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina C. is from the village of D'Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and is single. Albina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as candies, some food for snacks, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Albina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Albina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.  About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abadacogora Group

texts.fr:
K. Edouard est âgée de 32 ans, il est jeune marié donc il n’a pas encore d’enfants. Edouard est président du  groupe appelle ABADACOGORA, ce groupe travail en commun pour l’expansion de leur business diversifié dont tous font le commerce, il travail six jours la semaine.Edouard lui est vendeur des produit alimentaires qui sont pomme de terre, bananes, haricots.

Edouard et son groupe travail pour augmenter la capacité financière de leur groupe, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business.les bénéfices récoltés après vente de ses produits seront réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon future, un des mebmres est malade ,c'est pourquoi ils sont cinq sur la photo.

Concernant le groupe
Un prêt de groupe signifie que chaque membre prend son montant et l’utiliser pour son propre business, l’avantage est que le groupe garantisse pour les prêts individuels de chaque membre et si un membre ne parvient pas rembourser, tout les membres du groupe remboursent a sa place.
texts.en:
K. Edouard is 32 years old and recently married, so he does not have any children yet. Edouard is the president of the Abadacogora group, which works together to expand their diversified businesses. He works six days a week. Edouard himself sells food products such as potatoes, bananas, and beans. Edouard and his group are working to increase the financial capacity of their group, and to develop their business. In fact, the group has obtained a loan through Amasezerano Community Banking to buy items to resupply their businesses. The profits gained after the sale of these products will be reinvested to maintain the group's financial stability and savings in order to prepare for a successful future. One of the members is sick, which is why only five appear in the photo. Regarding the group: A group loan means that each member takes a certain amount and uses it for his/her own business. The advantage is that the group guarantees the individual loans of its members, and if one member is unable to repay the loan, all the other group members will make up the difference instead.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans. potatoes, maize flour, etc. for retail commerce

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de tortillas se levanta todos los dias a las cuatro y media de la mañana para elaborar sus tortillas ya que desde muy temprano es visitada por sus clientes, vende en su casa de habitacion y tambien sale a vender a diferentes colonias cercanas a su hogar, sale caminando y las vende de casa en casa ya que tiene sus clientes fijos que les vende a la hora del almuerzo.
dependen de ella sus dos hijas de 8 y 13 años las cuales tambien le ayudan a entrgar el producto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

Su esposo trabaja en otro departamento cercano a Tegucigalpa, el trabaja en la agricultura en el Departamento de Olancho y viene cada 15 dias a visitarla a ella y a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Doña Zoila sell tortillas for a living. She gets up at 4:30am everyday to make her tortillas since her customers come very early. She sells them from her home and also, she walks to the different neighborhoods near her home selling door to door because she has regular customers that she sells to at lunch time. She has two dependent daughters, ages 8 and 13, that help her deliver her product. She will use the loan to buy more materials for the production of tortillas. Her husband works in another department near Tegucigalpa. He works in agriculture in the department of Olancho and comes every 15 days to visit her and their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wood, lime, water and matches

loans.name: Ramon Daniel

texts.es:
Don Ramon de 38 años de edad es casado, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus 4 hijos en la Comarca Piedra Pintada.  Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la explotacion ganadera y a la agricultura (siembra de trigo, frijol y maiz), ademas se dedica a la construccion y carpinteria dentro y fuera de la zona para asi obtener ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.   

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar terneros de desarrollo y fortalecer su inventario ganadero.  

El mayor sueño de Ramon es poder consolidar su inventario para poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias del hogar.
texts.en:
Ramon is 38 years old and married. He lives with his family, who are his wife and 4 children, in the Piedra Pintada region. For 25 years, he has worked in livestock-breeding and agriculture (sowing wheat, beans and maize), and has also worked in construction and carpentry in the area and elsewhere. This allows him to earn extra income to support his family. He is requesting his first loan in order to buy young beef cows and strengthen his cattle inventory. Ramon's biggest dream is to make his inventory stronger to be able to offer his family the necessary household conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young beef cows

loans.name: Linda Urania

texts.es: La señora Linda Urania G. es comerciante y se dedica al negocio  de abarrotes en su propio local donde vende dichos abarrotes. Ella tiene  dos  años de dedicarse a este negocio y se esfuerza por mejorar las condiciones de sutienda de abarrotes. Con el crédito comprará los productos para continuar ofertandolos en la tienda de abarrotes y así satisfacer a todos sus clientes que le visitan para la compra de dichos productos.
texts.en:
Linda is a businesswoman who works selling grocery items. She has worked in this business which is a store operating out of her home for two years. She has had ten loans from CEPRODEL and has used all of them to expand her merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as basic grains and for expanding the business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie Q., age 48, and her husband have eight children, five of whom are in school. The couple work hard to cover their daily expenses and provide for their children's education.  For the past ten years Melanie has owned and run a sari-sari store (general store) and small salon providing manicures, pedicures, and massages.  

Melanie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase snacks and other groceries for her sari-sari store in hopes that the additional inventory will help attract more customers and increase her sales.  Loans allow her to buy in bulk, minimizing transportation costs. 

Melanie has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for several loan cycles and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes that eventually proceeds from her store will allow her to fully cover her children's educational expenses. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with no children. She has been operating her retail shop for the last two years. She sells both in a shop and as retail to her neighbors and passers-by.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase maize flour, soap detergents, rice and kitchen utensils. She earns additional income from her pharmacy shop. Transport is a major challenge for her business. She hopes to make more profit and expand her business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to expand her business. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, kitchen utensils and soap detergents

loans.name: Yos

texts.en:
Yos Y. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Y. and her husband are farmers. They grow rice for the family's use. The two children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about USD 5 each per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

The family has to spend USD 78 on food and USD 7 on electricity supply every month. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of land in the village to expand her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to run a business of selling groceries in front of her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land in the village.

loans.name: Kenia

texts.es:
Kenia es una de nuestras microempresarias se dedica a la venta de alimentos comestible, de consumo diario para la elaboracion de las comidas, es una pequeña tienda a la cual, en Republica Dominicana es llamada Colmado y vive en la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenía la necesidad de invertir en su negocio.

Kenia está muy emocionada de recibir su cinco préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 1 años, el cual inició con un pequeño capital que fue ahorrando mientras realizaba otros tipo de negocio. Kenia está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Sacos de Arroz, azucar, harina, habichuelas, entre otros alimentos. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, le gusta leer y su reto mas dificil ha sido estudiar. Su más grande sueño es poder convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Kenia operates one of our small businesses.  She has a store--called a "colmado" in the Dominican Republic--where she sells the common food items that her customers need to make their daily meals.  It's a small store in the city of San Pedro de Macoris where she lives.  The city is famous for its sugar industry and the soccer balls that are made here.  The economy depends on a free trade zone, the cement industry and other activities such as tourism.  Kenia came to us because she needed to invest in her business.

Kenia is really excited to receive this, her fifth Esperanza Internacional loan, after having successfully repaid past loans and making great strides in growing her business.  She started the business a year ago with money that she managed to save while working at another business.  She plans to use this new loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour and beans, among other things.  She will reinvest her earnings in the business.  Kenia likes to read and her most difficult challenge has been to go to school.  She would like to make herself over for a professional career.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents, and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees. 

Christine has been in the tailoring business for 2 years, and she works 7 days a week. She has a retail shop in Mulago market. She also generates additional income by selling fried ground nuts and popcorn. Her main business challenge is transportation.  

Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothing materials.  Her goal for her business is to improve her standard of living by owning an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Somos Un Complemento Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Somos un complemento” es conformado por 22 socias, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Varas. Sus principales negocios son la venta de ropa, frutas y verduras; producción de mermeladas y frutas en conservas; tejidos en telar y servicios de peluquería, terapias y masajes estéticos.  
Verónica, quien en la foto se encuentra en última fila, en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y tiene el pelo corto, se dedica al servicio de manicure y pedicure hace 4 años. Este rubro lo aprendió sola y obtuvo un certificado a través de un curso que tomó por Internet. Con este préstamo comprará los materiales que le faltan para seguir con la construcción de una sala para atender a sus clientes en su casa, ubicada en el patio trasero. También atiende a domicilio. Verónica estima terminar su sala el próximo año. 
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio y mantenerlo en su casa para estar más cerca de sus dos hijas, de 11 y 4 años y cuidar de ellas, ya que el negocio es el principal sustento económico de su familia. 
A Verónica le ha servido mucho el apoyo económico de Fondo Esperanza y también disfruta mucho al compartir con sus compañeras ya que todas comparten el  sueño de surgir.
Puerto Varas es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos, a orillas del Lago Llanquihue. La ciudad se ha destacado siempre por su relación con el turismo, ofreciendo hermosos paisajes naturales, buena comida, playas, parques naturales. También  es conocida como “la ciudad de las rosas”, por la profusión de rosales plantados en sus calles.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Somos un complemento” (We Are the Complement) is made up of 22 members from the city of Puerto Varas.  Their main businesses are the sale of clothing, fruit, and vegetables; production of jams and fruit preserves; weavings, services like hair-dressing, massage, and beauty therapies.  Verónica, who is in the last row, first on the left, with short hair in the photo, has worked giving manicure and pedicure services for the last four years.  She learned this skill by herself and obtained a certificate through a course she took on-line.  With this loan she will buy the materials that she is lacking to continue with the construction of a room to attend to her customers in her house which will be located in the back patio.  She also does house calls.  Verónica estimates that she will finish her room in the next year.
Her dream is to grow her business and keep it in her house so that she can be closer to her two daughters who are 11 and four-years-old so that she can take care of them, as her business is the main source of income for the family.  The economic support from “Fondo Esperanza” (Hope Fund) has helped Verónica greatly and she also enjoys sharing with her fellow members as all share the same dream to grow.
Puerto Varas is a community located in the south of Chile, in the Los Lagos region on the banks of the Llanquihue Lake.  The city has always been known for its tourism, offering beautiful natural landscapes, good food, beaches, and nature parks.  Also, it is known as the city of the roses because of the many rose plants in the streets.

loans.use: Construction materials needed to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna C. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Mirna married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mirna owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mirna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mirna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirna is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mirna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 12 pairs of large hoop earrings, 10 tiger eye rings, 12 animal bracelets, 10 Onyx rings, 12 heart bracelets, 10 anklets and 12 ball chains

loans.name: Ferdinand Njoroge

texts.en:
Ferdinand Njoroge N., 47 years old, is married to Nancy Wairimu and together they have four children aged between 8 and 20. They live in Eldoret. Ferdinand has been selling scrap metal for seven years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES from the business.

This will be Ferdinand's sixth loan from KADET LTD. He has been repaying all his other loans well and he plans to use this entire loan to buy scrap metal to add to his stock. With the income he is going to receive, he plans to add more stock so that he can earn even more income. His dream is to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Léster Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Léster Antonio S. V. trabaja como Guiriza en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 1 año.

Es casado de 39 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 39 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para consumo y compra de materiales de construcción tales como: bloques y piedra cantera.
texts.en:
Léster Antonio S. V. has worked for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year.

He is 39 years of age and married with three children. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Managua municipality all his life. 

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to buy consumer goods and building materials such as cement blocks and slate.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods and building materials

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 1, 2 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Raysa (parada con Blusa azul) es una joven empresaria D. apenas 23 años, una familia conformada por sus padres y algunos D. su hermanos. En una vivienda  propia construida en una estructura simple, techada D. zinc y paredes D. block. Sus planes son seguir esforzándose mientras trabaja desea terminar sus estudios universitarios y así poder formar una familia y ayudar a sus padres en sus necesidades. 

Raysa se dedica a L. venta D. calzados nuevos, en compras al por mayor y por catálogos, lleva ya varios años realizando diferentes negocios, y con L. venta D. zapatos lleva ya 1 año, al mismo pudo invertirle su primer préstamo con Esperanza, en L. actualidad recibe su 2 prestamos. Se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. mercancías al por mayor. 

Raysa pertenece al grupo Mujeres en Esperanza 1, 2 & 5, un grupo formado por 15 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una D. las comunidades D. mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad. Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Raysa (standing in the blue blouse), just 23 years old, is a young businesswoman.  Her family is comprised of her parents and some of her siblings.  Her own house is built as a simple structure with a zinc roof and block walls.  Her plans are to continue putting forth great effort while she works.  She wishes to finish her university studies.  That way she will be able to start a family and help her parents with their necessities.

Raysa sells new footwear. Purchases are wholesale and by catalog.  She has been in different businesses for several years.  She has been selling shoes for one year.  She used her first loan from Esperanza to invest in her business.  She is currently receiving her second loan.  She is very grateful for the loans because she has been able to advance and invest in her business.  She will use her new loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

Raysa belongs to the Mujeres en Esperanza (Hopeful Women) 1, 2, & 5 Group.  The group is comprised of 15 members.  Each one of them works day to day in their business activities in Santo Domingo.  It is one of the communities with scant resources located to the north of the city.


Her story represent the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities.  This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Justina Antonia

texts.es:
Justina, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Arequipa y actualmente Justina vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Justina es la compra y venta de maíz. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Justina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. 

Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justina is 38 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in the city of Arequipa, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity consists in buying and selling corn. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Justina currently needs a loan to buy corn.

Justina is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is currently in a business of selling clothes. She is 38 years old and a widow with 8 children.  All of them go to school. Cicilia asked for a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 34 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco,  Perú. Ella tiene su pareja y tienen cuatros hijos. Actualmente, Victoria vive en la comunidad donde nació.  
Sus actividades económicas principales es la venta de Chicha de Jora, crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos. Ya tiene 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 
Victoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz para hacer mas jora, ella tiene pertenece al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old and was born in Yanahuara community, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, Paru.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  Victoria currently lives in the community in which she was born.  Her main business activities are selling 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink) and raising animals such as hens, guinea pigs and pigs.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well.

On this occasion, Victoria requires a loan to buy corn for making her 'chicha de jora' drink.  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen" community bank.

loans.use: to buy corn for making 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more more books to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
This is Adelina E., 49, a resident of Victoria Reyes, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vicente E., a seafarer. She finished high school and decided to run a rice retailing outlet as a source of income for her family. 

Adelina has been operating a rice retailing business for quite some time now. She buys sacks of rice at a wholesale price and retails the same per kilo with minimum mark up. In the Philippines, almost all Filipinos are rice consumers since rice has always been a part of their daily meals. Serving her local community, Adelina earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more sacks of rice for retailing. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelina always desires a happy and abundant life. She prays that her business will continue to grow and be of help not only to her family but also to her relatives and neighbors. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studied. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice for retailing

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 53 years old, married and has six children. He earns a living from his welding workshop, a business he has run for the past 24 years. His business is able to provide for his needs as well as his family’s needs.

Moses was introduced to KADET by an existing customer. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is his first loan with KADET. With this loan, Moses plans to buy raw material for his welding business including metal rods, screws and iron sheets. 

He wants to see his business grow so that he can educate his remaining two children and also establish another workshop at a different location.

loans.use: To buy welding material like rods and sheets of iron

loans.name: Keysis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keysis, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pan dulce desde hace 7 años, ella tiene 22 años de edad y vive con su madre y tres hermanos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña para hacer las tortillas, también harina, azúcar, levadura, para hacer el pan,  esta inversión ayudara a incrementar la producción en su venta de pan y tortillas.
Su mayor sueño es algún día poder tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Keysis has dedicated herself to selling tortillas and sweet breads for 7 years.  She is 22 and lives with her mother and three brothers.

Currently, she is requesting this loan to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.  She also needs flour, sugar and yeast for making the bread.  This investment will help her increase her production of bread and tortillas.

Her greatest dream is to one day be able to have her own house.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un comedor cerca D. la localidad donD. resiD., Martha prepara ricos desayunos y almuerzos todos los días pues el lugar es muy concurrido D. personas, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela ya que sus platillos son exquisitos y los  venD. a precios accesibles; además el lugar es muy higiénico y ella muy servicial siempre complace los gustos D. la clientela. Para Martha la razón D. su trabajo es su familia es por eso que le pone su mejor empeño y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para sus comidas como granos básicos, plátanos, embutidos, lácteos, carnes, bebidas entre otros. Así siempre satisfacer el paladar D. sus clientes y al mismo tiempo llevara el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 42 years old living with her children in her own house.  She has an eatery near the locality where she resides.  Martha prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches every day because the place is quite busy.  She has acquired many customers because her dishes are delicious and she sells them at accessible prices.  Besides, the place is very hygienic and she is very service oriented and always satisfies her customers’ wishes.  For Martha, the reason to work is her family and this is why she puts her best effort into it.

This is also why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs for her dishes such as: basic grains, bananas, cured meats, dairy products, meats and beverages, among others.  This way she will always satisfy her customers’ taste buds while supporting her home at the same time.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bananas, cured meats, dairy products, meats and beverages.

loans.name: Sarah Ayuma

texts.en:
Sarah Ayuma is 27 years-old and married with four children.  She has been in the grocery business for ten years.

Her store is in a densely populated area and she receives all types of customers.  She needs to boost her  business by buying more stock.  She also wishes to establish a retail shop from the current kiosk and her future dream is to acquire a wholesale shop.  She would also like to educate her children. Sarah is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en Accion se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Capiatá, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Esmeralda, contactó con personas allegadas al programa de mujeres emprendedoras y se informó de la forma de organización del mismo. Después de esto formó y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio para formar su comité. Logró reunir a 19 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el quinto ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria. Ellas se conceptúan como mujeres muy emprendedoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas como ser sandwiches, empanadas, tortillas y otros tipos de comestibles. Se dedica a esto hace ya mucho tiempo por lo que tiene ya un grupo de clientes bien definido. Sueña con un día poder tener un establecimiento propio donde ofrecer sus alimentos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos que ella vende. Piensa que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: The Mujeres En Accion (Women In Action) group consists of an excellent group of women from the city of Capiatá, Paraguay. This is thanks to the work of current general director Esmeralda, who contacted people associated with the women's entrepreneur program and was informed about the organization. After this, she organized her friends and neighbors to form the group. She was able to unite 19 women who work with a lot of passion and are already in their fifth loan cycle jointly and with solidarity. They think of themselves as hard-working women willing to fight for what they want. One of the members is Silvia, who makes a living making and selling food such as sandwiches, empanadas, tortillas and other items. She has done this for a very long time, so she has a solid customer base. Her dream is to one day be able to have her own establishment where she can offer her meals. She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients she needs to make the food she sells. She thinks that the loan will be a big help so she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as meat, eggs, spices and others, to make meals.

loans.name: Ligia Mercedes

texts.es: Ligia Mercedes se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Con mucho esfuerzo es que ha podido continuar con este negocio. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio.  Cuenta con este negocio, el cual poco a poco ha ido sacando adelante, surtiéndolo con lo que ha sido posible para ella, ya que esto es bastante difícil, ya que la mayoría de las ganancias son para su negocio. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como bolsos, calzado, cremas, ropa en general y otros productos.
texts.en: Ligia Mercedes sells general merchandise.  This is not her first loan request.  With much effort she’s managed to stay in business.  She’s been in business for over three years.  She has this business that she’s gradually moved ahead stocking it with whatever she could since this is quite difficult since most of her profits go back into the business.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to be able to buy larger amounts of products like purses, footwear, creams, clothes in general and other products.

loans.use: to buy purses, footwear, creams, clothing in general and other products.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 58 years old, married and has three children.

Hatem has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy two refrigerators and to add more foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators and more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Juliet has a beauty shop that provides haircuts & pedicures. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy materials & beauty products needed for the salon.

Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials & beauty products

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath, 50 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a security guard at school with $2 per day for his income. She has three children. One of her children is studying and the other two are working for $6 per day for all. Every month she has to spend $50 in food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son who is providing a motorcycle transport service. In the future, she hope to buy another motorbike for another of her sons to provide motorcycle taxi service as well because this career can make a good income in her province. She wants to support her last child to study until he finishes at the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to provide motorcycle taxi service

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive con su hijo. Ella venD. ropa D. forma ambulante en diferentes zonas cercanas a la localidad donD. resiD., María venD. todo tipo D. ropa y D. diferentes estilos para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas como faldas blusas, pantalones entre otros; se ha hecho D. mucha clientela después D. años dedicados a esta actividad; últimamente ha notado un incremento en sus ventas dado que a aperturado nuevas zonas D. venta vendiendo a un precio muy accesible, su atención es inigualable; María Luisa es una mujer con ganas D. salir adelante para ella el triunfo surge D. la voluntad y el empeño que se le pone al trabajo, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas etc y satisfacer la demanda D. los nuevos lugares descubiertos que en su mayoria son cantones o caserios es decir lugares en su mayoria rurales y muy alejados D. las ciudades, donD. incluso el transporte es limitado. María Luisa tiene la confianza que D. esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 56 years old, and lives with her son.  She sells clothes as a street vendor in different areas close to where she lives.  María sells all types of clothes in different styles for women, men, boys and girls, such as skirts, blouses, and trousers among other things.  She has many customers after her years working in this business.  Recently, she has noticed an increase in her sales, as she has started selling in new areas.  She has affordable prices, and her level of service is incomparable.

María Luisa is a woman with the desire to get ahead in life.  For her, victory comes from the will and commitment that you put into your work.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, T-shirts, etc. In this way, she can meet the demand from her newly discovered sales locations which are mainly cantons or hamlets, that is to say places that are mainly rural and far away from the cities, where even transportation is limited.

María Luisa has confidence that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 18 years, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing at her business in the Philippines.

Paz is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing items such as pants and blouses to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Badarch

texts.en: Badarch is 60 years old and lives with his wife in a ger -- a Mongolian yurt,  in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. He started his business 11 years ago by planting vegetables and selling them. He runs this business operation in his hometown. In the future, he plans to expand his business. His wife helps him manage the family business. Badarch is a hard-working and diligent man who says "With this bank loan, I want to expand my business. In the future, I plan to open a grocery shop."  He is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to buy a tractor for his business.

loans.use: buy a tractor

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She is vested in her responsibility to look after her family and her dream is to educate her children through the university level.

Margret is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Claudia Marina

texts.es: Claudia Marina tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella con el crédito va comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, talla extra grande, chaquetas, camisetas entre otros. Tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre le solicitan variedad en sus prendas de vestir.  Ella quiere proporcionarle a su negocio todo lo necesario para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos y obtener así más ingresos económicos para su estabilidad económica y bienestar familiar del futuro.
texts.en: Claudia Marina, 43, lives with her husband and son.  She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, and skirts in extra-large size, jackets and t-shirts, among others.  She has a wide variety of customers who always request variety in her articles of clothing.  She wants to provide her business with everything necessary so that her customers will be satisfied to earn better income that way for her economic stability and her family’s future wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts in extra large size, jackets and t-shirts among others.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been running a retail shop for the last five years to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income.  Eunice has been able to maintain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. She has requested a loan of 34,980 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: buy sugar, cooking fat and rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor, un joven soltero de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus hermanos a quienes agradece por brindarles un techo donde vivir. Hace un mes que Nicanor empezó a trabajar como obrero en la localidad de Santa Rosa, él es un joven que le gusta sobresalir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre esta con sus compañeros con quienes comparte momentos de alegría y considera que lo mas difícil es tener que trabajar mucho para poder tener un sustento. Nicanor, en lo futuro desea cumplir con su sueño de tener una granja donde pueda criar cerdos, ya que lo vio que sería un negocio rentable. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal se siente muy contento por haberle dado una oportunidad de poder trabajar juntos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar cerdos, para así poder abrir una granja.
texts.en:
Nicanor is a single 19 year old. He lives at his siblings’ house and feels very grateful because they give him a roof. 
A month ago, Nicanor took a job as a construction worker in the community of Santa Rosa. He is a young man that likes to stand out. What he likes most about his work is that he is always spending time with his colleagues, with whom he shares moments of joy. He also considers that the most difficult thing is having to work hard in order to make a living. 
In the future, Nicanor wants to have a farm to raise pigs, as he thinks this could be a profitable business. This will be his first loan with the institution and he expects help to achieve his goals. He is very happy with his Communal Bank because it has given him and the other members an opportunity to work together. With the 1,000 New Soles he will be able to purchase pigs and thus, to open a farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 31-year-old married lady. Three years ago, she started a small retail business selling bed covers and sheets, and during this time she was able to expand by selling blankets, too.

Now she has a special room in her house decorated specifically for this business, using her connections and her husband's connections. He has a shop to sell curtains; Heba now has a wide customer base in their area and their close neighborhood, too.

Heba has applied for this loan in order to offer more blankets and start separating her business from home by looking for an independent store near by.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for sale.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban, 41, owns a general store in her house in the Baray district. She sells many types of merchandise such as sweet things, snacks, shampoos, biscuits and others. Besides selling, she takes some free to time to distill Khmer traditional liquor (white wine) at home. She is a good mother of three children. She typically earns an average of $3 per day to support her family. 

Ban would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy some feed and piglets to raise in the back of her yard. She will use the balance of this loan to pay for local laborers cultivating and threshing her rice crops. In the future, she hopes to uplift her family out of poverty and to obtain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy some feed and piglets to raise in her backyard.

loans.name: Bariétou

texts.fr:
Bariétou est une femme  âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants tous vont à l’école. L’ainé a 10ans et le 07ans.
Bariétou travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe depuis 2005. Elle vend seule à la maison.
Bariétou a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffe. Elle veut épargner pour démarrer la vente de charbon de bois.. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bariétou voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer une stabilité financière.
texts.en:
Bariétou is a 34-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children who both go to school. The eldest is 10 and the youngest 7 years old.

Bariétou has been reselling firewood since 2005. She sells alone from her home.

Bariétou has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood. She wants to save in order to start up the sale of charcoal.

In the coming years, Bariétou would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure financial stability.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en:
Ake is 57 years old.  She is married and has six children.

Ake owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Ake is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST or $146 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

Ake joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Ake's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia continua en el banco comunal “Fuente de Vida” y su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de muebles de madera para luego venderlos en una feria sabatina o dominical. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Julia continues to me a member of the “Fuente de Vida” communal bank.  She makes wooden furniture and then sells it at weekend fairs.  She’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for her thanks to her dedication.  She needs this loan to buy supplies such as lumber.  She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 45 years old and married with five children. She runs a restaurant that sells food and drinks as her business. She is also involved in cattle fattening, from which she gets her additional income. She joined this business to provide for the family's needs. She needs a loan to buy drinks and chairs to use in her business. Her dream is to educate her children, though she is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy drinks and chairs to use in her business

loans.name: Baba Yusufu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Baba. He is married and has three children, ages 17, 13, and 8. 

In 2000, Baba established his local foodstuff (beans) business. He started doing business to take care of his family's needs and his main customers are adults. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,988,700 every month from this business. 

Baba would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of beans. He hopes that this loan will add to his present stock and increase his profit. 

In the future, Baba plans to own a large farm that will be producing local foodstuff. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for local foodstuff (beans).

loans.name: Asni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Asni, one of Ruma's agents. Asni lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter). She owns a stall where she sells mobile payment service for her community. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to improve her business, as well as give more contribution to her community. 

As the business grows, Asni is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Asni improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Asni is the one who is in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Bethua

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Future Fruits group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Bethua is 40 years old, married and has five dependents. She is educated up to secondary level and she lives in Ole Roimen, Kiserian Town. She is the secretary of this group.

Bethua started her business in 1996 as a sole proprietor. She borrowed before from the groups’ revolving fund and used the money to expand her business. She operates her small shop at the same place she resides. With proper training on business and credit management, from WEEC, she has been able to run her small business well.

loans.use: With the USD 225 she will increase stock and this will attract more customers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Born September 2nd, 1975 in Afagnan village in Lacs Prefecture, Mrs. Marie A. is a single mother of three children. She trades basic grocery items and is one of the first women in her neighborhood to participate in microfinance. Although not highly educated, she quickly gained an understanding of price fluctuations in the different markets she goes to. This understanding allowed her to adjust her own prices according to local purchasing power. She has already successfully repaid her first two loans without difficulty. Today, Mrs. Marie A. seeks a $700 loan to stock groceries and build a real base of trade in the area, increasing her market share. This will allow her to meet her socio-economic needs and will contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 2 Septembre 1975 à Afagnan (Préfecture des Lacs), Madame A. Marie est célibataire et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des denrées alimentaires. Et c’est l’une des premières femmes de son quartier à s’ouvrir au système de microfinance. Un peu instruite, elle arrive à saisir très rapidement les changements de prix des produits au niveau des différents marchés qu’elle fréquente. Ce qui lui a valu l’adaptation de prix à la bourse de la population locale .Elle a déjà réussit à rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans problème. Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Marie sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner en denrées alimentaires et asseoir réellement ce commerce dans sa zone et ainsi détenir le monopole de vente. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins socio-économiques et contribuer à l’épanouissement de toute la famille

loans.use: Acheter et revendre des denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta opened a small store out of her home with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She sells miscellaneous personal care products and kitchen ware. This loan will allow her to start selling children's clothing for which there is a good market in her semi-rural neighbourhood outside the capital city of the San Pedro de Macoris province.

NOTE: Violeta belongs to a Bank of Hope which is a community of five micro-entrepreneurs who receive shares of a communal loan to expand their businesses. Each member of Violeta's group has already received and paid back a loan, demonstrating responsibility and business aptitude. This $750 loan will fund these businesses to expand their new business to increase capital, investment opportunities and savings.

loans.use: Purchase new children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her vegetable stall and start another one

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha Alicia is married and has four children who are19, 23, 29, and 32 years old. Her husband works as a mason, but the income he receives is very low and he missed a few seasons of work. Since Bertha is a entrepreneurial person, she began her own business 15 years ago. She began by selling tamales and a little while later one of her brothers-in-law invited her to sell clothing. This is what she does now, and, little by little and by incorporating a variety of clothing, she has been able to make her business grow.

In order to keep her business growing, Bertha needs a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise that will help her to improve her service and increase her sales. She promises to return the loan in 3 months. Become an important part of the life of this family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Alicia es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 19,23, 29 y 32 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como albañil pero el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo y pasaba algunas temporadas sin empleo, por lo que Bertha como es una mujer emprendedora desde hace quince años inició su propio negocio, comenzó vendiendo tamales y poco después un cuñado la invitó a vender ropa, ahora solo se dedica a esto y ha hecho crecer su negocio poco a poco incorporando más variedad de ropa.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Bertha necesita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con lo que podrá mejorar su servicio e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Suh Emmanuel

texts.en:
The untimely death of Emmanuel’s father left him alone to fend for himself at a very tender age.  At the age of 16 years, he started his business of selling cosmetics and since then, the business has been striving.
