However, profits are not enough to cover his needs, so in an attempt to get more profit, he has decided to increase the business.

Given a loan of $100, he plans to increase his stock and even introduce new items.  The profit raised will be used to pay school fees for his siblings and buy food and medication for himself.
 
He plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, Toiletries

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Mrs.Ngat K. is a widow with five children, two sons and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor who is living in the same village. She started her silk production in 1970. However, during the Khmer Rouge regime, like other Cambodian people she moved to another province and stopped weaving silk. She began her silk production again in 1979. She also purchases silk finished products from other villagers and resells them in the market. Currently, all of her children are living under her roof. One of her daughters is assisting her to weave silk at home. One is sewing clothes. One is planting ginger in the village. Only one of her sons is studying in higher education.

Mrs. Ngat K. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, plus paying for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Noel Eusebio

texts.es:
Noel owns a bakery that supplies bread to local shops. He started the business 15 years ago with a C$10,000 loan from a micro-lender. He starts his day in the La Terminal market, selling bread made in an oven at his house. He and the 4 workers who help him make different kinds of bread. Before he started the business, he used to work with his parents helping them sell bread.

Ceprodel has provided 7 loans to Noel over the last year and 7 months, funds that have helped him improve his quality of life. They've helped him buy medication for his mother who suffers from cancer and improve his business.

Noel now has an established spot in the market with his own stand where he sells wholesale and retail supplies of bread . He's a single father with 1 son in college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio del señor Noel inicia con una panadería el cual colocaba su pan en las pulperías. Actualmente tiene 15 años de tener el negocio el cual lo inicio con un capital de C$10.000.00 producto de un préstamo que hizo en una micro financiera. Inicia su trabajo vendiendo en el mercado la Terminal haciendo el pan en su casa en donde tiene el horno donde trabaja con 4 trabajadores que le apoyan en la elaboración del pan de diferentes tipos, antes de este negocio siempre trabajaba con sus padres ayudándoles a vender el pan.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace un año con 7 meses con un total de 7 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es mejorando su nivel de vida ayudándole a comprar el medicamento de su mamá que padece de cáncer (una enfermedad muy grave) y aumentando sus recurso económicos con mayores ventas y mayores inventarios.

Hoy en día el Señor Noel M. tiene un puesto fijo dentro del mercado con su estante propio en donde vende el pan al por mayor y al detalle. Es padre soltero con 1 hijo a su cargo que estudia en la universidad.

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio works as an artisan making shoes and his wife has a guesthouse near the bus stop for minibus 248 green.

His house is located in the Obispo Bosque zone of La Paz city. This is the third time he has asked for a credit. The money requested will be used to buy leather and lining in order to make shoes.

His working record has permitted him to apply for this credit as he already has experience as an artisan and this employment provides income in order to cover the loan repayments.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Julio trabaja como artesano donde elabora calzados y su esposa tiene una pensión en la parada del minibús 248 verde.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona obispo bosque de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado la compra de cuero y forro para elaborar calzados.

Sus antecedentes de trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como artesano y esta actividad le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and linings in order to make shoes

loans.name: Aura María

texts.es:
Aura María C. is a married mother of 3 children who are all in school. She began her sherbet (ices) business 10 years ago, selling her icy treats on bicycle around the streets of the El Sauce municipality in the city of León.

Today, in order to get ahead and be able to offer her dear children an education, Aura María puts great effort into working every day and despite the exposure to the sun and the physical exhaustion from bicyling, she's been able to succeed in her business.

For 3 years she has been receiving loans from CEPRODEL which have greatly helped her. She was able to buy ice cream for resale and saved money with which she hopes to one day buy her own store where she will sell sherbet.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Aura Maria C. es una madre casada y con 3 hijos de los cuales todos estudian, algunos en la primaria y otros en la secundaria. Desde hace 10 años inició su negocio de venta de sorbetes (helados) realizando sus ventas ambulantemente en una bicicleta donde recorre todas las calles del municipio El Sauce en la ciudad de León.

Hoy en día, para poder salir adelante y brindarle la educación a sus queridos hijos, la señora Esperanza se esfuerza grandemente trabajando todos los días y a pesar de la exposición al sol y el desgaste físico por vender ambulantemente en la bicicleta, ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio.

Desde hace 3 años ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel y según cuenta le han sido de muchísimo beneficio porque ha logrado comprar los helados para luego venderlos y de igual manera ha ahorrado para algún día tener su propio local donde vender los sorbetes.

loans.use: To buy ice cream

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê, who is 55 years old, resides with her husband and her youngest son in the province of Thanh Hóa. Her family's income has always been derived from fishing. In the past, Mrs. Lê's livelihood in fishing has suffered from a lack of capital to purchase the basic equipment that she needed. Now, her fishing business has been profitable after she was able to upgrade her boat. Since Mrs. Lê's monthly income has increased to $200 USD a month, she has used some of her profits to improve the quality of her family's life by purchasing a gas stove and television. Mrs. Lê would like to borrow $400 USD to equip her fishing vessel with more equipment.

Chị Lê Thị Tưởng, 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Quảng Xương. Chị sống cùng chồng và người con út. Kinh tế gia đình chị trước đây gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, nghề đánh cá mang lại thu nhập cao nhưng việc đầu tư cho nghề cũng rất lớn. Chị Tưởng bàn với chồng con và vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương mua công cụ đánh bắt. Có lưới và đồ nghề mới việc đánh bắt đem lại hiệu quả cao hơn rất nhiều, đời sống của gia đình cũng được cải thiện hơn. Chị Tưởng đã sắm được tivi, bếp ga và các vật dụng có giá trị khác trong gia đình. Với thu nhập hàng tháng là 200USD, vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD sắm thêm đồ nghề.

loans.use: Fishing equipment

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Mwajuma M.. She is married and has one child, aged 5 months.

In 2006, Mwajuma established her general store. Mwajuma requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, flour, soap, soft drinks, and other items, in bulk.

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Quý is 34 years old. She and her husband work on their rice paddy. They are hard working people. They also raise pigs and husk rice. Their family income is 300.000/day. She is seeking a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy rice to make noodles.
- Mrs Trần Thị Sự needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs .
- Mrs Trần Thị Lan needs 2.006.000 VND> She sells tomatoes.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Lan needs 2.006.000 VND to buy beans to make chop suy.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Loan needs 2.006.000 VNDto buy feed for her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Quý (MS: 13020009), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị là người đảm đang tháo vát, chị cùng chồng không chỉ làm ruộng, chăn nuôi nhiều lợn mà hàng ngày anh chị còn say xát hang tạ gạo. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000/ ngày. Chị tham gia chương trình với mức vốn vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị Trần Thị Sự (MS: 13020010), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Trần Thị Lan (MS: 13020011), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán cà chua. Chị Nghiêm Thị Lan (MS: 13020012), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua đỗ làm rau giá. Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 13020013), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: buy rice to make noodles

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi A. was born on April 8, 1980 in Abidjan, the capital of the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire. She is married to Mr. Kossi Dzivon who is an auto mechanic in the village of Adétikopé. She has three children and works as a hair-braider in the same village. She began this trade in 2002. She has already received one loan and is now requesting this loan to purchase 5 cases of hair extensions. Her business doesn’t demand a lot of financial input but just know-how in order to earn an acceptable income. She would like to stock up on hair extensions so as to avoid having to deal with frequent price rises for articles whose prices are likely to flare up from one day to the other.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est née le 8 avril 1980 à Abidjan, la capitale de la République de la Côte d’Ivoire. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DZIVON Kossi qui est un mécanicien auto dans le village d’Adétikopé. Elle a trois enfants et est une tresseuse dans ledit village. Elle a commencé par exercer ce métier depuis 2002. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et sollicite actuellement ce prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de fil à tresser. Son activité ne demande pas trop de moyens financiers mais du savoir faire et procure assez de revenus. Elle désire faire le stock de fil à tresser pour éviter de faire face à l’augmentation fréquente du prix des articles qui flambe de jour en jour.

loans.use:
Purchase of 5 cases of hair extensions

Achat de 5 cartons d fil à tresser

loans.name: Claude

texts.fr:
Claude A. was born in 1975 in Afagnan Gbleta, but at present lives in Kpoteme Kpessou. After finishing elementary school, he quit school and went to work. A healthy young man, he is married and the father of children. Today, he manages to feed his family by working the land.

Each year Claude gathers in a granary full of corn, which he later sells. He is applying for this loan at the beginning of the season in order to rent a tractor for plowing and to buy fertilizer. The income from his harvest will permit him to better provide for the needs of his children.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Claude est né en 1975 à Afagnan Gbléta. Il vit actuellement à Kpotémé Kpessou. Instruit de niveau primaire, il cessa les études et renoue avec le labour. Jeune homme vaillant, il est marié et père d’enfants. Aujourd’hui, il arrive à nourrir sa famille grâce au travail de la terre.

Chaque année, Monsieur A. Claude réussit à construire un grenier de maïs qu’il revend après. En début de cette saison, il compte solliciter ce crédit pour louer un tracteur de labour et acheter de l’engrais. Après récolte le revenu lui servira à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Tractor rental and purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
S. Shahodat is 37 years old. She lives in Isfara town and is married with four adorable children. For a long time her husband couldn’t find a job, so he had to leave for Russia to earn money. For the last 6 months since her husband left, she has been the only breadwinner in her family.

Shahodat is a very hardworking and independent woman. For more than 6 years, she has sold dried apricots in the central local market. She is very experienced in this business. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself, with the help of her oldest son. Because she buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means.

All this allows Shahodat to be quite successful and it brings a stable income for her family. Today Shahodat requests 600 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing apricots to dry, and be able to increase the range of dried apricots for selling. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en: K. Shamsiya is 45 years old. Since separating from her husband, she has raised her children alone. To provide for the family, and especially the children's education, she took to drying and remaking apricots. Thanks to Shamsiya's hard work, one of her children is now pursuing his studies elsewhere in the country. The high quality of her products has earned her a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown day by day. Today Shamsiya requests $1000 for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling. The only dream of Shamsiya is to grow her business so that she can keep educating her children. Shamsiya expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Today you have the opportunity to help her make this dream a reality.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Florence G., célibataire sans enfant est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Rural depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme et du citron pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Florence G., single and without children, has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Rural for 2 years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil and lemons to bolster her business. Her earnings allow her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Hamisa R. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Hamisa is married and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12.

Since 2006, Hamisa has been selling traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called vitenge. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with a wax print that is printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings, and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Hamisa works at her business 1 to 4 hours a day and is assisted by her sister.

Hamisa currently earns about $25 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to expand her business by purchasing additional vitenge in bulk, and to diversify her business by purchasing shoes and kanga. A kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its colorful pattern in frames. A kanga is a very useful item because it can be used as as either a wrap-around or a towel. Hamisa thanks you in advance for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitenge in bulk and to buy shoes and kanga in order to diversify her business

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. Ronke is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., age 45, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, age 44, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children attend school, one child is a weaver and the youngest child is still very young and stays at home.

Saroeun has been a silk weaver for 17 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder and rice grower for the last 10 years. He is a horse cart driver as well. 

Saroeun is requesting a loan of 300USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business and part of the loan for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving and for growing rice.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Juan A. tiene 40 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hugo Chávez con su esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 5 años de edad que van al colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en su negocio, el tiene una micelania la cual con mucho esfuerzos ha podido sobresalir con sus ventas, y con ayuda de su esposa, son cinco años lo cual inicio con ahorros y préstamos que  han sido de mucho beneficios para mantener surtida su mecelania, con este es su sexto préstamo,  en donde va invertir en productos de consumos diarios para la demanda de sus clientes. Sus objetivos es hacer su negocio en distribuidora y poder tener mejores ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios, y tener un mejor patrimonio para su familia
texts.en:
Juan A. is 40 years old. He lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood with his wife and two children, who are 17 and 5 years old and are in school. His wife helps him with the business. He has a general store and with much effort he has been able to excel in sales. He began the business five years ago with savings and loans, which have been useful to keep the store well-stocked. This will be his sixth loan. He will invest it in basic goods of daily use, which is what his customers want to buy. His goal is to turn his business into a distributor and thereby have improved income, to help his children finish their studies, and to have a better financial future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic goods of daily use

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en: Saidat says that hair styling is now a part of her. After her two years of training, she finally started her own beauty salon. She also sells hair extensions, styling creams, etc. She hopes for a loan to purchase a generator set to supplement her electricity. She does not want to lose her customers to competitors. Saidat is 30 years old and married with a child.

loans.use: To purchase a generator set.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia V. reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 58 años de edad y su hijo mayor es casado y trabaja. Su negocio es una pulpería que inicio desde hace varios años el cual comenzó con prestamos en Afodenic lleva once ciclos trabajando y han sido de muchos beneficios en su vida personal como en su negocio, con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de su casa de concreto ya que son de madera y esta en mal estado lo que mas ah anhelado es poder tener una vivienda digna y sentirse orgullosa que a pesar de ser una mujer soltera, puede hacer sus objetivos realidad. Con su negocio espera incrementar mas productos de consumo diario para mejorar las ventas a si como captar clientes.
texts.en:
Julia V. lives in Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She is 58 years old, and her eldest son is married and working. Her business is a grocery store she started a few years ago with loans from Afodenic. She has worked through 11 loan cycles, and has had as many benefits in her personal life as in her business. With this loan, she wants to buy construction materials to make concrete walls in her house, as they are currently made of wood and in poor condition. What she wants most is to have a worthy home and feel proud that despite being a single woman, she is able to achieve her goals. In her business, she hopes to increase the amount of consumer goods she sells to improve her sales and bring in more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make concrete walls in her home

loans.name: Elizabeth Kasaya

texts.en: Elizabeth Kasaya O. is a 27-year-old mother of five children aged 10, 8, 6, 2, and 4. All are in school. She is married to a “hawker” who sells small items on the street. Elizabeth, on the other hand, is a farmer and grows spinach, black nightshade and tomatoes. While she lives in Nymasaria, she grows her vegetables outside a small fishing village near Kisumu called Dunga. She hopes she can buy more seeds to grow more and be an intensive farmer – selling more of her vegetables rather than just eating them. She is asking for 10,000 KSH for seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. If she does very well, she says, there is definitely a market for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam A. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur married woman. She runs a café at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different types of food in her café and soft drinks.  The income generated from the business is used to meet her family's daily demands. She plans to extend her business. She needs a loan of 800,000 Tanzania shillings to boost up the business.

loans.use: To invest in cafe

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 34 years old. She is married with three children – one son and two daughters – who are currently in junior high and primary schools. Juliana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the central region of Ghana. 

Juliana’s husband is a commercial driver and she is a trader. She works to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in tubers of yam, which she sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She procures the tubers all the way from Atebubu in the northern sector.

Juliana has been in business for seven years, and is requesting a loan to procure tubers in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Purchase tubers of yam to resell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has owned a small food vendor store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the ajengo B '1' loan group (group code 2016). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Monica is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 18, 15, and 5.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Afila

texts.en: Afila A. is 50 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of five daughters. She started her business in 2001 with the aim to help his husband. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy. Afila asks for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Afila will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Malia Eme

texts.en: Malia Eme L., 66, is a widow with eight children.  She has four years of experience running her store. She sells to the village people and the general public six days per week. She has had six previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166). SPBD loans are Malia Eme’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a new refrigerator for the shop, canned foods and freezers

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 42 years old. She is a married woman with four children who are all in school. Vida has been a retailer for the last seven years and with this business activity, she takes care of her children. She is a very hard working woman and her children love her dearly. She sells cereals such as maize, groundnut, beans and other food items. She buys from the farmers of these crops directly and at a relatively low price. She sells at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. As well, she treks with some of her goods to nearby markets to sell . She says she wants to use the loan to buy supplies of goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a greater number of customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of cereal for resale

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a hog raiser in a village in Cabisera 27 San Antonio Ilagan, Isabela. He would like to request another loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP12000 to further help him raise his hogs. He will use the loan to buy at least two sacks of feed and for the family's needs at home. 

Aside from working as a hog raiser, he also works on his farm. He must work hard so he can provide for the needs of his family.  He hopes and prays that he will again be entrusted with the loan he is requesting.

Avelino is married to Constancia. His four children are: Gemalyn, who already graduated from her teaching course and is now a teacher; the twins, Geraldine and Mary Jane; and Rommel, who just finished the elementary level. His daughter Geraldine wants to pursue her studies in college and become a teacher like Gemalyn. Because of his daughter’s dream, Avelino strives to support her life's ambition, and is encouraged to work harder and to overcome the difficulties of life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando S. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Armando owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling barbecue and balot in the local community. A balot or balut is a fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase men's shirts, rubber boots, rice, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Ho

texts.en: L., 54, is a widowed mother living with two children under a thatch roof while her other two children are married and live separately. This is the second loan for her from HKL and her first Kiva loan. Her family members sell traditional cake to the villagers. They help earn a living to improve the family's living standards. L. buys bamboo from the villagers and splits the bamboo into smaller pieces for making  basket. She has lately decided to take out a loan to invest in her basket-making.

loans.use: to invest in her basket-making

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov C. is 34 years old and resides with his wife in Takeo province. He is a moto-taxi (passenger-carrying motorcycle and trailer) driver who is able to make US$13 in revenue each day. His wife is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables to earn a living. She typically makes less than US$1 per day. This couple has three young children.

Pov C. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to run a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita P., 49, wants her hog-fattening and fishing businesses to become successful. They are the main income providers for her family, and she is requesting a larger amount of loan to finance their growth and sustainability.

Angelita’s husband, Maximo, manages their fishing business while Angelita takes care of their hog-fattening business and also sells her husband's fish. Profits from the businesses have enabled Angelita to send her eldest child to college to take a vocational course. Now, her second child is taking a course in care-giving and her youngest child is in a pre-school. Through her business she hopes to provide for her children's needs and education until they graduate from college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair fishing boat, with a small portion of the loan used to buy piglets

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
60-year-old Clara S. is a tricycle operator in Norala, South Cotabato.  She started her business in 2004.  She is a widow and has six children. One of her children bought the motorcycle and sidecar.  The income Clara receives provides the daily needs of her family.

She’s requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 52-year-old widow with five children. Her children are between the ages of 14 and 22 years old, and all of her children are currently attending school. She resides in and owns a four-room house, where she lives with six people. Teopista also takes care of additional family members. Thankfully, her family has access to electricity and piped water, and they are able to eat three meals per day.

To earn a living, she operates a poultry business. Teopista works seven days per week in a semi-urban area (in the outskirts of Kampala), and she averages approximately 20 customers per day. She explains that she sells to all categories of customers (i.e., retail and wholesale customers), and that she incurs transportation costs when buying chicken feed and feeding trays. Her major business challenges are the ever-increasing prices of chicken feed and chickens in Uganda. She has been in this business for over 20 years, and she has been with MCDT for eight years. Notably, this would be Teopista's twentieth loan via MCDT. Teopista joined MCDT because it was near her home, and because it was an easy organization to work with. She would like to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feed and chickens. She aspires to own 5,000 chickens someday.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional feed and chickens

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married with a child. She is 39 years old.

Joy sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Joy is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana nació  el 28 de Noviembre de 1955 en Villa de Chiantla, Guatemala.  Ahora, tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que ya son grandes y no vive con ella.  

Ella es comerciante y tiene 15 años de haber iniciado su negocio.  Su primer negocio fue una tortillería muy pequeña y con el tiempo, fue incrementando sus clientes ya que les da una buena atención.   Con las ganancias y la ayuda de su esposo, pudo enganchar un terreno. Doña Estefana tambien hacía costuras (trajes, vestidos, pantalones, etc.)

Actualmente, tiene su tienda en su casa llamada “Tienda Buenos Aires.”  Ubicada ahora en la colonia Villa Lobos 2 de Villa Nueva, vende gas, garrafones de agua pura, y abarrotes.  Cuando la ventas son muy bajas, vende comida y haces costuras.

Su meta es poder trabajar un capital propio.  Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa.  Doña Estefana está muy agradecida con FAPE ya que le han brindad un apoyo moral y económico para mejorar su vida.  Tiene 2 años de trabajar con FAPE y lleva 3 prestamos cancelados.  Ahora, necesita un nuevo crédito para invertir en mercadería navideña ya que para esta temporada suben las ventas.
texts.en:
Estefana was born on November 28, 1955, in Villa de Chiantla, Guatemala. She is now 54 years old, and a widow. Her four children are grown and do not live with her. She has been a business woman for 15 years, having begun by selling tortillas, then growing her clientele because of her strong customer service. With her earnings and the help of her husband, she was able to pick up a plot of land. Estefana is also a seamstress (suits, dresses, pants, etc.). She operates her store, known as "Tienda Buenos Aires," out of her home, located in the Villa Lobos 2 section of Villa Nueva. She sells soft drinks, bottled water, and groceries. When sales are down, she sells food and makes clothing. Her goal is to have some working capital. Her dream is to finish building her house. Estefana is very grateful to FAPE, an organization that has given her moral and financial support to improve her life. She has worked with FAPE for 2 years, and has paid off three loans. She now needs another loan to buy Christmas merchandise, since sales are up during the season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sales of water and gas

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en:
Lesa I. is 45 and married with 8 children (ages 2 - 29).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lesa has many years of experience in this business.  Lesa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 tala or US $146 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Lesa joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lesa I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.66 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bonie

texts.en:
Bonie B. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Bonie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Bonie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bonie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his seventh from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, who loves and hopes to excel in her business, sells frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. Grace is the married mother of four children, her youngest just three years old. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda farms to earn a living. She has two children and her oldest child is 15 years old. She helps her husband work at the farm; she makes sure it is free of weeds and pests so that rice crops can grow healthy on the land. Sometimes, she also sells food at the school canteen. She said that it’s really hard to keep up with the school fees of her children, so she has to find ways to earn money. 

Merlinda is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Merlinda’s farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Juanita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling candies, some snack foods, eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 40 years-old and lives with her two children and mother in Zavhan province, Mongolia in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children haven't yet reached school age, and her mother is retired. 

During the day, Tuvshinjargal manufactures wool and bead products in her town. She produces a variety of products for sale including wool hats, shoes, sacks, souvenirs and carpets for her many customers. In addition, she makes wall pictures made of beads. Tuvshinjargal has been operating her business since 2005 and has steadily expanded her business. Originally, her profession was as an accountant and food technologist. Tuvshinjargal has very good communication skills and is focused on the future. She says, “I am working hard to create financial security for my family.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~ 212 USD) loan to purchase untreated wool for her business.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida por sus festividades religiosas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de reparación de automóviles en un pequeño taller ubicado en la zona donde vive, allí atiende todos los dias a los diversos clientes que acuden al lugar para que solucione los problemas que tienen con sus unidades móviles, el trata de realizar su trabajo con mucha responsabilidad y eficiencia para que sus clientes le sigan otorgando su preferencia.

Debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando su taller muchos de los instrumentos y herramientas con la que realiza su trabajo se estan deteriorando y ya no pueden ser utilizadas, por ello Julio se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de herrammientas para reeemplazar las viejas y seguir implementando su taller.

Julio es una persona que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, por ello trata de brindarle mucha dedicación para así progresar poco a poco, su mayor anhelo es formar una empresa de venta de repuestos para automóviles. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julio is a family man of 50 years of age, who lives with his wife and children in the Motupe district. This area is known for its religious festivals, and is located in the Lambayeque province, about 1½ hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, he has dedicated himself to providing auto repair services from a small workshop in the area where he lives. There, he tends to customers very day who seek him out for help with their mechanical problems. He aims to carry out his work with great care and efficiency so that his customers continue to choose him for their repair needs. Given the amount of time he has been in business, his tools are deteriorating and can no longer be used. For this reason, Julio finds himself having to appeal to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles. He plans to invest the loan into purchasing new tools to replace the old ones, and therefore be able to more efficiently continue with his work. Julio is a person who very much enjoys his line of business and, because of this, he has given it a great deal of dedication so it will continue to grow. His greatest wish is to start an enterprise selling replacement car parts. He has worked with our institution previously, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility from the moment he assumes his installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Central Tinke Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CENTRAL TINKE”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito D. Ocongate, provincia D. Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. OCTAVIA,  ella tiene 27 años D. edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos D. 7 años el varoncito y la mujercita D. 5 años, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes en la cual venD. productos básicos, verduras, frutas y bebidas D. todo tipo; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. más variedad D. productos.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, en un 80 % se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería, el restante tiene diferentes actividades, restaurante y tienda abarrotes. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “Central Tinke”. They live in the Ocongate district in the Quispicanchis province in Cusco department. Our member is Mrs. Octavia. She is 27, married and has 2 children: her son is 7 and her daughter is 5. She alternates her work at home with her retail business. Octavia has a small general store where she sells basic foodstuffs such as vegetables, fruit and all types of drinks. Our member is asking for a loan to purchase a larger variety of products. The members alternate their activities with retail businesses. 80% work in agriculture and animal husbandry. The rest have different types of businesses, restaurants and general stores. They are asking for a loan to reinvest in their different businesses. The members appreciate and value the support given them in this manner and promise to complete their loan payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for a loan to purchase a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Luz Karina

texts.es:
Luz Karina pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de Ollantaytambo, tiene 27 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente,  su actividad económica principal de la socia es vender bebidas alcohólicas como por ejemplo chicha y cerveza. Ya es un año que está en el negocio y le va muy excelente. 

Luz Karina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella requiere el préstamo para implementar la cantina. 

Luz Karina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Karina, 27, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” communal bank. She is single and has two children. Her main commercial activity is the sale of alcoholic beverages like chiha (made from fermented corn) and beer; she has been in this line of work for a year and does very well. Luz Karina is a hard-working, enterprising person who is always looking for opportunites to get ahead in life and, through her own efforts, raise her children. She is asking for funds to equip her pub. Luz Karina is grateful for the opportunity provided though this means and pledges to repay her loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip her pub.

loans.name: Madzdi

texts.en:
Madzdi T. is from the city of Sta. Cruz Baybay Ozamiz City. He is 34 years old. Madzdi is married. To make a living, Madzdi owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothes in the local community. Madzdi has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Madzdi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madzdi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Madzdi is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Madzdi from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with five children and all her children go to school.   Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She owns a bar selling all types of drinks such as beer and local gin.  She  buys crates of beer from delivery vans and local gin from suppliers who get it from villages.  

Margaret wants to  use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Besides this bar business she also owns a restaurant which adds to her income. Her customers are the local people. 

Margaret works seven days a week. Her business challenges include debtors and thieves. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university.  She decided to work with MCDT to get additional capital. Margaret resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina tiene 33 años está casada con el señor Damián Rocha y juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12,8 y 1) años, hace tres años atrás el esposo sufrió un accidente de tránsito, el trabajaba de chofer realizando viajes nacionales a diferentes ciudades del país trasportando cargas, donde hubo 3 muertos y varios heridos, ellos tuvieron que pagar todos los gastos y por lo tanto perdieron todos sus ahorros que tenían para pagar del lote y construir su propia casa.

La señora Martina y su familia viven en la ciudad de COCHABAMBA provincia CHAPARE en una casa en alquiler donde solo cuenta con dos habitaciones, una habitación la usan los padres y en otra los tres hijos. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, produce papa, locoto (ajillo) y haba verde, también se dedica al comercio de frutas (mandarina, naranja, manzana entre otros).

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas y abonos, para la producción de papa y haba verde.
Entre sus sueños y metas es tener su casa propia, ya que después del accidente su esposo no trabajo durante unos años, ya después superado ese trauma empezó a trabajar y van ahorrando poco a poco para ofrecer una casa cómoda a sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Martina is 33-years-old and married to Mr. Damián Rocha. Together they have 3 children (12,8, and 1 years old). Three years ago her husband suffered a car accident. He worked as a driver for national trips to to different cities in the country, transporting cargo. Three died in the accident and various people were wounded. Martina and Damián had to pay all the expenses and they lost all of their savings that they had to buy a lot and build their own house. Martina and her family live in the city of Cochabamba in the province of Chapare in a rented house where they only have two rooms. The parents use one room and the three children use the other. Her main activity is agriculture. She grows potatoes, garlic, and beans. She also sells fruit (mandarins, oranges, and apples, among others). The loan will be used for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for the production of potatoes and beans. Among her dreams and goals is having her own house. After the accident her husband didn't work for some years, but after he recovered from the trauma he began to work again, and, little by little they're saving up to offer a comfortable home to their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes and beans

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio C.  vive en el sur occidente de la ciudad del Barranquilla, se dedica a comercializar desde una vitrina donde vende en un local del centro, llamado San Andresito, tradicionalmente conocido por que es un lugar donde se comercializa mucha mercancía extrajera, como  electrodomésticos y en ese sentido todo lo que tiene que ver con tecnología de punta; él es  casado y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 21 a 30 años.

Desde 1984 se dedicó a la venta de relojería y también a su mantenimiento, posteriormente agregó calculadoras, radios, televisores, surtidos de baterías y accesorios; en la actualidad, agregó nuevos equipos de sonidos para vehículos, bafles amplificadores, plantas eléctricas. Este es su segundo crédito  a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior José Antonio  surtió con mas precisión su negocio, porque le permitió tener un capital de trabajo adicional, con el que compró de contado y adicionó cámaras que antes no vendía, de esta manera sus ganancias aumentaron  y logró beneficiar mas  a su hogar,  porque puedo darse algunos gustos  y eso siempre aporta a momentos de felicidad; todo ello sin dejar de mencionar  el importante aporte que hace su hija pues ella también trabaja y ayuda al sostenimiento del hogar. Con su credikiva solicitado, comprará celulares de mayor tecnología, así como  de MP4 y MP5 y radios con DVD para vehículos.

Su meta es siempre invertir en lo que tenga mayor utilidad y que a el le de satisfacción el venderlo y cumplir con sus compromisos económicos con mucha responsabilidad. Su desafío ahora es aumentar su utilidad para ayudar a su hijo a estudiar y que en un futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en:
José Antonio C. lives in southwest Barranquilla. He has a display case in a downtown location, called San Adresito, which is known for being a place where lots of imported items, like home appliances and state-of-the-art electronics, are sold. He is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 30. Since 1984 he has sold clocks and watches and has provided repair services as well. Later, he added calculators, radios, televisions, batteries and accessories to his stock. Most recently, he added new sound equipment for vehicles, loudspeakers, power plants. This is his 2nd loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He used his previous loan to stock his business. He was able to pay cash for the merchandise and add cameras to his stock, something he hadn’t sold previously. This led to higher profits and still more benefits for his home; he was able to provide a few treats for the family and this always means moments of happiness. He wants to make it clear that all this is possible thanks to the help he gets from his daughter who also works and contributes to the household support. With his Kiva loan he will buy more technologically advanced cell phones, like MP4s and MP5s as well as car radios with DVDs included. His goal is to always invest in items that are most profitable and that he get satisfaction from selling them and meeting his financial obligations in a responsible manner. His challenge now is to increase his profits so that he can help his son with his schooling so that his future will be more successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy technologically advanced cell phones, like MP4s and MP5s as well as car radios with DVDs included.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie S. is a young mother who aims to become successful someday by increasing her fishing business while her husband closely works with her as a fisherman. They work together for the future of their family. Lorie is thankful to ASHI, for through the loans they have provided since 1998, she has been able to support her fishing operation by purchasing a motor boat, fishing net, and other tools of her business. She is hoping to raise more fish to sell in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI and Kiva. 

Because a lack of business capital encouraged her to look for financial support from KIVA lenders, Lorie will be glad when her loan request is granted; she will utilize the loan wisely by purchasing an additional fishing boat and fishing net. Lorie’s hard work and patience are her foundation in bettering her family's life.  

The income she gets from the business is very helpful in supporting the business itself and meeting the needs of her family, especially in providing school allowances for her three children. She hopes that someday she will be able to expand her fishing business further. She is glad for the secured opportunity of taking this loan and for your support and encouragement. Lorie hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing boat and net

loans.name: Lee's Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people make up a village loan, Mrs. Lee C., age 53, is the village bank president, having been selected by its sixteen members. This group is located in Tranh village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Lee C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. 

Mrs. Lee C. is a widow with four children: One is a government worker, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the other is a student in the local school and also helps the mother on the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 37 years old and married with two children. He operates a retail shop where he sells cereals. He was previously employed. He also works in a quarry to supplement his family’s income. He has become more focused on his business since he joined the Dam Group of Faulu Kenya. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals. He hopes to expand his shop and open more shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean R., 49, is married and lives with her husband and three childR. in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She is a housewife and her husband earns about $3 a day by selling firewood. Each month, the family spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, and $0.5 on their childR.'s education. R. is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy a tuk-tuk (or motorized rickshaw) so that her son (who we see here in the photograph) can start a business as a driver. The family plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to repair its house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a tuk-tuk or motorized rickshaw

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
A true animal lover, Mike began working with animals at a young age. After earning a degree in Animal Care in England, he joined the Ringling Brothers Barnum and Bailey Circus as head elephant trainer. Many cities and towns later, Mike moved to California and switched to horses. 

Today Mike drives from farm to farm as a farrier, a blacksmith who specializes in horse care. His business is about three years old and very busy. Horses need new shoes every 5-8 weeks, and with a limited number of farriers in the area, Mike is constantly responding to calls. 

After his bank told him that his loan request was too small, Mike was referred to Opportunity Fund. "The loan process at Opportunity Fund was way easier than I thought it would be."  Mike will use a $10,000 loan to purchase a customized farrier trailer to transport his equipment from farm to farm. "This way, if my truck breaks down, I won't miss a day of work."

loans.use: To purchase a customized farrier trailer to transport horseshoeing equipment from farm to farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam S. est une femme mariée de 34 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (région de Sikasso). 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des fruits et légumes tels les bananes.  Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 9 ans, ce qui explique sa  bonne maîtrise cette  activité. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans la commune de Sido et dans les ses villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Sido est une commune rurale située à 25 kilomètres de Bougouni. Elle a appris cette activité dès son âge auprès de sa cousine.
Après des prêts solidaires avec une association de son quartier, elle décide de venir au prêt individuel et est à son quatrième, après avoir remboursé correctement tous les prêts antérieurs. Depuis maintenant six ans cette femmes collabore  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter puis vendre des bananes dans les différents quartiers et marchés de aussi bien que devant la mairie  de la commune urbaine de Bougouni.
Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam S. is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni (Sikasso region). 

She abandoned school early on in favor of income-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables such as bananas. She has been in this business for more than 9 years, which explains her good command of this activity. She gets her supplies from producers in the community of Sido and in surrounding villages. Sido is a rural community located 25 kilometers from Bougouni. She learned this business at a young age from her cousin.

After a few solidarity loans with an association in her district, she decided to get her first individual loan. This is her fourth individual loan, after having successfully repaid all previous loans. This woman has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for six years now.

She plans to use her loan to buy and then sell bananas in different districts and markets and also in front of the town hall of the urban community of Bougouni. With this loan, Mariam hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs. With these profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bananas

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin owns and runs Aric electronics shop.  He started this business which is located in a very competitive environment two years ago.  In his shop, he also does repairs on electrical appliances.  

Being a member of Genesis group in Faulu Kenya, he has been guaranteed a loan of 30,000 KES by the members.  He will use the loan to buy a welding machine and a work station machine.  Edwin hopes to have an electronic workshop and become financially independent in the future.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and a work station machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase onions, cooking oil and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada A. is 62 years old and married with six children. She is from the town of Trinidad. To make a living, Conrada owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Conrada joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Conrada is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Kumari is passionate about helping others discover, plan for, and achieve what they want in their lives. By starting her own small business, ‘A Coach for Success,’ Kumari has found a way to turn that passion into a career. 

Kumari has been coaching individuals for over 30 years. Her unique coaching style, now embodied in A Coach for Success, draws on Kumari’s education in Holistic Heath Education, experiences working with social service agencies, and lessons from her own process of self-discovery. A Coach for Success has been Kumari’s side project while working a full-time job with a nonprofit organization in Richmond, CA, but she is now ready to take the plunge and invest herself fulltime in her business. 

Kumari currently coaches 20 clients, teaches workshops in the community, and speaks at events. Being her own boss – with full control of her own schedule – will allow her to be a more effective coach, as well as reach out to more individuals. She has found over the past few years that her workshop and coaching style are particularly timely. Perhaps due to the economic recession, Kumari explains that, “People feel like they need to look at their life right now. I ask them: What do you want? Why? What’s stopping you?” 

Even so, Kumari explains that marketing is the most challenging part of owning her own business; “Transformation isn’t often something that people want to go through.” To help promote her business she needs products – such as stories, greeting cards, tapes, and more workbooks- to accompany her workshops and speaking engagements. With a $2,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, Kumari will be able to develop these products, increase other advertising efforts, and at last take her business to the next level. 

To learn more about A Coach for Success, visit: http://acoachforsuccess.com

loans.use: To develop products such as cards, tapes, and workbooks to accompany her workshops; other advertising costs

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 26 years old, married and has two children who are one and five years old. She is also raising two orphans who she has adopted. For the last seven years, Louise has made a living as a tailor, making clothing for both men and women who live in her area and school uniforms for children. She has three sewing machines, employs two people and works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. She also trains young girls and boys who have been unable to attend school so they will have a marketable skill when they grow up. Louise has applied for this loan to buy more sewing materials for her workshop.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials for her workshop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 30 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros, en compañía D. su esposo y sus dos hijos Brayan y Adriana. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos D. limpieza, que inicialmente era D. su padre, quien al fallecer ella tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Actualmente su hermana Yolanda es quien esta al frente D. la venta D. estos productos, pues ella acaba D. dar a luz a su hija Adriana, solo espera el tiempo necesario para retomar el trabajo, aunque no deja D. continuar invirtiendo en la compra D. más mercadería. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que desD. muy pequeña apoyaba a su padre en las ventas, y considera que es un trabajo muy rentable,  además algunos productos D. limpieza como el jabón, detergentes, escoba, escobillas;  no tiene fecha D. vencimiento, por lo que no se aflige D. su rápida venta.  Lo que más desea Rosa es ampliar su negocio con diversa mercadería. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que valora el beneficio D. este negocio en su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita desea incrementar con productos novedosos en limpieza para así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 30 years old, lives in her in-laws' home with her husband and two children, Brayan and Adriana. She makes her living with a business selling cleaning products.  The business was initially her father's, but when he passed away, Rosa had to take it take over.  Because Rosa just gave birth to her daughter Adriana, her sister, Yolanda, is currently in charge of selling their products.  Rosa is only taking the necessary leave before she takes up the business again.  Even so, she hasn't stopped investing in the purchase of more merchandise.  She likes what she does, especially since she helped her father with the sales even as young girl.  She considers the work to be very profitable.  In addition, some of the cleaning products, like soap, detergents, brooms and brushes, don't have expiration dates, so she doesn't need to worry about selling them quickly.  What Rosa wants most is to expand her business with varied merchandise.  This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time.  She values the benefit of MFP in her business.  With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to increase her merchandise with novel cleaning products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase novel cleaning products.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda de 47 años de edad es casada, tiene 3 hijos: Hector de 28 años que trabaja en el EMPA, alexander de 26 años trabaja en la UNAN, ambos le apoyan con los gastos del hogar; y el menor Jader de 9 añitos que estudia la primaria; Doña Zenayda labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace veintitres años actualmente se desempeña como Responsable del Cementerio Municipal de esta ciudad, ha superado los oabtaculos de la vida con puro sacrificio, desempeñando de lo mejor su trabajo con dedicacion y con creditos que hasta la fecha ha asumido con respondabilidad.  

Solicita por tercera vez el apoyo de Kiva a quien agradece desde ya por esta gestion brindada, requiere credito con el objetivo cambiar el techo de la casa antes que entre el invierno.  

Su mayor sueño es reparacion total de la casa, el cual pretende lograr poco a poco, siendo este el patrimonio que le dejará a sus hijos.
texts.en: Zenayda, 47, is married and has three sons: Hector, 28, works for EMPA and Alexander, 26, works for UNAN. They both contribute to the household expenses. Her youngest son, Jader, is 9 years old and in primary school. Ms. Zenayda has been working for the city government of Juigalpa for the last 23 years, as a caretaker for the municipal cemetery. She has overcome life's obstacles through pure sacrifice, performing her work as best she can, and through taking out loans, which she has done responsibly so far. She is requesting support through Kiva for the third time and she is grateful for the guidance she has been offered. She needs this loan in order to replace the roof on her house before winter starts. Her greatest dream is to repair her entire house, which she has been trying to do little by little, as this will be the legacy she leaves for her sons. [To see Zenayda's previous Kiva loans, click here and here.]

loans.use: to replace the roof on her house before winter

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Alicia es la venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Alicia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras. 

Alicia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alicia is 30 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in selling vegetables at the city market of Urubamba. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Alicia currently needs a loan to buy vegetables.

Alicia is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He had been selling air conditioners and repairing damaged ones for more than 14 years. Then he decided to open his own shop in 2000.  He also performs maintenance on some home appliances such as washers, dryers etc. He represents the main income provider in the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed products and tools for his shop. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase products and tools for his shop

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira P. Jiménez 
2011-66
250,000

Yadira P. Jiménez  tiene 43 años es madre de una niña de 5 años, vive en el Asentamiento El paraíso en la Virgen de Sarapiqui, Provincia de Heredia, Costa Rica. Junto a su esposo Marvin Zumbado trabajan una parcela agrícola donde simbran entre otro productos Pimienta y granos básicos, además de criar gallinas. La clienta ya había solicitado un crédito anterior para compra de pollos engorde, el cual pago sin ningún contartiempo.

Este nuevo préstamo se va a utilizar para la compra de cerdos para engorde y alimentación y productos para la salud de los animales, para dos ciclos de 6 meses cada uno. 
Al final de cada uno de los ciclos espera abonar la cuota respectiva y comprar más cerdos y los demás productos para completar un nuevo período de crianza, con una mayor cantidad de animales, que le generen mayores ingresos.
  The land Yadira and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario, which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through the IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing. Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of startup capital. Fundación Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as startup capital for investment in various productive activities.

As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for the pigs to grow to a profitable value, Yadira will not be required to make immediate repayments, as outlined in the repayment schedule.
texts.en:
Yadira P. Jiménez is 43 years old and has a 5 year-old daughter.  She lives in El Paraíso settlment, in Virgen de Sarapiqui, in Heredia province, Costa Rica.  Together with her husband, Marvin Zumbado, Yadira works on a plot of farmland where she grows, amongst other crops, pepper and basic grains.  This client has already taken a previous loan to buy chickens to fatten and she paid it back without any problems.

Yadira will use this new loan to buy pigs to fatten.  She will also buy feed and products for the health of her animals for two cycles of 6 months each.  At the end of each cycle, she hopes to make her loan repayment and buy more pigs and more of the other products in order to complete another rearing cycle with a larger quantity of animals that will make her more income.

The land Yadira and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario, which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through the IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing.
