Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of start-up capital. Fundación Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as start-up capital for investment in various productive activities.

As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for the pigs to grow to a profitable value, Yadira will not be required to make immediate repayments, as outlined in the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and enough feed for her animals for two cycles

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de internet y también se dedica al trabajo como agente de seguridad en el seguro social del cusco, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar el negocio de internet.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 26, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank located in Urcos District which belongs to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

He is single and alternates his daily chores with and Internet access business; he also works as a Security Guard at Cusco Social Security.  He wants to expand and improve his Internet access business and needs a loan to set it up.  He is happy about the loan and commits to repay his installments.

loans.use: to set up his Internet access business.

loans.name: Gulbiyo

texts.ru: Суфиева Гулбиё проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 38 лет. Она вдова, имеет троих детей. У нее средне - специальное образование, товаровед. Она в основном занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания. В этой области уже 10 лет. Ее дети учатся, а старший сын помогает ей в её деятельности. Она просит кредит для покупки масла, муки и конфет. То есть для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Gulbiyo S. lives in Dangara. She is 38 years old, a widow, and has three children. She has a vocational education as a sales manager. She trades in the market. She has a shop where she sells foodstuffs. She has been doing this work for ten years.  Her children go to school, and the eldest son helps her at work.  She is asking for a loan to buy oil, flour and candy. This will increase the variety of goods she is able to sell.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour and candy

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated an open air food market business, selling from home to her neighbours and public motor vehicles drivers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of improving her living standards in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna de 50 años, vive con su esposo Pedro. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive con uno de ellos, Jhon, en su acogedora casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Tapo. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, un buen día se dio cuenta que unos amigos se dedicaban a esta actividad y obtenían buenas ganancias, así  decidió empezar en este rubro, pero a pesar de su edad no dudo en trabajar. Al tiempo se casó, continuando en este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, y después de un tiempo empezó a ayudarle también  su hijo mayor: Desde entonces cada día se dirige a comprar verduras en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para venderlos al por menor,  obteniendo ganancias liquidas ya que el negocio le es muy rentable y no tiene mucha  competencia, además ya tiene clientes conocidos. Por otro lado comercializa sus propios productos que siembra, como: papa, habas y hortalizas, que cosecha en cada temporada. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de 11 vacas que tiene con lo que realiza queso, un promedio de 7 a 6 moldes diarios. También a la crianza de 18 carneros los cuales engorda y lleva a venderlos a los carniceros y pobladores de la localidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a ser puntual, como siempre lo ha sido en cada uno de sus pagos ya que quiere seguir trabajando con su banco comunal compuesto por personas muy organizadas y trabajadoras. Reyna, comenzará su sembrío de arveja, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “canchan”.
texts.en:
Reyna, 50, lives with her husband, Pedro.  They have 8 children but only lives with one of them, Jhon, in her cozy house located in Tapo.  She has sold vegetables for the last 30 years.  One good day she realized that some friends who were in this occupation earned good profits so she decided to go into this line of work.  Despite her age, she did not hesitate to work.  In time, she married and continued in this business with help from her husband and after some time her oldest son started helping out too.  Since then, she heads out to the city’s wholesale market every day to buy vegetables to later resell at retail obtaining net profits since the business is quite profitable and she does not have much competition.  

On the other hand, she also sells the products she grows herself like potatoes, broad beans and leafy vegetables that she harvests each season.  In addition, she raises 11 cows that she has and makes six or seven cheeses daily on average.  She also raises 18 lambs that she fattens up to then sell to butchers and local residents.

She belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Tapo” (Holy Cross of Tapo) communal bank and this is the sixth loan with MFP where she commits to be punctual, as she’s always been, with each payment because she wants to continue working with her communal bank which is composed of very organized, hard working people.

Reyna will start her pea planting so will use the requested money to buy two bags of pea seeds as well as several sacks of organic manure to spread among her crops of “Canchan” variety of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: La Rivera Group

texts.es:
Susy Anahi D. 43 años D. edad vive en L. distrito D. Huancayo Perú, socia D. L. alcancía comunal L. rivera, es madre soltera con dos hijos menores, Raúl D. 10 años y Geraldine D. 6 años, L. socia  se dedica a L. venta D. Comida desD. hace 2 años y anteriormente tenía una tienda que no le generaba muchos ingresos, ahora elL. venD. comida y bebidas en L. puerta D. su casa todas las tardes, L. socia agradece mucho a sus hijos por el apoyo condicional y moral que le ayudan para L. venta todas las tardes y asi genera sus propios ingresos y ahorro para los gastos del hogar.  El Préstamo es para L. compra D. arroz, Aceite, azúcar para su negocio. L. socia esta en L. primera fiL. lado derecho con chompa color verD. pantalon jean color azul. L. que no estuvieron son edeli, ana isabel,magaly angelica estan en orden al costado D. L. foto por las socias trabajan.
El Préstamo es  D. s/. 1000.00 Nuevo Soles
texts.en: Susy Anahi, 43, lives in the Huancayo District in Perú.  She is a member of the communal bank "L. Rivera", and a single mother of two children, Raúl, age 10, and Geraldine, age 6.  She has been in business selling food for two years.  Before, she ran a store that did not generate much income, so now she sells food and beverages in the front of her house in the afternoons.  She is very grateful to her children for the unconditional moral support they give her every afternoon so she can generate an income and cover household expenses.  The loan will be used to buy rice, oil and sugar for the business.  The member is the one on the right in the first row, with the green sweater and bluejeans.  The group members who were not present are Edeli, Ana Isabel, and Magaly Angelica who are pictured to the left of the larger photo.  The loan is for 1,000 PEN.

loans.use: To sell food and other items.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 40 years old and married. Her husband operates a rickshaw through which he provides transport services to the passengers. Shameem is a caring lady who stays at home to carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. Shameem is the mother of three sons and two daughters. She couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. Her two elder sons do jobs and the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new rickshaw that will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. He will rent his old rickshaw, which will earn him extra income every month. He has been operating his transport business for the past 20 years and Shameem is hopeful that her family’s financial condition will be improved as a result of the loan. 

Shameem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Dorotea, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children.  The youngest is in college. She has been running a doughnut business for 30 years now. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 6th "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to pay school fees and buy few kilos of baking flour for her business and for household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy 50 kilos of baking flour, 30 kilos of sugar, a sack of charcoal and a bucket of cooking oil to make more doughnuts.  Her dream is to one day start a chicken business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Jitegemee" which has a total of 13 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of baking flour, 30 kilos of sugar, a sack of charcoal and a bucket of cooking oil to make more doughnuts.

loans.name: Brigida Nancy

texts.es:
Brigida  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene educación superior incompleta.
Desde hace ocho años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta al por mayor de granos de la Región.  En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de chifleria (peines, hojas de afeitar, tijeras, cortaúñas, pilas, etc).
Con este nuevo préstamo de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, aumentará al capital de su negocio y comprará mercaderías como champú en frasco, detergentes de todo tamaño y otras mercaderías, para implementar el negocio.  Ella cuenta con la ayuda su esposo, quien vende telas en la ciudad de Cusco por temporadas.
Su sueño es tener una tienda bien surtida y ser mayorista.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el compartir con las socias y las bromas.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Communal Bank “Niño Jesús de Praga” which is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children. Brigida did not finish her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and invested in her business of selling regional grains in bulk. At the moment, she sells personal accessories such as combs, razor blades, scissors, nail clippers, batteries, and other items.

With this new loan of 300 PEN, Brigida will increase her business capital for buying merchandise such as bottles of shampoo, detergents in all sizes, and other merchandise to keep her business in operation. She receives help from her husband, who sells fabric in the city of Cusco on a seasonal basis.

Her dreams are to have a well-stocked store and to become a wholesaler. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings, being able to share with the other members, and the fun atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, detergents, and other types of merchandise.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, aged 53, is married to Peter and they are blessed with eight children aged between 18 and 36 years. She runs a retail shop that has been operating for three years.The business earns her a monthly profit of KES 6,000.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, maize, and wheat flour for resale.

Priscilla intends to buy a tractor using the expected profits and hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family in future.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Sarah Mae

texts.en:
Sarah Mae  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single and has 2 children. 

Sarah Mae  has a retail shop that sells beauty products and clothing.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beauty products and clothing from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

Sarah Mae  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sarah Mae  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing from NATASHA and AVON to sell

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu is 45 years old and married with three children between 16 and 23 years old. She runs a boutique in the western part of Freetown.

Memunatu has owned this business for 10 years and sells shoes, clothing, shirts and skirts at her boutique. She also earns income from a taxi business. She says that the main challenge to her business is that he construction of the road made her reduce the size of her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry. Memunatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to do international business, importing and exporting of goods.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags, shoes, shirts, and jewelry.

loans.name: Carina Yanusi

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria del poblado de mina santa pancha, su actividad económica es comercio como venta de ropa variadas, su núcleo familiar   son 4 personas ella , su esposo y 2 hijos todavía pequeñas, esta señora ha sido cliente con la empresa desde el 2007  , con 4 créditos recibidos, los que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida,
texts.en: This woman is a native of the city of Mina Santa Pancha. She is a tradeswoman who sells a variety of clothing. Her nuclear family consists of 4 people: her, her husband and two children, who are still small. She has been a client of Ceprodel’s since 2007 and has received 4 loans which have helped her to improve her situation and standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her house by paying for materials, such as bricks, cement and labor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling by retail from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and food stuff for the food café. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and food stuff for the food café.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To plough land for farming

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is from the village of Vartsikhe in Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 53 years old, married, and lives with her 35-year-old son and 5-year-old grandson. 

Darejan is retired. She oversees the agricultural business of the family. Her son is a soldier and works for the country’s armed forces. The family has a small dairy farm with four milk cows. Darejan produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Also, she grows maize on one hectare of land. Along with the aforementioned, the family has a vineyard with 800 grapevines. Darejan produces wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income from agricultural activities is 470 laris (GEL), or approximately 280 USD. 

Darejan requested credit for building a house and getting it ready to live in. Also, she will purchase new household goods, which are necessary for the family. Living conditions for all family members will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Olinda; es  conviviente; la socia tiene 31 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de panaderia,pero ahora se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos,ella no le fue tan bien en el negocio de panaderia y es por eso que decidio cambiar al negocio de crianza de animales,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacara adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pollos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Olinda, 31, has a spouse and two children.  She used to have a bakery but now raises animals like chickens.  She didn’t do too well in the bakery business and that’s why she decided to change her business to animal raising.  She wants to move her children forward with this business.  She also wants to expand and improve the business raising chickens so is asking for a loan to buy chicks and feed for them.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 35-year-old married woman who has no children. She has been selling beans and onions in Yei county, South Sudan for four years. Her husband is a driver.
Sadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use the extra income to build a store and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica lives  in West Point  and is 30 years old. She is single  and has two children, 4 and 12 years old,  who are presently in school and live at home. For the past eighteen  years she has been selling  slippers. She likes the way her customers  buy from her. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more  slippers  for her  business. Her plan is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more  slippers  for her  business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis nació en la  ciudad de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y ahora vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero.

Jose Luis desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, él tiene un GYM y el local está bien implementado. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Jose Luis requiere el préstamo para comprar bicicletas para el GYM. 

Jose Luis se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Jose Luis pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Jose Luis was born in the city and province of Urubamba, Cusco department. He currently lives in the city of his birth. He is 27 and single.
Jose Luis lives and works in Urubamba. He has a well-equipped gym. He has had this business for six years and it is going very well for him.

Jose Luis needs this loan to buy bikes for his gym.

He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this loan, and promises to complete the payments as scheduled. Jose Luis belongs to the "Tercer Milenio" communal bank through Asociacion Arariwa in Urubamba city.

loans.use: to buy bikes for the gym.

loans.name: Fidancie

texts.en:
Fidancie is 36-years-old and is married with one child who is 2-years-old. She takes care of three dependents and two relatives. Fidancie sells various goods such as lotions, sugar, soap, toilet paper, etc. Her business is well known and well organized and she has two years of experience in this business. She currently employs one person to help her and she works from 9am to 8pm each day except on Sunday. 

Fidancie has requested her loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company. With any profit, Fidancie will be able to reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, sugar, soap, toilet paper, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 37 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 12 years old. 

Jacinta is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for 12 years. Jacinta earns 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Jacinta hopes to have enough money to sustain her children's education until college. She also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou est mariée et vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans la coiffure et la vente de téléphones portables et d’habillement. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis janvier 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de thioups, portables et greffages  qui seront destinés  a la vente. Son  objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices  que lui procure son activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou is married and lives in Senegal.  For more than ten years she has been styling hair and selling cell phones and clothing.  She has been an account holder at her local UIMCEC (a credit union) since January 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy cotton cloth, cell phones, and hair weaves to re-sell.  Her goal is to increase her business profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cell phones, and hair weaves to re-sell.

loans.name: Livia Adelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Livia es socio del Banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su Iglesia se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Parroquial y posee más de doscientos años de antigüedad, la Laguna de Tari se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a unos 5 kilómetros del Centro Parroquial. Su gente es amable, responsable, y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Livia tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los  gastos del hogar.
 
Ella trabaja hace 8 años como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día, en su casa se dedica a la cría de chanchos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the Unión y Prosperidad Communal Bank.  She lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, where the beauty of nature is everywhere.  Her church is located in the Parochial Center and it is more than 200 years old.  Tari Lagoon is about 5km from the Parochial Center.  Its people are kind, responsible, and keep the cultural and traditions of their people alive.

Livia is 26 years old.  She is a single mother with a six-year-old son who attends kindergarten in the city.  She doesn't have her own home, so she lives with her parents and shares the household expenses.

She has worked as a housekeeper for eight years.  She works all day Monday through Friday and at home she raises pigs.

This is the second loan she is taking out with her communal bank and she is going to use it to buy pigs.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Christhian

texts.es:
Christhian tiene 28 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y juntos tiene un pequeño de 3 años de edad a quien Christhian quiere muchísimo y por el cual lucha a pesar de las adversidades. Desde joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyar a sus padres ya que ellos tenían pocos recursos económicos y por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, asimismo por circunstancias del destino tuvo un accidente pero gracias a Dios, Christhian pudo superarlo.

Día a día Christhian trabaja en su pequeño negocio de renovación de calzados, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de  8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; el cree que esta saliendo adelante en su negocio ya que es amable con los clientes y también por su responsabilidad y honradez.

Christhian está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para su negocio como pegamento, cuero, nilón, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo y poder seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su propia fábrica de zapatos y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Christhian is 28 years old and lives with his wife.  They have a three year old son, whom Christhian loves very much and for whom he works hard despite adversities.  Since he was young he has had to work to help support his parents, since they have limited financial resources, he was only able to study to fifth grade.  He also had an accident but was able to recover with God’s help.

Each day Christian works in his small shoe repair business.  He works eight hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers.  He believes that he is getting ahead because he is friendly to his customers and also responsible and honest.

Christian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he has been able to buy supplies such as glue, leather, nylon, and other things for his business.  In this way he will have the supplies he needs to continue to work to make his greatest dream a reality, “To have his own shoe factory and provide a good education for his children.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Selinda Isabel

texts.es: La señora selinda es una madre soltera, que cuenta con dos hijas, una de 6 años y una de 5 años, vive  a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad. La señora se dedica al servicio de expendio de comidas, vende en el mercado, este mercado se encuentra al otro extremo de la ciudad en relación a la ubicación de su domicilio. La señora vende en un puesto prestado de una señora donde vende ya hace dos años,  el plato especial que vende es el picante de pollo y la sopa de maní, la señora necesita el crédito para poder comprar una nueva cocina y utensilios para poder vender mejor ya que la cocina que tiene está un poco dañada, así podrá mejorara sus ingresos y  su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Sra. Selinda is a single mother with two daughters, ages 6 and 5.  She lives approximately 45 minutes away from the city.  

Sra. Selinda sells food from a space in the city market.  This market is on the other side of the city in relation to where her home is located.  Sra. Selinda sells from a stall that she is borrowing from another woman and has been in this location for two years.  Her specialty dishes are spicy chicken and peanut soup.  

Sra. Selinda needs a loan in order to buy a new stove and utensils so that she can sell more.  Her current stove is slightly damaged, so the loan will enable her to improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Kim Oern

texts.en:
Living in the village of the Steong Sen district of Kampong Thom province, Kim Oern is 45 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been selling rice and dessert for 10 years. 

Kim Oern is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son university’s tuition fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her school.

loans.use: to pay for her son university’s tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente R. is a 50 year old father of two boys. For over 11 years he and his wife have owned a bakery that is very popular in his neighborhood. They begin baking at 6 am every morning and continue to sell throughout the day and night until about 10 pm. They will use the loan to buy ingredients for their bread like flour, butter and baking soda and will also consider purchasing complimentary goods that they can sell with their current product. This business has provided a living for them and their children and allowed them to build their current home.

loans.use: Buy flour, butter, baking soda etc.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
In Zwola, one of the main businesses is the weaving of mats. Mrs. Kayi D. takes part in the creation of mats, a business she has engaged in since she was very young. Born in 1953, she is widowed and has six (06) children. In addition to weaving mats, she specializes in the sorting of straw which is used in the fabrication of mats. Others who make mats come to her to order straw. Recently, she visited a storehouse where the straw is of very good quality. The owner of the storehouse is getting ready to cut the straw and sell it. Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy straw, build up a stockpile, and to make and sell mats.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

A Zwola, l’une des activités principales est le tressage des nattes. Madame D. Kayi fait partie de ses tresseuses de nattes, activité qu’elle exerce depuis sa plus tendre jeunesse. Née en 1953, elle est veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. En plus du tressage des nattes, elle est une spécialiste en triage des pailles servant à la fabrication des nattes. Ce qui fait que souvent les tresseuses s’adressent à elle pour lui commander des pailles. Tout dernièrement, elle a visité une réserve dont les pailles sont de très bonne qualité. Le propriétaire de la réserve s’apprête à les couper et a les vendre. Madame D. sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter ses pailles, faire le stockage, la vente et la fabrication des nattes.

loans.use: To buy and stockpile straw in order to make mats

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has three children, two of which go to school. The youngest goest with her to her business, selling fruits and vegetables, which she started two years ago to help pay for the family's expenses. Her husband is a tinsmith withouth a permanent job, so sometimes he has little work and his income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Blanca's hard work has enabled her to get a stall in the Menchaca II market in Querétaro, Querétaro, where she is from.

Now she needs a loan of $375 to purchase products to sell, increase variety and get more clients. Become an integral part of her growth as a microentrepreneur, and help this family, they thank you for your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela y el menor la acompaña a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, que inició hace dos años por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ya que su esposo es hojalatero por su cuenta y en ocasiones el trabajo del él es escaso y el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. El esfuerzo de Blanca le ha ayudado para conseguir un local en el mercado de Menchaca II ubicado en Querétaro, Querétaro de donde es originaria.

En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio, tener más variedad y ganar más clientes. Conviértete en parte fundamental de su crecimiento como microempresaria, y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy products to sell

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong P. is an aspiring 18-year-old who works at a private tourist company and earns $3/day.  Her husband is a teacher and earns only $0.50/day.  Mrs. Thong P. wants to have a family, but first would like to build her own house.  Although she has a steady stream of income, she does not have enough cash to buy wood in bulk.  She will use this loan to buy wood to build her first home.  In the future, she hopes to have children and give them a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a house

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira has been a seller of household goods for the past 20 years in Tadjikistan. Her business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. Munira sells different kinds of household goods. She started her business from the selling of sieves and spoons. She is the one member of her family who earns money for family needs, because she lost her husband several years ago and is the sole provider for her five children. It is very difficult to support such a big family, but Munira is a very cheerful women. She says that difficulties in her life have made her stronger and resilient. She lives for her children. She must help them to find their way in their life.

Her eldest son helps her to import goods from Istaravshan, Tadjikistan. Her eldest daughter stays at her place of business, when her mother goes on a trip to buy goods .The turnover of her goods is good, but she has one problem. It is the condition of her place of business. She plans to increase the number of her goods in order to save money to renting a little stall in a bigger shop. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Business development.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, aged 35, is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop selling a variety of household commodities. She has two children, aged 17 and 10, both at school, plus two dependents, girls aged 10 and 14, also at school. Betty had an accident and lost one eye. This was a big setback to her businesses, but she currently feels better and is now back at work.

Betty would like to borrow $1,000 to put more stock in her shop. With the approaching festive season in December, she hopes to make big profits, which will enable her to provide school fees for her children and dependents.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for shop

loans.name: Jug Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jug Maiya M. is a 48 year old lady who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the famous villages for agricultural farming. She lives in with her husband, son and daughter. Her son is studying in BBS level and her daughter is studying in grade 12.

Her husband, Mr. Govinda M., has no work. So Mrs. M. and her husband opened their grocery shop nine years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, pulse, noodles, biscuits, etc. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled by the income of the shop. Mrs. M. is requesting her third loan of Rs20000 to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth N. wants a loan to purchase crafts from other craft makers. She is going to build a shade in her compound where she will place a market stall. She looks after 5 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase crafts

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).
 
Vive en la Comunidad de Nina Chiri  sector Laja a  tres horas  y media de la ciudad de La Paz., El es soltero vive junto a su abuela y a sus tres hermanos menores a quienes colabora económicamente por ser el hermano mayor.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su produccion de leche.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro A. is married to Martina Britez, and they have two young children who are in elementary school. Pedro and Martina own a small convenience store where they sell everyday necessities, including food supplies. While Martina works at their store during the day, Pedro works as a bricklayer to supplement their income.

They started the business with the money they received when they sold their truck, and they have operated the business for 6 years. They are hard-working parents who do whatever they can to give their children the best life possible. They are seeking a loan to purchase additional merchandise for their store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (e.g., flour, sugar, and cleaning supplies) for his convenience/grocery store

loans.name: Santa Maritza

texts.en:
Santa Maritza is a single parent of three sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school.  She lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní, and there she operates a small business selling pants to men and women.  That activity has been the principal source of income of her family after she separated from her husband and was left alone with their four children.  Santa explains that supporting the children is hard work, but she’ll keep fighting to fend for her children.
With her loan, Santa Maritza will buy more pants in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

loans.use: Purchase of pants for re-sale

loans.name: Aisha's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 20 years old and is single woman. She takes care of her mother, who is 35 years old. Aisha is a bite seller (maandazi), starting in 2007. Everyday, she works from 4am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales, cafe, and salon.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Eao

texts.en: Eao K. is an elderly Khmer woman who lives with her widowed daughter, Chen Mei. At 76 years old, Eao K. is still laboring as a rice farmer in her home province of Kampong Cham. She has been farming rice since she was young in 1960, 15 years before the Khmer Rouge would come to power. She earns $1.50 (US) per day. Her daughter grows cucumbers. Eao K. has six children, some of whom help care for her by sending money each month. As she is very old, she can no longer carry water from the well to her fields when not enough rain has come. She wants to buy a simple pump to use as an irrigation system for her fields. This will greatly benefit her family, she hopes, even after she is gone.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
"I have been making cakes for a little more than one year. My business is making cakes for different occasions, such as 15th birthday parties, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc. However, I need equipment so I can make the cakes more quickly and easily and to be able to deliver on time. For this reason, I am asking for a loan of $500 dollars to purchase equipment such as an oven and a more powerful mixer."
Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo aproximadamente más de 1 año con el negocio de repostería. En el negocio me dedico a ser pasteles de diferente ocasión con Quince años, bodas, bautizos, cumpleaños etcétera. Pero me esta haciendo falta algo de maquinaria para poder hacer los pasteles mas rápido y sin tanto trabajo y entregarlos  a tiempo. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $500.00 dlls para la compra de maquinaria como un horno y batidora más potentes.

loans.use: Buy an oven and mixer for making cakes.

loans.name: Philip F.'s Group

texts.en: Philip F. K. assumes leadership of this group of soldiers. He was born in Yifie. He is married with one child. Philip's wife sells local produce here in Makeni. He will use his loan to give to his wife to add onto her existing business. Other members of the group are: Thomas K., who also wants to give his loan to his wife; Samuel Christain J., who wants to invest his own loan to build a house; Majid M., who will give his to his wife to invest in her business; and Joseph G., who wants to do business with his loan. These guys will be remitting their loans to SMT through their paymaster at the end of each month. They are requesting the sum of 5,000,000 SLL.

loans.use: Give loan to their wives to invest in businesses.

loans.name: Koudohoin

texts.fr:
Née en 1971 à Logodomé , madame A. Koudohoin est une commerçante très vaillante qui vit actuellement à Logodomé   précisément dans la localité de vo . Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants.

 Vu le rendement de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter le haricot et le riz. Ce financement accordé lui permettra d’améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Logodomé , Mrs. Koudohoin A. is a hard-working merchant who presently lives in Logodomé, more precisely in the Vo area. She is married and is the mother of 8 children.

In view of the earnings from her business, she is requesting a loan to buy dried beans and rice. Given this credit she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dried beans and rice

loans.name: Mohamed Saidi's Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Mohamed S., age 36, is divorced with three children ages 15, 8 and 3. He runs a business selling meat soup, which he started 4 years ago. He works from 6am until noon, but only sells soup every other day because he alternates with a friend. There would not be enough business if they both sold soup on the same days. He is able to earn about $4 per day which totals to about $60 per month. He also sells baskets in the market to supplement his income.

This will be Mohamed's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a sofa set for his house and to purchase more utensils and pots to cook the soup. He paid back all the loans successfully. With the loan he hopes to receive now, he will increase his soup business.

Mohamed is a member of Nguvu Moja group (meaning "together we are one" in Swahili). The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mohamed is with his subgroup and is standing in the back row on the right. To his left is Juma Z. (salon owner). In front from left to right is Shani A. (clothing sales), Nasra S. (general store owner) and Halima A. (food vendor).

loans.use: To increase soup selling business.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, sobretodo para damas, también vende cosméticos y sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria visitando a vecinas, amigas y a personas que son recomendadas por los clientes que tiene. Clara vende al crédito dando facilidades de pago a sus clientes de manera diaria, semanal, quincenal y mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes, esmaltes, labiales entre otros productos que tienen buena acogida entre sus clientes y así atender sus pedidos que le hacen las personas quienes son la razón de su negocio.

Clara tiene 42 años de edad, es natural de Lamas y vive con sus 03 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos, más adelante piensa comprar un local en el mercado para vender verduras porque está analizando que este tipo de negocio tiene más salida por ser ingrediente principal en la dieta diaria.
texts.en:
Clara, a member of the Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto "Las Zamaritanas", lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She sells clothing, women's overcoats, and cosmetics and she achieves her sales by visiting neighbors, friends, and people referred to her as clients. Clara sells on credit, allowing her clients to pay daily, weekly, bimonthly, and monthly. With this $275 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy women's clothing like polo shirts, blousers, trousers, and beauty products such as perfume, nail polish, lipstick among other products that her customers prefer and address their requests. Clara is 42 years old, a native of Lamas, and lives with her three children. She is a a woman eager to move ahead despite obstacles. Later, she is thinking of buying a place in the market to sell vegetables because she has determined that this type of business has more output since vegetables are the main ingredient in the daily diet.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy women's clothing such as polo shirts, blouses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Degninou

texts.fr: Degninou F. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il exerce l’activité de la couture et est compté parmi les meilleurs de son secteur à Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Pour donner plus de teneur à son activité, Degninou souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle machine et aussi des tissus pour la commercialisation
texts.en:
Degninou F. is 42 years old, married and the father of three children, all of whom are at school. He works as a tailor and is considered one of the best in the business in Atakpamé, a town in central Togo. To bolster his business Deginou wants to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine as well as fabrics that he can sell.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to sell

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr:
Madame I. Assana est née en 1967 à parakou au BENIN, un pays voisin du Togo. Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè kitigan à Lomé (Togo), elle a deux (02) enfants et est divorcé de son mari OUSSENI Salifou qui est un chauffeur. I. Assana est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1996. Elle est est très dynamique et très motivée dans son commerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 500000F auprès de WAGES qu’elle a remboursée sans difficultés.
Elle demande un autre crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 15 sacs de riz et 12 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Ms. Assana I. was born in 1967 in Parakou, Benin, a country neighboring Togo. She lives in the Agoè Kitigan district in Lomé (Togo), has two children, and is divorced from her husband Salifou OUSSENI, a chauffeur. She is a retailer of grocery items and has been in this business since 1996. She is very energetic and highly motived in her work in order to support her family. Having already been a recipient of a 500,000 franc loan from WAGES that she repaid without difficulty, she is asking for another loan to get supplies: 15 sacks of rice and 12 drums of oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Racila

texts.en: Răcila T. has 32 years old and is active in farming. T. is a member of a credit bank group for the village of Carabetovca. She lives in Carabestovca village, Basarabeasca district, Moldova. Racila's family is actively involved in cereal farming.  The family has two farms and they have farmed this land since 1994. The farms are heavily mechanized though there is still much manual work. This is her second loan with Microinvest. The first loan for 5000 lEI, to purchase fertilizer, seeds and loan payments, was repaid May 24, 2007.  The loan, now requested is required to purchase farm chemicals and mechanical equipment parts.

loans.use: To purchase the chemicals and mechanical parts

loans.name: Adeleke

texts.en:
Adeleke runs a shop where she sells many items, like native pots, eggs, cowries, herbs and the ingredients to make pepper soup. The demands for her goods are high because Nigerians love native pots. Native pots in Nigeria are used in the preparation of local soups and herbs.

Now, she needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more native pots and pepper soup ingredients to sell.

Adeleke is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Adeleke is a client of LAPO. She is very grateful to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more native pots and pepper soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin K. is a 22-year-old man who sells different goods such as food, home products and toothpaste. He started his business three years ago when hunger knocked at his door. Elchin decided not to enter the university, and he started his own business. He borrowed some money from his relatives and opened a small shop share he started to sell foodstuffs such as macaroni, sugar and salt. After two years he expanded his business and started selling other items such as home products and bath items. Now Elchin would like to expand his store and purchase more foodstuffs for his store to improve his family life conditions. Elchin and his family count on your help.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim K., a local entrepreneur in Makeni City. Ibrahim is requesting a loan in order to give strength to his business. Ibrahim sells second-hand clothes and second-hand traveling bags. He would like to get a loan in order to buy two bales of traveling bags and one bale of men’s t-shirts.

Ibrahim is aged thirty-eight, and married with four children. Two of his children are in secondary schools, one in nursery school and the last one is still very young. Ibrahim was born in Makeni City, and he has been a businessman for eighteen years now. 

This will be the first loan Ibrahim is receiving from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve on his business. Things are now expensive, he told me, but with a loan, he will be able to buy quality clothes thereby attracting many customers. Getting this loan will therefore make Ibrahim feel very good, happy and proud because of the improvement it will bring to his business.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second hand traveling bags and one bale of men's T-shirts

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар женщина , которая самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом, сама ездит в Бишкек за товаром, сама продаёт.Дилбар хочет дополнительно получить параллельный займ для завоза весеннего товара.Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов.Дилбар на свой товар ставит маленькую наценку, поэтому она имеет хороший поток клиентов.Микроинвест рад выдавать кредит таким клиентам , как Дилбар,т.к.она имеет хороший моральный облик.
texts.en:
Dilbar runs this business on her own. She travels to Bishkek for items and sells them herself. Dilbar wants to take out a loan for delivery of goods for spring. She has regular customers. Dilbar adds a small markup to her wares. MicroInvest is happy to furnish loans to clients such as Dilbar, because of her upstanding character.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade in children's clothing

loans.name: St. Francis A  Aliyiza Lydia Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lydia A. is a married woman, age 34, with two kids: a 14-year-old son and a 6-year-old daughter,  both in school. For over two years, she has been selling dry cells, books, toothpaste, sweets, pens and pencils, torches, and small wine packs. She will use the loan to buy more stock. Her dream is to enlarge her business, own poultry and see her kids through school.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 47 años, desde muy joven siempre se preocupó por salir adelante en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio son los metales, tiene un taller donde los moldea y convierte en estructuras útiles, como carritos sangucheros, carretillas, triciclos, etc. Actualmente cuenta con 3 trabajadores que laboran en su taller y son los principales ayudantes que tiene en su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus productos, ya que en su negocio ella es la encargada de hacerlo. Lleva 27 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que conseguir los metales para moldear, ya que transportarlos le resulta muy pesado y cansado. Para el fututo, espera hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en uno de los principales de la ciudad de Juliaca. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Maria con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querida ya que siempre esta preocupada por el bienestar de las demás socias. Con los 3000 soles que solicita planea comprar más metales para trabajar mejor y realizar adecuadamente sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47-years old who from an early age was always concerned with getting ahead in life. She lives in a proper house and desire very much so to have a better quality of life. Her business is metals and she has a shop where they mold and convert metals into useful structures, like sangucheros (trolleys, carts and tricycles, etc.) In actuality, she has 3 workers laboring in the shop and they are the main assistants in the shop.

The thing she likes about her job is selling the products because since it’s her business she feels responsible to sell. She’s been doing this for 27-years, but the thing she likes least is molding the metals and transporting the resulting products as it’s very heavy and tiresome.

For the future, she hopes to make her business an integral part of the city of Juliaca. This is the 4th loan request that Maria has taken through MFP and just as she did with her first request she plans to repay her debt promptly as she cares a lot for her community bank and is also concerned with making it the best. With 3000 soles she plans to purchase more metals to work better and gain more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy metals

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Mrs. Salve Z. is a former OFW (Overseas Filipina Worker). At the age of 31, she got married to Dominic Z., an overseas seaman, now residing in P7 Gango, Ozamiz City. Theye are blessed with 2 children, both studying in Gango Elementary School.

Even though her husband is an overseas seaman, Salve still wanted to help earn their living. She decided to put up a little Sari-sari (variety) Store with a small amount of capital. Unfortunately, she experienced a net loss. She tried to revive her business and invested again in the store. Now her business is still existing and has showed progress in sales and inventory. As an active regular member, she is now applying for the amount of PHP 20,000 as her 4th loan. As a mother, her only desire is to give her children a better education for their good future. She is very thankful to God, to PAGLAUM and to KIVA for helping fulfill her hopes and dreams in life.

loans.use: additional capital for her Sari-sari store

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy N., jeune femme de 38 ans est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait de la restauration et en même temps aussi du commerce d’effets vestimentaires. Elle prend en charge ses factures d’eau et aimerait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumy N., a young woman of 38, is a widow and the mother of 4 children. She sells cooked food and at the same time, clothing. She is responsible for her water bills and would like to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: serving cooked food

loans.name: Ofe

texts.en: Ofe T., 31, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the ice cake business.  She sells to village people 6 days per week.  She has one previous loan with SPBD.  Ofe expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).   SPBD loans are Ofe’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cordials, plastic cups and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 21-year-old engaged woman living with her parents. She has been working for four years as a Research Analyst, providing reports for those in need of specific information. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 to be able to market her services more and to have more liquidity in her business.

loans.use: To be able to market her services more and to have more liquidity in her business

loans.name: Charmarose

texts.en:
Charmarose M. is the 42-year-old responsible wife of Mr. Gil M. and a loving mother to her five children who age from 23 to 3 years old. Her husband is laborer while she is a woman who runs different kinds of small businesses. Before she had an access to credit through ASHI, sufficient income to cover all her family expenses and business sustainability were the problems she encountered. These were also the reasons why she had been doing different kind of businesses. 

In 2001, Charmarose decided to join ASHI to address the problems she had. Firstly, she wanted to finance the business she thought best capable of generating a bigger profit. Then, the next problem, which is covering her family expense, would be solved once her business became stable.

Therefore, Charmarose’s first and second loans were used to support her rice buy-and-sell business. She has been able to grow the business and has increased their family income. She was able to payback the loans on time and has been attending center meetings of ASHI on time, too. Every week she manages to save through ASHI for her other personal and family needs.

At this point in time, Charmarose is planning to use her loan to purchase a motorcycle as an additional business. Motorcycle-for-hire is one of the most common businesses of people in the municipality of Hamtic where she and her family live. This is the most convenient kind of transportation and people would rather choose it than a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar), since a motorcycle doesn't take long in the parking area waiting for passengers and can easily reach farther and more uphill places which is the typical landscape of the municipality. 

In the future, Charmarose hopes that her businesses will grow more and that she will be able to purchase another motorcycle to have a bigger income. With this income, she wants to send all her children to college so that she will have the capacity to offer them a more worthwhile kind of life.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transportation business and to finance her rice buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Chandika

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandika S. lives in Bholdhoka, lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two son. Her husband Mr. Shyam S. is  a driver. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and younger son is studying in grade 3.
Mrs. Chandika opens her shoe shop eight years ago. In her shop she sells different types of shoes for all group and gender. She opens her shoe shop to uplift the economic condition of her family.
She use her income in household expenses.
Now she is requesting for Rs 15000.00 loan to buys different types of shoes to meet the increasing demand of shoes in that area.

loans.use: To buys shoes for her shop

loans.name: Claudia Yojana

texts.es:
la señora Claudia Yojana D. R. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en barrio Victoria de San Lorenzo. vive en union libre con el señor Jesus Alberto Aguirre R. quien labora en el area de ventas 
de Aguazul San Lorenzo.
Tienen un hijo que esta en el kinder.
 
Claudia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en diferentes barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, tambien viaja a un lugar que se llama monjaras para vender su producto.

Claudia se transporta en autobus, a demas tiene otra persona que la ayuda con las ventas.
Claudia necesita el prestamo para comprar mas ropa para niños, ya que muchos padres compran ropa para vertirlos para la celebracion del dia del niño que esta proximo en venir.
texts.en:
Claudia Yojana D. R. is 26, and she lives in the Victoria de San Lorenzo neighborhood. She is in a common law marriage with Jesus Alberto Aguiree R.. He works in the area of sales in Aguazule San Lorenzo. They have a son who is in kindergarten. Claudia sells new clothes in different neighborhoods and sectors of San Lorenzo. She also travels to a place called Monjaras to sell her product. Claudia goes buy bus. She also has another person who helps her with the sales. Claudia needs a loan to buy children’s clothes. Lots of parents buy clothes for their children to wear for the celebration of Children’s Day, which is coming soon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing like jeans, blouses, shirts, and T-shirts

loans.name: Yee

texts.en: Yee S., 51, is married with six children children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province Province. To make a living, her husband operates his motorbike attached with a trailer in the town, typically earning US $5 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.  Her husband has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family and the children. The family also assisted by two of the children who are currently employed in a local hotel as drivers with a reasonable income to make a good living and to assist the family. S. is seeking to increase her income and start a new business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to buy all of sugar canes in stock from the local farmer in her province and sell them back in fairly profitable price. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy all of sugar canes in stock

loans.name: Bangelyn

texts.en:
This is Bangelyn D. L., age 24, from Tala, Caloocan City. She is married to Raegan, 25, a driver by profession.

Five years ago, Bangelyn started her general store with just a few items to sell and a few thousand pesos in investments. Now she is earning around P 6,000.00 a month. She uses her profits to build up inventories for her store.

Bangelyn is now on her third loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She has applied for a new loan in the amount of P 8,000.00, with which she will buy more items to sell at her store.

In the future, she wants to see her general store in the future grow significantly so that she can help employ some of her neighbors.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta T. is from the town of Bag-ong, Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000.00 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2007, Modesta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Modesta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mr. Ret R., 26 (was not in the photo, but his wife is available instead) and his wife, Mrs. Thary Hong, 30, married in 2004 and have a young son. The couple is living along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ret has been selling jars for three years. He buys them from his village and transports them to sell at the other districts far from his house. His wife has been raising pigs at home for one year. Ret is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a remoque in which to carry jars to sell. A remoque is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying jars to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa D. is from the village of Sto. Niño,Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old. Felipa is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business making & selling food, primarily selling "biko" rice products in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felipa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felipa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio  vive, en la calle Huancane de la zona Amor de Dios, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Basilio es soltero, vive junto a su madre en su casita propia en una zona alejada del centro.

Trabaja como empleado administrador en una tienda donde comercializan materiales de construcción, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto



El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción (estuco, pinturas) para realizar algunas mejoras en las habitaciones de su domicilio.
 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Basilio lives on Huancane street in the Amor de Dios neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Basilio is single and lives with his mother in her own little home in a remote zone from downtown. He works in a store where they sell construction materials, located in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction materials (plaster, paint, etc.) to make some improvements to the bedrooms of his home. This is his second loan with Impro, whose evaluation qualifies him for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stucco and paint for the bedrooms of his home

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Gavino Marcelino C. V. tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el Barrio Laureles Norte es soltero y sus mayores logros serian el poder mejorar su casa y conseguir un mejor estabilidad económica y sentimental, el es sastre y tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio solicito un préstamo con el fin de comprar telas para la elaboración de trajes a la medida a sus clientes, esto le traería mayores utilidades que lograrían que el señor C. monte un pequeña tienda donde pueda vender sus diseños, agradecería el apoyo que se le pudiera brindar puesto que le cambiaria el estilo de vida que lleva en estos días.
texts.en:
Sr. Gavino Marcelino C. V. is 47 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Norte. He is single and his greatest achievements include making improvements to his home and obtaining financial stablility. Gavino has been a tailor for twenty years and is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics for making customized clothing for his clients. This will result in greater revenues. He established a small shop where he sells his designs and appreciates the support that allows him make positive lifestyle changes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Loung S., 45, is married and the mother of six children. Two of her sons help provide the family with food by fishing around the river, while the other two sons attend school. Her husband, Saveth, age 43, earns a living fishing along the Tunle Sap River. 

To earn a living, Loung S. either gets fish from her husband’s fishing, or buys from other fishermen, and brings the fish by boat to sell at the local fish market. Recently, many of the fishing tools were ruined, and the family’s income was affected. Therefore, Loung S. is taking out her loan to purchase essential accessories, such as nets, traps, and a boat for fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase essential accessories, such as nets, traps, and a boat for fishing activities

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: S. Nasiba is 45 years old. and lives in Isfara town. She is married and has three children. Nasiba processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. She purchases dried apricots and processes them and is experienced in the business. Because Nasiba buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of dried apricots for clients of different means. All this allows Nasiba to make her business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for her family. Nasiba requests 1,000 USD which she is going to spend on purchasing more dried apricots to process and sell. Nasiba expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been selling home products since 2005. He sells batteries, bulbs, and other things. He decided on doing this business because he took over his friend’s business. Therefore, the shop already had its own clients and was known in his region, which allowed him to not face lots of difficulties when he became the owner of the place. This is the first time he has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. With his loan, he plans to purchase merchandise for his shop to increase his sales, and repair the car he uses in his work to transport tools from the shop to different work places.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Faridah Musoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Faridah is 42 years old and married, with six children between the ages of 22 and 5 years old. Five of her children go to school and the first-born is working. Faridah owns and resides in a five-room house living with ten people. There is electricity and no water. The family gets three meals a day. 

Faridah resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week and operates from her home. She deals in bananas and charcoal, selling to all kinds of people both on wholesale and retail. Faridah sells to an average of 40 people per day. She buys bananas and charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any extra transport costs. Faridah has been in this business for the past ten years .She first dealt in  bananas, but with subsequent loans from MCDT, was able to supplement her income by investing in a charcoal business.
 
Faridah has been with MCDT for the last six years and is servicing her 18th loan, working all this time with her same group. Her major challenge is defaulters in the charcoal business. She wants to use this loan to invest in farm produce to supply to various nearby schools. She aspires to construct rental houses in free space near her home.
.

loans.use: To invest in farm produce to supply to various nearby schools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing new furniture

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita P. is a grocery store-keeper in the town of Sanepa. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, beaten rice (dehusked rice which is flattened into flat light dry flakes), etc.

Nowadays, the demand for grocery goods is increasing, due to the migration of people from different places to Sanepa. So Mrs. Sita P. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to buy grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. Sita P. lives with her husband and four children. Her husband works in a private office and all her children are now studying.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Divina Misericoridia Group

texts.en:
Quesy is the coordinator of her group 'Divine Misericordia' (Divine Mercy), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiage, a large city known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with longterm partner and their four children.

Quesy is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small food stand, by purchasing the rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil (all staples of Dominican life) that her customers demand. She will sell these goods and use the profits to invest in the education of her children by saving for them to go to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: rice, beans, vegetables and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
