Arceli O. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamis City. She is 52 years old, married, and has one adult child. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In November 2006, Arceli joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Maria Editha

texts.en:
Maria Editha C. is from the village of Barangay Roxas in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old. Maria Editha is single. To make a living, Maria Editha owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Maria Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Maria Editha's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zorumabel

texts.en:
Zorumabel O. is a 49-year-old woman whose passion is to grow her small sari-sari (variety) store business and its profits. “Sari-sari” is a tagalog (Philippine language) word which means a small volume of various grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages for retail.

Zorumabel wishes that, someday, her sari-sari store will turn to a mini-grocery store that has a larger volume of inventory to increase the number of her customers. With that, her profit would grow as well and she could put up a savings fund to support the medication of one of her children who has an ailment.

Also, Zorumabel wants to support the education of her youngest child until graduation from college. She may be unhappy for her eldest and second child who have not graduated from college yet. She understood that they are just victims of poverty.

Zorumabel promises to sustain her business through the loans she can request from ASHI because this is the only way she knows to combat poverty and improve the lifestyle of her family, rather than depending on the income generated by her husband who is a hired carpenter.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages for her store

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with five children, who all attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. Deborah resides in and rents a two room house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

Deborah owns a stall selling second hand clothes in Ndeeba, Lubaga Division, Kampala district. She buys the second hand clothes from Owino Market, using public transportation to and from the market. She works in Ndeeba market and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale levels. Deborah works six days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow big and to start importing the clothes herself. Deborah joined MCDT because of low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 28 años, es una madre muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Percy de 27 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que Raquel realiza en sus chacras, han hecho que sus cultivos de alverja y papa sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Han transcurrido 9 años, y aún le gusta sembrar y cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga, ya que estos afectan el desarrollo de su cosecha. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Raquel is 28 years old and a modest hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Percy, age 27, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. The hard work that she performs in her fields has yielded productive and abundant crops of peas and potatoes. Her products are sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she is able to obtain good prices and has very loyal customers who buy everything in bulk. After nine years of farming, Raquel still enjoys planting and protecting her crops from pests that can affect their development. In time she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase production.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Raquel knows she has to submit all of her loan payments on time and is determined to do so. In her Communal Bank she is one of the more cheerful and supportive members. The loan of 500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene una tienda de viveres desde hace años atrás cuando su esposa murió. 

Para poder mantener a sus dos hijos el comenzó a vender verduras y frutas poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a tener suficiente dinero para comprar vitrinas y readecuar el loca, ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende frutas, lácteos, bebidas, legumbres etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio y surtirlo mas el quiere con el préstamo comprar frutas y legumbres, en el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para sus hijos y tener una camioneta para mejor movilización de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ángel, 30, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary). He has had a grocery store for the last two years since his wife died. To support his two children he started to sell fruits and vegetables. Gradually, with much effort, he managed to have enough money to buy display cases and refurbish the locale. He now works from 6am until 9pm every day selling fruits, dairy products, beverages, vegetables, etc. To continue with his business and stock it better he needs funds to buy fruits and vegetables. In the future, he’d like to have another business for his children and have a van so that he can transport his merchandise more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline U. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Benito. She is 38 years old. Madeline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Madeline owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits, vegetables, and rice in the local community. Madeline has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns a net of 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Madeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Madeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Madeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Madeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a divorced woman with two boys who all attend school. She has been operating her retail shop for the last six years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. With the KSH 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil. Her previous occupation was a restaurant operator. Halima faces the major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay back, hence low realization of profits. She hopes to open a bigger shop in future and sell more stock. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to expand her business. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo  vive en la  zona  Kallutaca, Provincia  los Andes, del Departamento La Paz. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), vive junto a su   esposa y su bebe, también trabaja como chofer  propietario de una movilidad de transporte publico. El crédito es para compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives in the zone of Kallutaca, located in the Los Andes province and in the department of La Paz. He works raising cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). He lives with his wife and baby. Marcelo also works as a public transportation driver. The loan requested is for the purchase of cattle. This is his first loan with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rorng

texts.en:
Rorng S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for its business with Vietnam. Rorng is employed as a garment factory worker for 2 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of 3 USD per day.

Rorng is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family’s use. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, she would like to use any profits to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Benita Del Pilar

texts.es:
Benita es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida ya que se encarga de brindar un buen trato a su cliente. Ella utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Benita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y por consiguiente, sus ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Benita es una mujer bastante trabajadora y luchadora. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benita is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Olmos, a zone in the Lambayeque province, located more than one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past three years, Benita has sold groceries from a store located within her home.  There she offers all sorts of daily use products, and her business does well because she treats her customers well.  She uses her income to help her husband maintain the financial health of the family.

Benita wants to expand her business by buying more items so that she can expand her sales and earnings.  For this she has seen fit to request her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa to help accomplish her objective.

Benita is a struggling hard working woman.  Those who know her pay her much admiration and respect.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school.  

Ruth has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works five days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail.    

Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Ruth include transportation and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van and to educate her children up to university. Ruth lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en toda actividad agropecuaria. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención, la de su esposa y sus dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in his own home in the Tipampa Achacachi community.  He is a dairy producer and his wife works with him in all his farming and livestock activities.  It is the main source of income for himself, his wife and their two children.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will enable him to increase his milk production and improve his income.

This is his second loan from Impro.  His good repayment history allows him to access a new loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 45 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 children aged 24, 22 and 21. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilma also makes candies that she sells in their neighborhood. Sometimes, she goes to schools to sell more candies.

Wilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and ingredients for making candies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, as well as ingredients for making candies.

loans.name: Pion

texts.en:
Pion Y. is 36 years old and married to Ester Y.. Together they are the parents of four children. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.
  
Pion learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to prepare land for the next planting season by buying chemicals and fertilizer. Wheat has proved to grow well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Pion hopes he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land in order to plant wheat on a larger scale. In the future, he also hopes to buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer to prepare the land for the next planting season

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: Felipe Antonio
texts.en: Felipe Antonio

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

location.town: El Santuario, departamento de San Vicente

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José  vive en la zona del Plan 3000 ya hace como 4 años, él se dedica al rubro de la carpintería, cuenta con su propio taller y dispone con maquinaria y obreros que trabajan para él,  actualmente realiza puertas y marcos tanto como para ventanas y puertas. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de edredones, sábanas y perfumes, para ayudar con los gastos de la casa y así poder pagar ella sus propias cuentas ya que ella trabaja con créditos en grupos, mientras que él esta con cuentas individuales. Ellos tienen una hija de unos 5 meses, son una pareja responsable que les gusta trabajar y compartir en familia. Actualmente como es fin de año es cuando más demanda tienen por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de madera por lo que necesitan incrementar su capital para poder abastecer a las personas a las que dejan las puertas y marcos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José has lived in Plan 3000 neighborhood for 4 years.  He is a carpenter and has his own workshop, machinery and employees who work for him.  He currently makes doors, window frames and door frames.  His wife sells comforters, sheets and perfumes to help with their household expenses and so that she can take care of her own accounts since she takes out group loans while José takes individual loans.

The couple have a 5 month-old daughter.  They are a responsible couple who like to work and share as a family.  As it is currently the end of the year, which is when he has most demand, José requested a loan to buy wood to increase his capital so that he can supply people with their doors and frames.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Son S., age 31, who lives in the province of Kompong Thom, which is the best territory for farming. Son S. is married and devoted to her one child, who depends on her care. Her husband earns an income by driving a horse cart around his community. 

Son S. grows various crops on her farmland, which she acquired from her grandmother many years ago. She does well in the farming business almost every year. Son S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming, and to add to her personal savings. She will use this land for farming.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s land for farming

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Violeta es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas del Distrito D. calleria, Departamento  D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos y está separada D. su esposo hace varios años.
La señora Violeta, lleva trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace varios años, dinero que le ha servido para comprar parte D. sus maquinas,  se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, tiene su propio taller que funciona en su casa. Actualmente la persona que le ayuda es una D. sus nueras.
Violeta  invertirá  el nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,800.00 nuevos soles en la compra D. materiales para su taller Como son: 6 conos D. hilos duro D. colores que más utiliza, 4 conos D. hilos D. remalle, ½ doc. D. tiza sastre, 10 cortes D. tela, 5 metro D. algodón pima estampado, 5 metros D. algodón llano, 1 cono D. elástico, 2 doc. D. cierres, un ciento D. botones D. varios tamaños.
La señora Violeta sigue trabajando aun teniendo un dolor tan granD. como es la pérdida irreparable D. uno D. sus hijos, pena que todavía no logra superar; "seguirá trabajando con Manuela  Ramos  por muchos años más".
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors), which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, has five children, and has been separated from her spouse for several years.

Sra. Violeta has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for many years. The money has been used to buy parts for the machines she uses for making clothes. She operates her business out of her home and one of her daughters-in-law currently works as her assistant.

Violeta will invest this new loan of 1800 PEN in the purchase of materials for her workshop such as six cones of durable thread in the most used colors, four cones of mesh, a half dozen boxes of tailor’s chalk, ten bolts of fabric, five meters of patterned pima cotton cloth, five meters of plain cotton cloth, one cone of elastic, two dozen zippers, and a hundred buttons of various sizes.

Sra. Violeta continues to work in order to deal with the pain of the loss of one of her children which she has still yet to overcome. She says, “I will continue to work with Manuela Ramos for many more years to come.”

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Ella estudió solo hasta tercero de secundaria. 
Juntamente con su esposo se dedican a la producción de trucha, productos que son criados en seis jaulas, una vez madurado los vende. Con Movimiento Manuela Ramos viene trabajando hace un año, el primer préstamo que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la  compra  de dos sacos de alimento  para truchas.
Ella solicitara un préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, para comprar  cinco sacos de alimento balanceado marca tomasino y purina.
 Su sueño es  salir adelante y tener una casa en juliaca. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito - Juli province, in Puno department.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She only studied up to the third year of high school.

Together with her husband, Hilda raises trout in six cages.  Once they have grown she sells them.  Hilda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in buying two sacks of feed for her trout.

Hilda is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy five sacks of Tomasino- and Purina-brand balanced feed.  Her dream is to get ahead in life and to own a house in Juliaca.  What she likes about her community bank are the prompt payments and the chats.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of Tomasino- and Purina-brand balanced feed

loans.name: Las Divinas De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS DIVINAS DE SAN MATEO". Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, en México. Esta conformado por 13 personas. La señora Paula A. M. es integrante del grupo, tiene 48 años, estudio hasta la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catálogo desde hace 15 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia para su negocio de cosmeticos, y de esta forma hacer crecer sus negocios. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al crédito piensa hacer mayores inversione en su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener más ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida, a ella y a toda su familia, y es por eso que, debido a sus altos indices de ventas estan por acenderla lo que le permitira tener una gran variedad de clientes en distintas localidades y logre sus objetivos.
texts.en: This group is named Las Divinas de San Mateo (The Divine Ones from San Mateo). It is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. It is made up of 13 people. Señora Paula is an important member of the group. She is 48 years old and attended elementary school. She is a storekeeper and has three children, one woman and two men. She has been selling cosmetics through catalogs for the past 15 years. She requests this loan in order to invest in more merchandise for her cosmetics business and in this way, to expand her business. Upon requesting this loan, she feels excited by the prospect of being able to make more investments in her business and in this way to begin to make more money that will allow her to create a better quality of life for herself as well as for all of her family. It is because of this, owing to her high sales indices that are about to increase, that will allow her to have a wide variety of clients in different neighborhoods and to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Juana. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad, mientras que los menores que son mellizos están en escuela. Su esposo es profesor de escuela. Ella en la actualidad está estudiando para licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación en una Universidad a distancia.

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja en su casa todos los días en las mañanas  y en las tardes visita a sus clientes que tiene.  Deja a crédito y cobra los sábados o domingos cada semana.
 
Este crédito es para comprar: perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y en especial productos de promoción. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos y le gusta la unión del grupo. Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y poder conseguir un nombramiento como maestra.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Madres para un Futuro Mejor' (Mothers for a Better Future) community bank meets in 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  This canton is known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, the variety of its fauna and also for its kind and hard-working people who mainly work in farming and livestock raising.

Here we meet Juana who is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Two of her children are grown up and studying at university whilst her youngest two are twins and are attending school.  Her husband is a school teacher.  Juana is currently studying for a degree in 'Education Sciences' with a distance learning university.

Juana is a great housewife who is also a saleswoman.  She sells Yambal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works from her home every day of the week in the mornings and in the afternoons she visits her customers.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every Saturday or Sunday.

Juana will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and particularly sales products.  She has been a member of her community bank for 5 loan cycles and she likes the unity of the group.  Her goals are to finish her studies and to achieve a position as a teacher.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and sales products

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es: La señora Mariette es dueña de una pequeña pensión que tiene en la misma casa donde vive y donde atiende a sus clientes con platos de comida;   el crédito lo necesita para adquirir más insumos como ser fideo, arroz, verduras, condimentos, etc., para elaborar  mayor cantidad de platos a la carta. Vive en casa  de sus padres  ubicada en la zona de Villa San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y  tiene cuatro hijos. La cliente se siente muy feliz con los préstamos que le otorgamos ya que le sirvieron para el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariette owns a small, home-based eatery where she provides meals for her customers.  She needs the loan to buy more ingredients like: noodles, vegetables, condiments, etc. to make a larger quantity of a la carte dishes.

She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s Villa San Antonio area.  She’s married and has four children. 

She feels very happy with the loans we give her because they were useful for her business’ growth.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Dushekan's Group

texts.en:
Dushekan K., 55, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and has five grown children. Currently she is getting ready for spring field work. The business was started in 2007 when she received two head of cattle as a gift from her children. The initial capital for her business start-up was 15,000 soms. Now she would like to ask for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase two head of cattle for further reselling. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for further reselling.

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 39 years old and is married with four children, plus three children he takes care of. He is a tailor. He starts his work at 7am and works until 6pm every weekday. He has been in this business for 2 years. Ezechiel currently employs two people to help him.

Ezechiel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more and new materials for his tailoring. From this, Ezechiel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more and new materials for his tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to make snacks and to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jessica; ella tiene 18 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz y habas y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa, haba y maíz venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo.                                               
                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Jessica is 18 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her farming business.  Jessica owns farmland where she grows potatoes, corn and beans which she later sells in Urubamba market.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, Jessica gets her son ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business selling potatoes, beans and corn and is requesting this loan to buy potatoes and fertilizers for her farmland.

Jessica is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
This is Jurinda, 36, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a driver, and mother to their children. The entire family manages the household while operating the business. Jurinda works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Jurinda operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jurinda earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by individual item. She also has a piggery, where she takes care of hogs and sells them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Jurinda earns a minimum of PHP 493 in daily sales.

To help her continue operating her business, Jurinda is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory and to buy pig feed. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jurinda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. She would also like to support her children's schooling up to college level. Jurinda faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.en:
Manuel is 33 years old and lives in the city of Cotacachi in northern Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and their five children aged twelve, ten, seven, six, and two years, respectively. Manuel describes himself as hardworking, humble, and simple. He works with his wife and her cousins at his business making cement blocks. 

Manuel reports that the business is going well and that they are currently selling 4,000 cement blocks a month. He is seeking his first loan to buy a machine to make blocks more efficiently and easily. He hopes that the loan will improve his quality of life and give them the ability to produce more cement blocks. In the future, he would like to have a larger store to sell the cement blocks and own a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy a machine that helps him make cement blocks.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos. El posee un negocio de estructuras metálicas, que es el que le ayuda a mantener a flote su hogar; se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, las personas que lo visitan quedan satisfechas por el servicio y por el excelente precio. Carlos  es un hombre emprendedor que quiere salir adelante piensa que quien va cuesta arriba necesita motivación y valor de arriesgarse es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar metales para seguir fabricando estructuras metálicas y satisfacer  la necesidad de sus clientes. Carlos Alberto tiene fe que su arduo trabajo le ayudará a darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is thirty-nine years old.  He lives with his life partner and his three children.  He is engaged in the business of building metal structures and that is what helps him keep his household afloat.  He has gained many customers as his work is of very good quality.  The people who do business with him are satisfied with the service and the excellent price.  Carlos is an enterprising man who wants to get ahead.  He thinks that anyone going uphill needs motivation and the courage to take a risk.  For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will enable him to buy metal and continue making metallic structures to satisfy the needs of his customers.  Carlos Alberto has faith that his hard work will help him provide his family with a better quality of life

loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Амирхон окончил медицинский колледж. По специальности он фармацевт. Он уже 7 лет как занимается торговлей. В основном он занимается торговлей строительных материалов. Он берет кредит для покупки досок, цемента, дверей и окон. Амирхон хочет увеличить свой товар, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Amirkhon lives in the town of Kulob. He is 21 years old and single. He lives together with his parents. He has graduated from an allied health college. He is a pharmacist by education. For about seven years he has been in retail. He mainly sells construction supplies. He is taking out a loan in order to buy wood planks, concrete, doors and windows. Amirkhon would like to expand his stock in order to attract new customers and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy wood planks, concrete, doors and windows

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. 
Junie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Junie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Junie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Sothea, 52 year old, is a primary teacher. Her husband is a farmer and their income is $6 per day. She has four children. Two of her children are studying and one is working in the factory for $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $50 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to pay for her children's school fees for the university. In the future, she hopes to be able to send all of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university fees

loans.name: Rosa Nidia

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene treinta y seis  años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
Rosa acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su casa de habitación, ya que el préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es arena, cemento, piedra y zinc, para la construcción de un cuarto  en su casa de habitación para dos de sus hijos.
Todo esto para que sus hijos puedan desarrollarse mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-six years old. She is a single mother of three children who are of school age. 

Rosa comes to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a home improvement loan. The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone and tin roofing, in order to build a room in her home for her two children. 

All of this is so her children can prosper.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as: sand, cement, stone and tin roofing.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en: Elvina is a 27-year-old trader. Several years ago, her husband died and she was left alone with three children. Alone and without any source of income, she gave up. Then she gathered all her strength in hand because she is responsible for her children.  With the idea brought by her mother, she started selling perfumes and cosmetics from her home. In the countryside, most of the women are housewives. They usually gather in Elvina`s house to try new products and buy something. Now her income generates 200 USD and she has more ambition to grow. For this purpose, she applied for a 1500 AZN loan. Elvina already has a good client history with AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the past seven years, he has been supplying building materials such as sand and ballast to earn a living. He has grown the business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.  He also works as a taxi driver to get more income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. With the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy sand.

loans.use: To buy sand

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 59 years old, married, and has two children.  His mother also lives with him.  He is from the village of Khomuli, Imereti Region, West Georgia. 

Josef is leading the agricultural business of the family. His wife is a teacher in the village. One of Josef’s son’s is painter and works locally. The second son helps Josef with the family farm. They own a small dairy farm with three milk cows. Family members produce cheese and sell it in nearby Kutaisi. They also have a pig and sell piglets. The total average monthly income of the family, including salaries and pension, is 1200 Laris. 

Josef is requesting a loan, which he will use for the construction of a new cattle shed. With a larger cattle shed, he will be able to purchase additional cows and increase the amount of cheese sales, which will improve the family income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle shed construction

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 26 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y muy sociable, es separada, pero vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo de 4 años, a quien quiere mucho y es el motivo para seguir esforzándose. Juntos habitan en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad a la que se dedica Lizbeth, es la venta de productos Unión, productos comestibles como: galletas, pan integral, pionono, mermeladas, entre otros. En este negocio cuenta con la ayuda de una amiga, quien es la encargada de traer estos productos desde la ciudad de Lima para luego ofertarlos y muchas veces venderlos a crédito a empleados de las diferentes empresas de su ciudad. Tiene dos años dedicandose a este trabajo, y lo que le gusta es tener un ingreso económico, con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que actualmente no cuenta con ningún apoyo, siendo padre y madre para su hijo. Durante este tiempo de trabajo, manifiesta que la desventaja que tiene es hay ocasiones que sus clientes no le pagan y eso le perjudica en sus ganancias. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que le han brindado anteriormente y ahora espera nuevamente su apoyo. Con el dinero que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de más productos Unión.
texts.en: Lizbeth is 26 years old. She is a hard-working, dynamic and very sociable woman. She is separated but lives together with her 4-year-old son who she loves very much. He is her motivation for continuing to work hard. They live together in a house which she owns. Lizbeth's business is selling Unión-brand products. These are food products such as cookies, wholewheat bread, piononos, jams, etc. In this business she has the help of a friend who takes care of transporting these products from the city of Lima so that she can sell them (often on credit) to employees in different companies in the city. Lizbeth has been in this line of work for two years and what she likes is having an income which she can use to cover her household expenses as she currently has no support, being both mother and father to her son. She tells us that the downside to her work is that there are times when her customers don't pay her and this affects her profits. This will be Lizbeth's fourth loan from MFP. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunities that she has been given in the past and now she is once again hoping for your support. She will invest the money that she has requested in buying more Unión-brand products.

loans.use: to buy more cookies, wholewheat bread and other products

loans.name: Jua Kali C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jua Kali C Group in Western Kenya! Jesca is the facilitator of Jua Kali C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jesca takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jesca had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jesca was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jesca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jesca will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Jua Kali C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel tiene 33 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El trabaja en el área de bodega del departamento de infra estructura del ingenio san Antonio. El señor quiere mejorar su techo de su casa ya que es de teja y se humedece mucho que gotea y provoca goteras, el motivo del crédito es para la compra de zinc, clavos y perlines. Su mayor sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras para su vivienda pues siempre le ha querido dar a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Señor José Ángel is 33 years old and has two children under the age of 18 in his care.  He works in a warehouse in the infrastructure department in the sugar refinery at San Antonio.  

The Señor wants to improve the roof of his home as it's made of tile and when it rains a lot, it drips and leaks.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase zinc sheets, nails, and supporting beams.

His biggest dream has always been to make improvements to his home, as he has always wanted to give his family the best life possible.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, nails and supporting beams.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Felicita, casada, madre de 4 hijos, es maestra de educación primaria y comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella vive en Quezalguaque municipio de León. Ella inicio su primer negocio haciendo pasteles que ella misma elaboraba, luego tuvo la iniciativa de poner una pequeña pulpería porque los ingresos en su hogar era muy pocos y no le ajustaba, recuerda que comenzó vendiendo 50 libras de frijoles, de azúcar, arroz , después vendía aceite pero con el tiempo fue creciendo y comprando nuevos productos. De esta manera combina su actividad como maestras y comerciante.
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar carne, pollo, aceite, productos de limpieza y que estos productos son los que vende mas rápido y carece mas la población de su zona. Uno de sus planes  introducir a su pulpería cosméticos como shampoo, jabones para cuerpo, cremas, desodorantes y la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Felicita is married and has four children. She is an elementary school teacher and a merchant. She has a small store in her home. She lives in the Quezalguaque municipality of Leon. She started her first business selling cakes that she made herself. She then took the initiative to open a small store because her household's income was quite low. She remembers that she started off selling 50 pounds of beans, sugar, and rice. Later she started selling oil, and with time her business has grown and she has bought new products. Therefore, she works both as a teacher and as a merchant.
She needs this loan for the purchase of meat, chicken, oil, and cleaning products. These are the products that she sells off the most quickly and are most needed by the people in that area. One of her plans is to open a small cosmetics store, selling items such as shampoo, soap, cream, deodorant, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, oil, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 47-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, all of whom are still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family; he works on a daily basis in a local company. 

As for Sahar, she opened her own lingerie shop in 2005. She has her loyal customers and knows very well how to stay in a good relationship with them. Today she is requesting to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie, and may other items. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop to include women's clothes.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise selection of underwear, pajamas, bridal lingerie, and may other items.

loans.name: Elmurot

texts.ru: Элмурот житель района Шахритус. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Элмурот более шести лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кроме того он работает сторожем по ночам. Элмурот берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Elmurot is resident of the Shahritus region. He is 52 years old, married and the father of four children. Elmurot has been engaged in crop growong for more than six years. He grows vegetables for sale. In addition, he works as a night watchmen. Elmurot is taking a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Doris' Group

texts.en:
Matilda sells materials and bags in Takoradi. She is 40 years old, married with one child. She has been running this business for four years now but does not have adequate working capital to support her business. She most of the times buys supplies on credit and makes payments after sales.  

She wants to use the loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes to use part of her earnings to finance her children’s education and also build a peaceful family. 

She belongs to the community group called “humanity.” In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a divorced woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another food stall business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase kitchenware such as cooking pots, plates, and cups. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware such as cooking pots, plates, and cups.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 24 years old and single. For the past two years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rio has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila has been an aspiring entrepreneur for her entire life. 

After some unfavorable circumstance in the department where she was a teacher, Sheila was forced out of her job. She did not see this as a curse though. This allowed her to pursue her own business. 

Sheila founded Paper Doll Boutique and Beauty Bar in 2007 as a clothing store and website where customers could come to buy contemporary, vintage, and street wear clothing for a competitive rate. In the store she also provides personal shopping assistance and styling services. 

She has many goals for this store but none is greater than to expand and help employ members of her community. She especially would like to help employ the youth of her community. She already has one employee and also gets help from her daughter, but she would like to expand further. 

This loan would help her provide the capital that she will need to improve her store and store front to attract more clientele and grow her business.

loans.use: To improve the look of her store front and to improve the general organization of her store.

loans.name: Alex Sandro

texts.en:
Alex Sandro de Lima Menezes, 34, he was born in north Brazil, came to São Paulo seeking better opportunities. 
He´s married, has 3 children, he wants to give a best life and boost  his income generation.
Recently started working with a small garage machine, going to the clients by door to door. He learned this profession with his father.
Alex is keen to purchase a new machine and tools to attend his clients.

loans.use: To buy tools (trunk key) and batteries car

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргис является мастером своего дела.  Она опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет маленьких  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 7 лет назад она начала свой бизнес шитьём женской и детской одежды. Она имеет ателье в центре города. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood and etc. for repairing house

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en:
A kind man by name Behruz lives in a house which has bad condition. His wife is a kind woman who is a housewife. They have 2 clever children of 3 and 2 ages. Behruz runs a transportation business. He drives goods of businessmen from one region to another. Behruz must to repair the roof of his house at first and then he must to repair all rooms. He is asking for a loan of 400 USD to buy building materials to repair his house. 
In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Andriambolamanana John

texts.fr:
Andriambolamanana John est un père de deux enfants dont tous scolarisés. Il a 35 ans. Il fabrique des sambos et tient une petite gargote avec sa femme. L'activité a commencé en 2011. C'est l'activité principale, source de revenu de la famille. Le couple y travaille merveilleusement bien ensemble pour que la famille aie une meilleure condition de vie et les enfants puissent continuer leurs études jusqu'au terme. 
Le foyer habite dans une maison d'héritage, et projette d'avoir sa propre maison dans l'avenir. Il vise fortement la réussite de ses enfants qui n'ont que 5 et 7 ans actuellement. Le chemin est encore loin dit-i, mais il ne se plaint pas le moral est toujours en hausse.
texts.en:
Andriambolamanana John is father to two children who both attend school. He is 35 years old. He makes sambos [beef samosas] and runs a small restaurant with his wife. The business started in 2011. It's their main activity and the family's source of income.

The couple work wonderfully well there together so that their family has a better standard of living and the children can continue their studies until the end. The family lives in an inherited house and plans to have their own house in the future. 

Andriambolamanana John is working towards the success of his children, who are currently 5 and 7 years old. There's still a long way to go, he says, but he does not complain. His moral is always high.

loans.use: to buy one bag of flour, two bags of coal, one tin of edible oil, one second-hand freezer, meat and onions.

loans.name: Dòng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dòng is 26 years old and she is married with 1 child.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 3 years.
Dòng lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Dòng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
In 2014, Dòng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Dòng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the Dòng's group, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Dòng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Reason for Borrowing- Pedro M., who was born in Guayaquil, is a 49-year-old bicycle salesman who has been in business for 3 years. His small enterprise is located in the house that he and his brothers inherited from his father. His bike shop is strategically located because there is not another similar business like this nearby. Working from 9 am until 7 pm, Pedro desperately needs this capital to serve his clients better. He would like lenders to know that he is running a professional bike shop and that he is very responsible.

 

Justificacion de Credito- Pedro M. nació en Guayaquil, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, posee un negocio de venta de repuestos y arreglos de bicicletas desde hace 3 años, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio que fue herencia de sus padres con otros hermanos, la ubicación es estratégica porque no hay ese tipo de negocio en la zona y esta muy bien ubicado, atiende de 9:00AM hasta las 7:00PM., el esta solicitando el crédito para comprar más repuestos y surtir su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes. Se pudo observar que Don Pedro es una persona que conoce del negocio y muy responsable.

loans.use: Pedro is posting on Kiva because he needs capital to buy more bike parts, improve the appearance of his shop, and attend to his clients better.

loans.name: Reimundo

texts.en:
Reimundo has 30 years experience in shellfish sales, a vocation he inherited from his father, who took him along fishing from the time he was 20 years old. He liked fishing very much and once he was married decided to start his own business with his savings and a loan. He bought himself a tricycle and began to ride through the streets of his neighborhood from 5 am till 11 at night in order to sell all of his product.

Reimundo wants the loan in order to invest it in additional seafood products since he currently only sells fish. He currently lacks the capital to invest in additional products.

Reimundo is 59 years old with 2 children, both in school. His wife also works; she's been working doing domestic chores for 7 years. With their earnings they hope to set up a domestic chores business in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Reimundo tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la venta de mariscos, actividad que la adquirió de su señor padre ya que desde la edad de 20 años lo llevaba a pescar. Le gusto mucho y decidió por sus propios medios una vez casado comenzar su negocio propio con el dinero que había ahorrado y una parte que le prestaron. Se compra un triciclo y comienza a recorrer las calles de su barrio en horario de 5 a.m. hasta las 11 de la mañana donde termina de vender todo el producto.

Reimundo desea el crédito para poder invertir en otros productos de mar ya que actualmente solo vende pescado y por falta de capital no invierte en lo otro.

Reimundo tiene 59 años, 2 hijos los cuales estudian, su esposa también trabaja en quehaceres domésticos desde hace 7 años, desea con sus ingresos poder poner un negocio de los mismos en su domicilio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy various types of seafood to sell

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en: Zebi A. has sold office supplies in Chkalovsk for over 13 years. She brings the goods from Istaravshan, which is 90km from her town. Before deciding on what business to start, Zebi looked into her own life. She has three children and knows from her own experience that quality school supplies are necessary but hard to find at a reasonable price. Right now, the school season is almost over, and school bags are available wholesale at a lower price than usual. Zebi wants to buy the bags now so that she can start selling them in July and make a good profit. After doing the math, Zebi thinks that $800 is the right amount to invest.

loans.use: Purchase of school bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Fruit Business

loans.name: Urhobomudia Alfred

texts.en: Urhobomudia Alfred A. is 26 years old, and married with 3 children.  She has 3 years experience in her business.  She sells baby things to those in her community and other neighboring communities.  She is requesting the above funds to enable her to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baby things to sell

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is young entrepreneur, single, and does not have any children. She started her business to help her parents with expenses and to acquire money for the future so that she can have her own house and to provide her future family with a better quality of living. She began her business more than a year ago; taking advantage of the demand that was neglected in that area to start her business which is close to elementary schools, preparatory schools, and businesses. Thanks to the outlook of the business, she is very content with its achievement so far and hopes that the business will continue to grow.

María Guadalupe is seeking a loan for $475 to purchase accessories that are needed, such as computer mouse, microphones, speakers, webcams, etc., to provide better service to her clients. She will return the loan in 6 months. She is very grateful for the support that she will be given to continue with her business so that she can continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es una mujer joven y emprendedora, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, ella inició su negocio para ayudar en la economía familiar a sus padres y para poder hacerse de un patrimonio para el futuro ella también poder formar su propio hogar y poder brindarle a su futura familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella inició su negocio hace mas de un año aprovechando la demanda desatendida de la zona en donde pudo abrir su negocio ya que esta cerca de escuelas, preparatorias y negocios, y gracias a la visión de negocio que tiene, por ello ella esta muy contenta con lo que ha logrado hasta ahora y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

María Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar accesorios que se acaban con el uso, como mouses, micrófonos, auriculares, bocinas, webcams, etc., para tener un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder así con su trabajo continuar con su crecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase asseccories for her business.

loans.name: Jalila

texts.en: Jalila is a 39 year old woman who owns a grocery shop. Jalila is an impressive woman who developed her own business even though she suffers from a hearing impairment. She is a professionally active woman who needs a loan not only to buy enough merchandise for her grocery shop, but also to assist her father in painting his gas station.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Jane Namugalu's Group

texts.en:
Jane N. wants to be a producer of chicks for rearing rather than producing eggs and chickens.  Specifically, Jane wants to be a wholesaler rather than retailing.  With this loan, Jane plans to increase her stock and sell outside her local area.
Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda
BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.
The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.
 In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To sell chicks wholesale

loans.name: Marisela Emma

texts.es:
Doña Marisela Emma was born in the town of El Viejo, Chinandega. For economic reasons she moved to Managua where she lives in the district of La Fuente. She has 2 daughters, 10 and 8 years old. Her husband works as a security guard in a private enterprise. For 6 years Doña Marisela has had a neighborhood store in her house and supports her husband with the family expenses.

She works hard to increase the variety of merchandise at her general store and she is requesting the loan to buy products such as soft drinks and products for home and personal care. Even if her business has been growing she still has a long way to go and therefore she wishes to continue investing in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marisela Emma nació en la ciudad de El Viejo, Chinandega. Por motivos económicos tuvo que emigrar a Managua y vive en el barrio La Fuente. Tiene 2 hijas de 10 y 8 años. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada. Doña Marisela tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años en su casa de habitación y apoya a su marido en los gastos de la casa.

Trabaja arduamente para incrementar los productos de su pulpería es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar productos como gaseosas, productos para el aseo del hogar, productos de higiene personal. A pesar de que su negocio ha crecido todavía le queda un camino largo por recorrer, es por eso que desea seguir invirtiendo para seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and products for home and personal care to increase sales.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano is 56 years old and has worked in agriculture for more than 35 years. He has several plots of land where he grows oranges, pineapples, plantains and coffee. He works all day in the fields taking care of his crops, fertilizing the land and spraying insecticides. When the pineapple harvest is ready, or the coffee, Emiliano hires people to help so he can get his products to the markets of Ticuantepe and Managua. Emiliano needs to purchase specific materials in order to maintain his crops for a successful pineapple harvest in May.

Don Emiliano, tiene 56 años, es un agricultor de más de 35 años de experiencia en trabajos agrícolas, posee unas manzanas de tierra en donde tiene productos como naranjas, mandarinas, piñas, plátanos y café. Todo el día trabaja en el campo cuidando y dándole mantenimiento a los cultivos, él mismo se encarga de fertilizar la tierra, abonarla y rociar insecticidas que puedan dañar el cultivo. Cuando está por salir la cosecha de piña así como los granos de café, el señor contrata personas que le ayuden a agilizar todo el proceso de cosecha y de esta manera logra comercializar sus productos en los mercados de Ticuantepe y Managua. El señor necesita comprar ciertos insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo de piña, temporada de cosecha que sale en mayo.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS AND INSECTICIDES FOR HIS CROPS.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong C., 37 years old, is a dried fish seller earning $10 per day in Chrang Chamres II Commune, Phnom Penh City. Her husband, 40-year-od Mr. Men Sophorn, drives a motorcycle taxi, earning about $5 per day. They have five children living with them, and due to growing family expenses, they need to expand their business to increase income.

They request a loan of $800 to buy fish stock and renovate their home to make it easier to dry the fish. With their expansion, they promise prompt loan repayment. They thank Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To buy fish stock and renovate their home to make it easier to dry fish.

loans.name: Sérgio Isabel

texts.pt:
Sérgio Isabel S., a 25-year-old single man with one child, born in the city of Maputo, was raised by his mother along with his brothers and sisters, and finished 10th grade. In addition to his daughter, he supports seven other people including younger brothers and sisters and nephews. Due to socio-economic problems, he had to leave school and begin working with his brother-in-law as an auto mechanic. He explains that his older brother, a sailor, then encouraged him to become involved with fishing. In 2005, with the help of his friends, he built a rowboat and purchased nets, and thus began his fishing business. He has been in business for more than five years now, and is doing well in spite of the lack of a formal business or other degree. His business currently has two employees.

With a loan of 11,000 MT, he intends to buy nets and other accessories. He was introduced to Hluvuku through friends. With the profits from his business he is able to support his family, pay for his daughter’s studies, and improve working conditions. His plans for the future are to buy a motor for his boat so that he can cover more miles.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Cliente: Sérgio Isabel S. Localização – Bairro Chali, Catembe Actividade:Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 MT Aplicacao: Compra de redes e outros acessórios Início: 25/03/08 Fim: 18/07/09 Sérgio Isabel S., solteiro de 25 anos de idade, tem um filho, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, concluiu a 10ª classe sustenta para além da filha mais 7 pessoas, dentre irmaos mais novos e sobrinhos. Cresceu e viveu com a mãe e seus irmãos, devido a problemas sócio-económicos teve que parar de estudar e passou a ajudar seu cunhado mecânico na reparação de veículos e assim começou a envolver-se cada vez mais com esta arte. Relata que para abraçar a pesca parte do irmão mais velho que é marinheiro que incentivou o a abraçar esta actividade é nisto que em 2005 decide com ajuda dos amigos fazer barco a remo e comprar redes que impulsionaram bastante o trabalho e está nesta área a mais de 5 anos e não tem nenhuma formação e emprega actualmente dois trabalhadores. Com o crédito de 11.000Mt pretende comprar redes e outros acessórios, é assim que procura auxílio na Hluvuku que conhecera atraves de amigos. Com o rendimento consegue sustentar a família, por a crianças a estudar, melhorar as condições de trabalho. A perspectiva futura é comprar um motor para permitir percorrer mais milhas.

loans.use: To buy nets and other accessories

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun S. is 47-years-old. She has been a rice farmer in Kampong Cham since 1988. She does not earn much despite the current high rice prices throughout the developing world. She only earns $1.50 per day. Her husband rents out grinding mills to local farmers for processing their crops. He also climbs palm trees to collect valuable juice at the top of the Khmer Sugar Palm which is used in making Khmer wine and other unique food products. He has been doing this since 1995 but only earns around four dollars per day.

They have six children, five who are single. Besides their own children, they are also responsible for three nieces who reside with them.

They want to invest in a strong healthy cow for plowing their farmland. Right now they must rent a cow every time they need to plow. If their income and thus savings go up, Kun S. hopes to purchase another plot of land to increase their rice production and care for their large family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing fields or rice.

loans.name: Gloria Del Transito

texts.es:
Gloria C. has been running her sewing business for the past 8 years from her home in her native city of Chinandega in the municipality of Somotillo.

She characterizes herself as an excellent seamstress who has been creating all types of dresses, shirts and pants for men, women and children.

Thanks to Ceprodel, through the granting of loans, she has improved the conditions of her business by purchasing sewing machines and showcases, among other things. Today, the purpose for requesting this loan is to purchase a sewing machine and equipment such as threads, needles, fabrics, etc. With this loan, she will benefit as much as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria C. se dedica a su negocio de costurería desde hace 8 años atendiéndolo en su casa de habitación de donde es originaria en la ciudad de Chinandega, en el municipio de Somotillo.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente costurera que se ha dedicado a la elaboración de todo tipo de vestidos, camisas, pantalones, ect. tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Gracias a Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos, ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones del negocio en la compra de las maquinas, vitrinas, etc. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual solicita el crédito es para la compra una maquina de trabajo y de las herramientas de trabajo como lo son hilos, agujas, telas, etc. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and equipment such as threads, needles, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 49-years-old. He is married with one child.

William has been a publisher for the past five years. Publishing has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a press shop where he prints his clients’ orders. He has requested this loan so he can procure additional tools and materials like printers, ink, and paper. This will enable him to expand his operations. William believes this will fetch extra income to improve the welfare of his family.

He belongs to the community group called “Enka ho daa” Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and assist one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To procure additional tools and materials like printers, ink and paper

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame N. Abla est née en 1969. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, il a embrassé le travail de la restauration dans le milieu. Cette activité lui procurer de revenu, elle a mis un accent particulier sur la vente de fufu. Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce à son revenu minimum. Très dévouée et sage dans ses réactions, elle gère bien ses activités et sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son restaurant et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
