Mrs. Abla N. was born in 1969. Not having had the chance to succeed at school, she took up food service in her neighborhood. This business brings in revenue; she has particularly specialized in fufu (white yams pounded into a material somewhat like mashed potatoes).

Married and the mother of 6 children, she manages to cover the needs of her family thanks to her meager earnings from this business. Very devoted and sensible, she manages her business well and is requesting a loan that will allow her to enlarge her little restaurant and thus increase her turnover so that she can better contribute to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding her little restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Mai

texts.vi: Kinh tế còn khó khăn, không có đất rẩy chỉ có 2 sào ruộng làm đủ ăn khỏi mua gạo. Nghề chính của gia đình là chồng làm thuê quanh năm, mấy tháng nắng còn có công việc làm nhưng mùa mưa thì không có việc làm, còn vợ thì bán rau ngoài chợ mỗi ngày lời được 10.000đ nên thu nhập còn thấp đủ chi phí trong gia đình. Cuộc sống còn vất vả, con cho nghĩ học để phụ việc gia đình chỉ còn 1 con nhỏ đi học. chị vay vốn lại lần 2 cua kavi
texts.en:
Financial situations are hard. They have no garden or yard, only two sào (a Vietnamese measurement equaling to 360 square meters) of rice paddies which produces only enough so that she doesn't have to buy rice grains to eat. The family's main source of income is from her husband working as a year-round hired hand. During the sunny months he has job assignments, but not during the rainy months. Whereas, the wife sells produce at the market everyday for a profit of 10,000 VND. Their low income is only enough to cover their living costs. Life is still hard. Their children stay home (do not attend school) to help with family affairs; only the youngest is still attending school. This is their second loan through Kiva.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell at market.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
La señora Gilmer, socia del BC “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, vive en la región y provincia  San Martin, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como plátanos, yuca y limones. El negocio lo desarrolla en su casa, ubicado en el Jr. Miguel Grau Mz H – Lt  2 del AA.HH. Las Brisas de la Molina. Sus clientes en su mayoría son sus vecinos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará plátanos en racimos, limones y yuca, los cuales son los productos que más vende. Compra al por mayor  para luego venderlos al menudeo.  

La señora Gilmer  tiene  33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 03 hijos, quienes la motivan para salir adelante y para poder satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. Su meta es  arreglar su casa para luego implementar un negocio con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gilmer belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas de la Molina II”. She lives in the San Martin province district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She is dedicated to the sale of local foods like plantains, yucca and limes. She does business from her home and the majority of her clients live in her neighborhood. With this loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will buy plantains, limes and yucca. All of these products are in high demand and she buys wholes and sells retail. Gilmer is 33 and lives with her husband and 3 children. They are her motivation to get ahead and satisfy their basic needs. Her goal is to fix up her home so she could latter begin to sell non perishables.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantains, yucca, and limes

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Keramatshah

texts.en:
Keramatshah is a young boy with lots of experience. He is single and lives in Behsood, Nangrahar province. Though he is uneducated, he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 3 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. In order to buy more seeds and some insecticide for his land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 40,000AF ($1,000 US) for 27 months to buy some seeds and insecticide for his land.

Keramatshah is a professional, and from when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the village where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Keramatshah to help with their problems.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and that it is really great, especially for agriculture workers. He wants to continue his partnership and to encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticide for his land.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer E. sells foodstuffs and fruits like oranges, pawpaws, and apples. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Jennifer hopes to expand her fruit business. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more fruits to sell. She says a big thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is a 57 year old mother of eight children. Five of the children are independent and the rest are still in school. She has been a local manufacturer of soap and smoked fish seller for seven years in the market place of Babiani where she lives.

To prepare the local soap, Afia combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production and increase her quantity of smoked fish.

Afia sells at the surrounding villages during their market days. She hopes to raise improved income to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Nhyira, meaning God Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make soap (like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil) and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Ségla

texts.fr: A. ségba habite le quartier de logoté à adjidogomé, il fait du commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier sagbado et ce depuis 2001. il n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande qui est élevée c’est pour celà qu’il demande à WAGES un premier crédit d’un montant de 150000F pour pouvoir satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Il est marié et sa femme est une revendeuse, ils ont 04 enfants à charge
texts.en:
Ségla A. lives in the Logoté neighborhood of Adjidogomé. He deals in foodstuffs in the Sagbado neighborhood, and has done so since 2001. He can no longer satisfy increased demand, and for this reason, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES--a sum of 150000F--in order to be able to suitably meet the needs of his clientele. He is married; his wife is a retailer, and they have four children to support.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assorted foodstuffs

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodocia B. is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She has a small store and meat shop which she runs from her home, a business she has had for more than 12 years. Her main customers are workers in the area, as well as tourists who come to the city to visit the rivers in the area. She also gets customers from the weekend craft expo that is held in the plaza in the city.

At this time, she plans to expand her business for the summer and she is already doing so. She is constructing an area where she will sell fast food and snacks, cold drinks, fruit salads, and ice cream.

Mrs. B. says that she does very good business on the weekends and during the middle of the day during the week. Thanks to this business, she is able to support her family and help her husband to cover the household’s costs.

With the loans she receives from Fundación Paraguaya, she is able to purchase all types of goods for her store, like drinks, meat, milk, oil, rice, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.use: Products for the store such as rice, milk, flour, eggs, beverages, meat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Manrique Zamir

texts.es:
El señor Manrique Velasquez se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios siendo una pequeña pulpería el cual ha logrado surtir gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en su negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un apoyo fundamental para él por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en su negocio directamente y hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le proporcione el otro crédito para la compra de los productos que tanto requiere adquirir.
texts.en:
Mr. Manrique Velasquez sells various products in his small general store which he has stocked thanks to his great efforts in his business. Ceprodel has been a fundamental support for him in providing loans that he has used directly in his business and today he hopes that Ceprodel will grant him another loan to buy the products that he so needs to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She says one in tertiary, while the other is in senior high school.

She works to make some income to support her husband financially, to take care of the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and Ruth is a trader.

Ruth deals in all kinds of textiles – shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. Ruth also treks to villages to sell. Ruth has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. She hopes to improve her living standard and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy bails of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Yimmy

texts.es: Yimmy tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Desde hace un año se dedica a ser transportista con su motocarro, el cubre la ruta interna de su localidad a precios módicos, de esa manera el trabaja todos los días durante todo el día, dándose tiempo sólo para almorzar. Para Yimmy, recorrer las calles es toda una aventura, ya que disfruta del trabajo que realiza y a menudo tiene la oportunidad de entablar amistades con sus clientes. Él ha notado que durante este tiempo de trabajo sus ganancias son estables, pero para más adelante quiere tener un auto para ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a formar parte de su actual banco comunal porque han visto en él, cualidades de un joven emprendedor.  Con el dinero que requerido invertirá en la reparación de su motocarro y compra de llantas nuevas para el mismo.
texts.en:
Yimmy is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. For a year he has been operating motorbike transport, doing a route in his area for modest prices. He works everyday and all day, taking time off just for lunch. For Yimmy, to travel the streets is always an adventure, because of this he enjoys his work. He also has opportunities to be friends with his customers. He has said that, for now, his earnings have been stable, but, in the future, he wants to have a car to offer a taxi service. This is the first time that he is asking for a loan with MFP, he was invited to be a part of his community bank because we have seen good qualities of a young entrepreneur in him. With this money he will invest in repair and buy new tires for his motorbike.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación y compra de llantas para su motacarro

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene 46 años, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales ahora sólo vive con dos D. ellos en su casa propia, quienes la apoyan en sus labores agrícolas. Serena y tranquila como las manzanillas D. sus chacras, posa Florinda posando en una D. sus plantas. Los últimos años le han resultado ser muy rentables, ya que cada viaje que realiza a la ciudad siempre carga sus hierbas para mate y con las ganancias solventa sus pasajes. Pero no sólo se dedica a la siembra D. manzanilla, sino también tiene papa, ollucos y alverjas. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a los cultivos agrícolas, y está muy complacida con esos trabajos, los que le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y darles una vida muy cómoda. Y una vez cosechados sus productos opta por comercializarlos a los mercados D. la ciudad D. Lima, porque le resultan más rentables a comparación D. los mercados D. Tarma. Ahora tiene planes D. implementar un servicio D. Internet para su hija menor que está estudiando en la ciudad, para que D. ese modo pueda solventar sus gastos D. su educación. Florinda es fundadora D. su banco comunal, tiene el cargo D. presidenta, durante varios créditos consecutivos, donD. demostró ser muy responsable en cada uno D. sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos D. papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Florinda is 46 years old, married, with 7 children. Only 2 of her children currently live with her in the house she owns, and they help her with her agricultural work. Calm and serene like the chamomile in her plots, Florinda poses in one of her fields. The past few years have been very profitable, since every time she goes to the city she always takes her maté herbs and with the earnings she covers the cost of the trip. In additional to chamomile, she also grows potatoes, olluco (another root vegetable), and peas. She has done agricultural work her whole life, and she is very happy with this work, which has allowed her to educate her children and proviD. them with a very comfortable life. Once her crops are harvested, she prefers to sell them in markets in Lima, because they are more profitable than the markets in Tarma. She is now planning to start an Internet service for her youngest daughter who is studying in the city, in order to help pay the costs of her education. Florinda is the founder of her communal bank. She is the president, and through various consecutive loans she has shown herself to be very responsible in each of her payments. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato and olluco crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
"I work as a tenant. My parents and I are tilling the land we never own," says Linda L., a 46-year-old farmer. She is still single but soon to be married. She hopes to have an abundant harvest so that her family will have enough food to eat despite the worsening economic crisis. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and certified seeds. The loan will help a lot to improve their yield.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides not only loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, herbicides and certiifed seeds

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (1824071468) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Y. owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Y. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi S., 26, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the flea market-handicrafts business.  She sells to the general public 2 days per week.  She has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  Foketi expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).   SPBD loans are Foketi’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase handicraft supplies.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a car repair shop since 2004 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Ismail is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase an air compressor to develop his work and satisfy the demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei P. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Saleaumua.  She is married and has five school-aged children.  To make a living, Tinei owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Tinei has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Tinei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tinei has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Tinei is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tinei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
Alina tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive con su esposo en el centro poblado Saltur, que pertenece al distrito D. Zaña, ubicado a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace un año tiene una pequeña bodega – tienda que administra junto a su esposo, ambos le dedican todo el tiempo que tienen disponible para ayudarse y salir adelante, su esposo es pensionista y con el dinero D. su pensión compraron sus primeros productos; poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo y ahora ellos desean ampliarlo con la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Por este motivo ella está solcitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio para solventar sus gastos y tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto a sus esposo y, con el paso del tiempo, dejárselo a uno D. sus hijos.

Alina es muy conocida por los vecinos D. su comunidad, los cuales la quieren y estiman mucho ya que es una mujer responsable y muy activa.
texts.en:
Alina is 64 years old and has 7 children. She lives with her husband in the center of the village of Saltur in the district of Zana, located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a small shop for a year that she manages with her husband. Both of them devote all the time that they have to help themselves to get ahead. Her husband is retired and they bought their first products with his pension. Little by little the business grew and now they would like to expand it with the purchase of staples (rice, sugar, oil) and groceries to offer to their customers.

For this reason she is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian Nuevo Soles, U$375) from our institution. She wants to grow the business in order to meet their living expenses and have a better quality of life, and eventually to leave the business to one of their sons.

Alina is very well known by the neighbors in the community, who like and respect her as an active, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staples to sell

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.es:
Marlinda tiene 29 años, es madre de 3 hijos, quienes son estudiantes y vive junto a su esposo que es agricultor. Hace 3 años se dedica al comercio de diversos productos, pero en su mayoría comestibles (abarrotes, bebidas, carnes, verduras, etc.), para ello mandó construir un local en su casa. Marlinda se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, atiende durante todo el día y todos los días, esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos familiares, en especial la educación de sus hijos y lo más satisfactorio para ella, es que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes regulares quienes acuden a su tienda constantemente.
Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo comenta que lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas ordenadas y muy solidarias. Con el dinero que viene solicitando ampliará el local de su negocio para seguir creciendo, además de comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Marlinda is 29 years old and the mother of 3 children who are students. Her husband is a farmer. For the past 3 years, she has dedicated herself to her business of selling diverse products, mostly food (groceries, beverages, meats, vegetables, etc.). She built a room in her house exclusively for her business. Marlena wakes up early in the morning to open her store and manages it the entire day and every day. Her business enables her to provide for the household expenses, especially her children’s education. The work provides her great satisfaction. She has several regular customers who come by her store constantly to shop.

Marlinda is requesting her 9th loan from MFP. The things she likes most about her Communal Bank are that the members work well together and are organized. With the money she requested, she will expand her store so that the business will continue to grow. She will also buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise & expand her store

loans.name: Leout

texts.en: Leout S. is married with a young child. He lives with her wife (pictured) in Battambong Province Province. To make a living, he is employed as a builder at a construction site in the town, typically earning US $2.5 per day. His wife in engaged in the agriculture sector of growing vegetable, earning an income of US $1 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family and the child. Therefore, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to easily commute to work and cut down great expenses on public transportation.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. sells fresh fish at Elmina. Faustina has received senior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Faustina has been selling fresh fish since 2004. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and settlement of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of her fresh fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save up and to build her own house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more of her fresh fish to sell.
